Reviews.Title: “Excellent welcoming base for Rome”
Reviews.Author: IsraelAri
Reviews.Content: We, parents with three kids, had an excellent time at "Hotel Golden" on April 2012. The team, most of them are the family members, does all they can to make your stay perfect. The hotel is very very well located; the rooms are big and comfortable, the breakfast is very good, and the overall experience is fantastic. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in an amazing city!”
Reviews.Author: andn_gbg
Reviews.Content: The hotel is run by the most friendly family you can imagine. They are helpful and caring in everthing they do and always have smiles on their faces. We left happy as never before and felt like friends to these lovely people. The location of the hotel is in my opinion perfect; it's situated close (walking distance) to some of the major sights (i.e. Fontana di Trevi and the Spanish steps) and yet in a quiet and cosy neigbourhood. Rome is a rather busy and noisy city at all hours, but thanks to the great location of the hotel we slept like royalties. The beds were firm and comfortable, which also contributed to good night sleep. You find public transportation really closeby and we can really recommend bus line 80 from Via Boncompagni, which takes you directly into the middle of the city centre (i.e. Via del Corso and Piazza Venezia) in a couple of minutes. We stayed att a superior double room and were more than satisfied. It was clean, spacious enough and had air conditioning. The bathroom was big and fresh with shower cabin. Breakfast was included in our rate and it was delicious with omelette, bacon, sausages, bread, cheese, yoghurt and lovely croissants with chocolate. Great coffe and warm milk as well! The reception has 24 hour service and there are security boxes for safe keeping in the rooms. When we visit Rome next time we will stay at this top of the line hotel again for sure! Big thanks to everyone at Hotel Golden for making our stay better than we could ever imagine!

Reviews.Title: “Definitely recommended!”
Reviews.Author: Larla13
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here and could not have been more pleased. The location is just one block off of Via Veneto where there are many upscale hotels and the area felt very safe. Upon check in (which we were able to do early!), Giuseppe provided us with plenty of incredibly helpful information about the local area, sights, and good restaurants. We had a small double which was definitely cozy but no more than expected. It was very nice, clean, and felt homey. I'm not a huge fan of beds in Europe as I prefer softer mattresses but this one was as good as any. We only heard other guests when they were in the hallway so no problem there. Everyone in the family was very welcoming and eating breakfast was like being at your nonna's house. We will definitely return on our next trip to Rome! Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: DiGiFamily
Reviews.Content: My family of 6 people stayed at the Hotel Golden in the family suite for 4 nights last week. The suite was perfect for us. It is located 1 floor above the main area of the hotel and had 2 huge bedrooms, 1 bathroom, and common area. The staff is very helpful and attentive and made great suggestions for our stay in Rome. When my daughter lost her cell phone on a tour bus, they were happy to help call the company several times and ended up locating the phone! The hotel itself is located 1 minute from Via Veneto and the entrance to Villa Borghese, and about 10 minutes to Trevi Fountain/Spanish Steps. The restaurant San Marco and coffee shop Lotti, around the corner were both excellent recommendations. Thanks Hotel Golden for a great stay!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service, Food and Staff”
Reviews.Author: DCDani
Reviews.Content: We stayed here after an awful hotel stay in Florence and thank goodness we did! Family run business done professionally. Service: They settled us in quickly, provided and reviewed a map with us, made tons of great recommendations and even suggested we visit the Villa Borghese park for bike rides and museums, while there was still light out on our first day. They recommended the best routes to take, how to maximize our time and trips, they were just wonderful. We enjoyed Rome so much and largely due to them! They welcome you in and you can feel that they truly want you to enjoy your time in Rome and at their establishment. You can see the pride in their service. Hotel: Cozy, very clean and in a great location. Its a "budget price" but way above other budget hotels and B&Bs and I'd give a 3.5 star hotel ranking. We went every where from here. There is plenty within walking distance or a short bus ride. Even for the Vatican, Colosseum, Spanish Steps we never took more than 15 mins to get there. Great pizzerias, wine shops and delis all around on the same street. We ate at the La Bruschetta 3x, right below our room window and loved it. Room: Double Room Superior - Clean, large bathroom (in ours), robes, great lighting, large windows to leave open and take in the sights and sounds around us. Bed and pillows were comfy. Bring ear plugs if you are a light sleeper, sound comes in through the door but only is a slight problem if it is quiet in your room and not if you are talking or watching TV. I'm a light sleeper and slept soundly with my ear plugs. Breakfast: Excellent, fresh, plentiful and the variety was outstanding. It completely fueled us for our long days out. Would definitely recommend staying here and we will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great first impression of Rome”
Reviews.Author: SenoraNovi
Reviews.Content: We would definitely recommend this hotel. This was our first, and best hotel of three that we stayed at in Rome. Located a little north in the city, it was easily accessible to many sights. The room we had was a little small for three adults, but typical for Europe. We didn't spend much time in the room so it wasn't an issue. It was clean and quiet. The family who run the hotel were very friendly and helpful. They gave suggestions for restaurants and sights we hadn't originally considered but were very glad we explored (the park just to the north) and told us the city was safe except an area they marked on the map for us. The hotel is in walking distance to many big sights-Trevi fountain and Spanish steps. Breakfast is typical for Italian hotels-rolls, oranges, espresso. They held our luggage for us as we explored the city the next day and called a taxi to take us to our next hotel (for our tour of the country). Enjoy the experience!

Reviews.Title: “Welcoming Family Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bastille45
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a lovely stay at Hotel Golden. We took our two daughters to Rome and were welcomed by the friendly staff to a clean, comfortable family room. Staff very helpful. Great location - beside Villa Borghese - the girls loved hiring rickshaw-style bicycles in the park. Quiet street location but easy walking distance to Spanish Steps and Trevi Fountain. The hotel staff organised a taxi to pick us up from the airport on arrival which was great.

Reviews.Title: “Good value - good location.”
Reviews.Author: Iain A
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights late March. Good location near Villa Borghese. About 10-15 mins walk from Spanish Steps. Characterful building with quaint old fashioned elevator. Hotel occupies the first floor. Staff very helpful, Guiseppe provided map and suggestions of where to go as well as local restaurant recommendations. Room was comfortable, not huge but everything was clean and of a good standard. Some noise from the street during the day but quiet at night. . Breakfast room is quite small but there was always a table free during our stay. Would happily stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great family friendly hotel!”
Reviews.Author: maya p
Reviews.Content: Would definetly recommend this place to all travelers! Its only a short distance from the Barberini/Trevi Fountain rail station, yet located far enough away to escape the hustle and bustle. This is a family run hotel, and they always have someone onsite to assist with anything you may need. We wold absoltely return to stay here again in the future! Bonus: They have a elevator ! Having had to carry our luggage in all our other hotels, this was such a relief!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience”
Reviews.Author: RodneyHobart
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at Hotel Golden. The staff were friendly and helpful, the rooms were clean and comfortable and the location was quiet and within easy walking distance to the main sites. Definitely the best accommodation we've had in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Superb little hotel”
Reviews.Author: EEAAS
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a fantastic stay at Hotel Golden. Very friendly, family run hotel on the first floor of a typical Roman apartment building at the top of Via Veneto and near Villa Borghese. Within walking distance of all the major attractions but on a quiet back road which was nice to return to at the end of a hectic day of sightseeing. Our room was immaculate. The 116 little electric bus runs from the historic centre to the top of Via Veneto and from there it's only a two minute walk to the hotel if you're a bit tired. The family who run the hotel were so helpful and there was an impressive breakfast buffet and free Wi-Fi (you need to ask for the log-in and password). We booked through their website in advance and got a great deal. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant little hotel at a reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: veedubmelb
Reviews.Content: This was a pleasant little family run hotel, which was quite reasonably priced for what and where it was. It's upstairs, and shares the building with other tenants so can take a few minutes pondering to figure out what you're meant to do on arrival (there's a buzzer to push). Nice breakfast, free wi-fi that works well, good location (and staff helpful with guidance on the use of Rome's confusing buses). Happy to stay here again next time.

Reviews.Title: “We love this place”
Reviews.Author: Ashdefranco
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Hotel Golden many times over the years, and we will never stay anywhere else when we are in Rome. Everything is always perfect. It is a family-owned hotel and each person is beyond friendly and accommodating. They always arrange our airport pick up, suggest amazing restaurants (where the locals eat), and go out of their way to ensure we have a wonderful time while we're in Rome. The location is also excellent. You will pay much more for a hotel in Rome and not get anywhere near this level of service. We've recommended Hotel Golden to several friends and they have always had a wonderful experience as well. We HIGHLY recommend this lovely place.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in every respect”
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth S
Reviews.Content: The family made us feel completely at home whether making reservations at good nearby restaurants to explaining how to navigate smoothly through Termini for the train to the airport. We stayed there four nights followed by a longer group tour, which included some five star hotels. We would gladly have traded any of them for a night at the Golden! The location next to the Borghese gardens and its museums is of course a big plus and its proximity to public transport. We enjoyed the homey breakfasts. If we were staying longer, we'd like brighter lights to read by. Whenever we go to Rome, the Golden is the place we'll hope to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great, Affordable, Pleasant, Clean”
Reviews.Author: Marta V
Reviews.Content: Had a lovely stay in the Hotel Golden. Room worked great for our family of 3. Everything we needed at an affordable price. Staff was extremely helpful and friendly. Breakfast was very nice.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful”
Reviews.Author: jawsk
Reviews.Content: I cannot say enough about this hotel! From the begining they were marvelous! They arranged all our aiport transport for us at a very good rate taking a lot of stress off of us. The hotel was in a great location to all the sights in rome and public transport. Great places to eat all around plus they recommended some without us having to ask. The breakfast was an excellent start to our day with a lot of variety, all made by the matriarch of the family! The price was amazing considering it was rome. The room was so comfortable. I really cannot rave enough about this delightful hotel. I will never stay anywhere else when I come to Rome, and neither should you!

Reviews.Title: “The best possible place to stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Seemin S
Reviews.Content: I had chosen this hotel after a rigorous search for affordable hotels in Rome since were on our honeymoon but being students we needed to keep affordability in view. This hotel was certainly the best place I could have chosen to put up for the 4 memorable days in Rome. The people especially Giuseppe were so helpful and friendly that I simply cannot find words to express my gratitude. The breakfast in the mornings was huge and varied so no complaints there. There was a wide assortment of baked goodies and simply put a gourmand's dream. Being a vegetarian, I did not want to eat the omelette with ham in it, so they made fresh omelette for me even though I did not ask for it. They had high speed internet included with the room tariff (which was not the case in our other hotels). The two brothers at the front desk were always ready to patiently explain the travel routes, the best places to eat and the easiest way to plan our day travels. In addition to being extremely patient with our multudes of questions they were also very forthcoming with helpful hints to getting around in Italy. Not only that, they also helped us figure out the cheapest fares to our later trips to Venice and Florence. As a family hotel they had a very personal approach to the hospitality unlike the more professional B&Bs. Being near the Borghese Garden, it was also literally minutes away from most of the sights in Rome. If you get a Roma Pass, you really do not need anything better. The best part of our trip was that they even agreed to keep our extra pices of luggage in storage so we could travel light and reclaim our bags on our last night of stay. The rooms were nice and airy and the beds were very comfortable. I am definitely going to stay here if I ever go back to Rome(which might happen because I threw coins into the Fontana de Trevi) and I would absolutely recommend it to anyone (regardless of if you are on a budget). This was probably the best ever stay in a hotel in my entire life.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay & a good location.”
Reviews.Author: Maria48311
Reviews.Content: Room & bathroom was very large - clean too. Nice breakfast included. Great location. Very nice employees. Helped me pick a tour & booked it for me. Very reasonable mini-bar in the room. Gave me a map and showed me how to get to all the places I wanted to see. They also pointed out where we shouldn't walk at night. Would return & recommend to friends. Only complaint is I couldn't figure out how to use the TV??

Reviews.Title: “Money well spent”
Reviews.Author: Palosaari
Reviews.Content: We (me, my wife, two year old son and mother in law) stayed for five nights i a family suite at The Hotel Golden. Everything was great, i can really recommend the family suites, two large bedrooms, a common room and a bathroom. The location was good and we got some good practical advice from the staff, who was very friendly and helpful. There is allways room foor improvement and in Hotel Golden´s case that would be to make it easier for the guests to move more freely in and out of the hotel. In order to get in to the family suite you first had to buzz the doorbell down in the street then have a staff member from the reception to come and lock up the door to the family suite (this wasn´t necessary with the ordinary rooms). All in all a very pleasant expirience.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and location”
Reviews.Author: Fersoy
Reviews.Content: This is a family owned hotel and it shows. They are always willing to help you with recommendations of restaurants near by, attractions and all kind of info you may request. The hotel is on a first floor of a building so you really don't see from outside. The rooms are clean and big with a tv and refrigerator. Breakfast is included in the rate and is quite good. The location is great near the Via Venetto and very close from an electric bus stop that takes you many tourist attractions for 1 euro. I will defenitely would be back again

Reviews.Title: “Great Place!”
Reviews.Author: supa-dupa-chic
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel for many reasons: people who run the place, food, sleep quality, location etc. Everything was great and met our expectations fully. This trip to Rome was pretty amazing in general. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Sweet budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: moggles10
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel Golden for 3 nights. It was our first trip to Rome and we were on a bit of a budget. This hotel was very good value, as we only paid just over £200 for the whole stay. The hotel is in an old fashioned apartment block, on the first floor. The location is set back from the main, very busy area of the city but it felt very safe and civilised. After lots of sightseeing and battling our way down the Corso, it was a welcome relief to be somewhere a bit quieter. We had a nice welcome from the guy on reception, who gave us a map and showed us the routes to walk to the main sights. I'm sure he would have given us lots more information and help had we needed it, but we already had most things planned. Our room was pretty tiny but they don't pretend otherwise on their website so we knew what to expect. It had all the storage and other facilities we could need, and everything was very clean. A great bonus was the large fridge and good value mini bar. We also had a TV with BBC world, which was a bonus. Breakfast was the only disappointment of our stay. I think the problem is that they put things like pastries and toast out first thing, but that's it,so if you come to breakfast later it's the same round of toast etc. This means we endured quite a lot of rock hard pastry and very chewy cold toast. Coffee and juice were nice, but they're trying to do too much. If they cut down on the large and random selection of cakes, and just did more fresh toast it would be an improvement. The other amusing thing is that breakfast is meant to be served from 07.30, but the day we visited the Vatican so needed to leave early, we were sent back to our room until 8am as breakfast 'wasn't quite ready'! Overall, very sweet place and we really enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “This Hotel is Golden!”
Reviews.Author: Lauren2306
Reviews.Content: When you are planning to visit Rome stay in this hotel. Wonderful rooms, very delicious breakfast en a nice and helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “2 stars ? no, 4 stars !”
Reviews.Author: Jean claude D
Reviews.Content: Nice room, very comfortable, all what you can have in a four stars hotel: TV, minibar,complete equipment in the bathroom, air conditionned, and sherry on the cake: a wonderful buffet breakfast with pastries home made by Mamma ! Excellent service provided by the brothers Giuseppe and Marco at the reception, very helpfull et efficient, always there for anything you may need. You are not in a hotel but at home ! Good location, you can go anywhere by walk, I recommend definitly this hotel for your next trip to Rome

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant and friendly”
Reviews.Author: houstonhog
Reviews.Content: Travelling with 2 children, both 13 years old. Booked one room which was ok - probably double with added bed, but it was comfortable and room also had a wardrobe with plenty of coathangers. Not a great deal of space for laying out clothes but would be fine for two people I think. Arrived in Rome late evening and took a taxi to the hotel. The driver had to look up the hotel location on his satnav and even then he had some difficulty finding the hotel as it is tucked away off the main road, Via Veneto. Price from the airport, Fumiumicino, is 40euros. The driver tried to charge me another 9 euros for 3 pieces of hand luggage but relented quickly when challenged. Take some tranquilisers before you get into the taxi, either that or keep your eyes shut until you get to the hotel because the driving is manic - also crossing the road at a pedestrian crossing means nothing as you will still be fair game for any motorised vehicle in the vicinity of the crossing. To be fair the hotel supplied details of how to get to the hotel and the information was worthwhile. On the way home, because we were leaving at lunchtime and because by then I was more familiar with the city, we took the Terravision Shuttle bus from the station Termini to the airport, costing 6 euros each. The hotel is small, which in my opinion is certainly not a negative, maybe 8-9 rooms. The staff are very friendly and keen to give advice on where to visit, how to get there, where to eat etc and this was very helpful when you first arrive. The entrance to the hotel is slightly unusual because It seems like a residential block with other people, not hotel guests, also living in the building and using the same entrance door. Later in the evening the outer door is locked and you need to buzz reception from outside in order to gain access. The room was fairly large and nicely decorated but the shower room/toilet was quite small and compact. Everything was very clean and the towels were changed daily. It is a family owned hotel and there is attention to detail and any problems, if they should occur, would I am sure, be dealt with promptly by the owners. There is also internet signal available and you need to ask at reception for the code. Breakfast was continental with a selection of meats, rolls, cheese, coffee, juice etc. It was perfectly adequate and a good start to the day. All in all we had a good stay and we walked for miles all around Rome and really enjoyed the city. Now that I am familiar with how to get to the hotel, if I was returning to Rome I would seriously consider returning to the Hotel Golden.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable, beautifully presented continental breakfast every morning”
Reviews.Author: Steventate
Reviews.Content: What a charming hotel, one I will definitely return to. Clean, comfortable, beautifully presented continental breakfast every morning, ideally located, family run which is what gives it it's charm. Family were so friendly and helpful, we were sad to leave Hotel Golden.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: Bimbimbap_and_Donnie
Reviews.Content: Tiny rooms, but the service and quality were great. Very clean and a great location to just about everything.

Reviews.Title: “great for families and runners.”
Reviews.Author: travelswithspot
Reviews.Content: Very friendly family run hotel. Quiet location within walking distance to all sights. Very close to great park for an early morning run in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: RicardoReeves
Reviews.Content: It was the best trip ever. The hotel is perfect, the service, the owner, the staff, the rooms. Everything.....

Reviews.Title: “Very good for the location, great hospitality”
Reviews.Author: jaykeya
Reviews.Content: We were at this hotel in Dec 2012. Family run hotel. Rooms are Ok. Clean and tidy. Bathroom was quite big and had more amenities than I expected. Great breakfast with a lot of variety.Breakfast room was a little too small and would get crowded easily. The brothers of the family who run the hotel helped us a lot in giving advice on reasonable places to eat in Rome and also places to see. Highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Family Run Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TwoTravelers32128
Reviews.Content: We stayed at hotel Golden just before Christmas for two nights. We are a family of four (two teenage daughters) and our room was very spacious! The family that runs the hotel is very nice and very accomodating. Breakfast was excellent, the room was spacious, beds were very comfortable and it was VERY clean. It is in a good location for walking to the sites or catching the subway. I would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Beyond our expectations”
Reviews.Author: Rbprr
Reviews.Content: My husband and 2 teenage daughters just stayed there for 6 nights over Christmas. We stayed in a 2 bedroom suite. The hotel is in a charming apartment building right off Via Venetto. The 2 bedrooms were very big and they each had a big flatscreen TV. We could not believe how much space we had. The master bedroom also had a couch in it. The apartment had a dining room table. I would highly recommend this hotel to families. The hotel is run by 2 brothers and their families. Each one was really nice. I would also recommend this hotel for young people. If my daughters wanted to stay in Rome when they are older, I would feel really comfortable if they stayed in this "family" environment. The only downside was that one night an upstairs neighbor had a party and it was a little noisy. Overall, we had a wonderful experience and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good!”
Reviews.Author: rishabh_bajaj
Reviews.Content: Very Helpful Staff..Changed the rooms on request and gave us very useful tourist information Breakfast very basic..Expected a little more variety.. Convienently close to the metro station..

Reviews.Title: “Family Run, Family Values!”
Reviews.Author: swmkam
Reviews.Content: We had the privilege of an enjoyable 3 night visit to Rome over the Thanksgiving weekend, thanks largely to the kindness, and hospitality of the Lorio family. Hotel Golden is a small, and extremely well kept family run hotel, located just one block off Via Veneto, and across the street form Borghese gardens. The area is busy, but clean and safe, and services such as groceries, cafes', wine shops, restaurants, ATM's, and bus lines are available within one to two blocks. Our room, #111, a "Double Superior" was located on the corner of the building, and had a view of one the few remaining sections of the wall that once surrounded Rome. We had much more space than I had imagined there would be. Our room was large and inviting, and featured a King size bed, two night stands, desk and chair, cable television, an upholstered chair, armoire, and a luggage stand. The bathroom was quite large, and included a large single sink, shower, commode, bidet, table, chair, and hair drier. Heat, which was turned on later in the evening, was more than adequate. It was provided via an over door unit in the bedroom, and a radiant wall unit in the bathroom that also served as a towel rack. Something that is important for those with accessability issues to know, is that this hotel could be somewhat challenging for those in wheel chairs, or having difficulty with steps. You must traverse several half steps between the street and the small iron/wood Otis elevator. The first floor hall is narrow, and some rooms have a step up into the bathroom. Use of the commode in some of the rooms is tight as well. Ours required stepping between the shower and bidet for access. Knowing all of this, I think you will find Hotel Golden to be a comfortable respite from your time spent discovering Rome. We were greeted by Giuseppe upon arrival early in the morning. Our room was not quite ready, but after checking with Mama Teresa we were invited to enjoy a liesurely breakfast while our room was prepared. Afterward Giuseppe went over details about transportation and sites in the city, and offered recommendations for ding and groceries. All of his recommendations were eventually put into play, and every one was spot on in regards to quality, value, and location. Hotel Golden is not for everyone, but if you enjoy the warmth of a home spun atmosphere, a cozy breakfast, friendly and honest people, and meticulous cleanliness you should enjoy the Lorio family, and their "Hotel Golden"!

Reviews.Title: “Family Run Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Caseymjobe
Reviews.Content: We visited February 2009. Just now getting around writing a review. This hotel was perfect. The location, staff, services, food and room were all great. The staff is all family and very knowledgeable on every subject, from where to eat, sightseeing, transportation, shopping and airport details. The dining area is a bit small but worth waiting for the food. Within walking distance to so much and close to the metro. Our room was located directly in front of the check in desk so there was a little noise throughout the night.

Reviews.Title: “What you see is what you get.”
Reviews.Author: KealohiHI
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed in HG from 08/11/2011-16/111/2011. I think this is a more than adequate amount of time to review this hotel. I chose it online because it was very convenient to the Borghese Gardens and Via Veneto. Overall, I would not recommend its location, however. The hotel is compact. The breakfast room is claustrophobic. The assortment of items is good, though. My room was huge! Really. It was much larger than the stereotypical European standard fare. I was traveling solo. It was way more space than I needed. It was clean and well-equipped. Good towels, frigo bar, skype tv. It was not quiet over the first weekend I was there, though. Donʻt get me started. My ear plugs werenʻt enough. I did have a view of a head in a wall. However, when I opened the drapes and then the outside huge shutters to let the light in, upon returning to my room, the shutters would be closed and the drapes drawn. Yikes. It was still daytime. I doubt I will return to Rome. You know; so many places and so little time. I would recommend Hotel Golden, but not for a return visit, I would try a more convenient location and spend the additional amount for that convenience. Now. Marco and Giovanni, who own this hotel, are absolutely wonderful and caring. They went out of their way to make sure that I was taken care of during my stay. They would have taxis waiting for me within minutes. The fare from the hotel to Fiumicino was exactly what I was quoted. Restaurant suggestions were good. Directions were perfect. How would they know that I am directionally challenged? As I said. I would stay at HG again because the family who owns it is so wonderful and nurturing to its guests. I would try another hotel in a more "expensive" area just for convenience.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic rooms and service, location a bit out of the way”
Reviews.Author: edayem
Reviews.Content: Hotel Golden's staff (all family members) were extremely welcoming and helpful. Our room was spacious, comfortable, and clean, although the toilet was crammed practically on top of the shower. Very minor drawback. The breakfasts were the best we had during our B&B trip through Italy with plenty of options for carnivores, omnivores, and vegans. The only complaint we had--while the hotel is in a lovely, ritzy area, it's not close to any decent restaurants for average travelers, and it's quite far from most of the major sites. The nearest Metro stop is also quite a jaunt away. Most of the surrounding restaurants were way out of our price range, or just felt cold and bland, but we found a decent grocery store and wine store close by to supplement our meals in the room. The Pantheon and Spanish Steps are probably the closest landmarks and they required a ~15-20 minute walk up and down some good hills. Just wish this wonderful hotel were a bit more convenient.

Reviews.Title: “great location and service”
Reviews.Author: jark68
Reviews.Content: great little hotel in good location for all the sights, everything in walking distance Family run and very helpful, from arranging airport pick up and drop off to recomending restaurants.nothing too much trouble. Breakfast choice was good and enough to keep us going till late afternoon. Room was small but enough for amount of time spent in room.

Reviews.Title: “Great location,very helpful stuff.”
Reviews.Author: BMM2011
Reviews.Content: I stayed with family on short 3 nights trip.It is definite good value for money.Location is great-10 min walking to Spanish Steps-and Trevi fountain. Room was clean.Very helpful stuff.Breakfast was good,only thing ,the breakfast room is tiny.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely small hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nancy L
Reviews.Content: My mother and I stayed at this hotel in September. It was still very hot in Italy and the AC worked nicely. Our room was actually quite spacious for Rome hotels (I have been too many) and it was clean. Internet was great and skype worked well and it was free. Breakfast was good with more than a croissant for choice. Really liked Guiseppe who organized transport, a great restaurant (only Italians ate there except us). Staff were very friendly. As long as you stay away from the expensive restaurants on Via Veneto its a nice location. Its a hoot to walk by Harry's Bar anyway. We did pick up the bus tour for my mom down a few blocks and that worked out as she had not been to Rome. I have to go Rome again this yr and plan to rebook at Hotel Golden and its genuine, clean, reasonable, good wifi and very very helpful front desk staff.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Letty R
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Golden Rome is truly a wonderul find in Rome. The rooms are a nice size, the beds comfortable and immaculate and the breakfast was fantastic. The hotel is small, only 17 rooms, located near the Villa Borghese, American Embassy and the Via Veneto. It is located within walking distance of many of the most popular tourist attractions in Rome or if necessary it is very close to the subway. This is a family owned establishment and once you are there you are part of the family. They had many recommendations for meals and snacks which were all excellent choices and they all extremely helpful with directions and suggestions for things to see. If you travel to Rome this is a must stay hotel. I know we will be back, I hope soon.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and very helpful”
Reviews.Author: twoboys4me
Reviews.Content: I have to admit when my husband and I walked into our room at the Hotel Golden, we were in a bit of shock and wondered if we were staying at the right place. After we looked around a bit more we were more reassured. The room was very small, but it was immaculate. The bathroom was quite large and was also very, very clean. The bedding and furniture were not new, but were charming and also clean. After a few days, we decided that by staying at the Hotel Golden, we were able to experience a true Italian hotel. The internet was free and reliable. There were several English speaking channels on the TV. The free breakfast buffet was very nice, well stocked and delicious. The best part (and biggest advantage) of this hotel was that the staff. They are at the desk at all hours and are very helpful. They provided a great sense of security for us in a foreign country. I would gladly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant and friendly with a good breakfast”
Reviews.Author: clssdnsc
Reviews.Content: I love Italy and Italian food but let's face it, sometimes the breakfasts can be a bit disappointing. The good news is that the breakfasts at the Golden are a cut above similar establishments in Rome,setting you up nicely for a morning exploring the city. The room was reasonable with an excellent American king size bed and air conditioner, which we didn't need. Our room was on a roman street with occasional normal street noise, no problem for us but others might have an issue. The main negative was the shower which had low flow and lukewarm water. Overall though, it was well located with some nice restaurants, recommended by the friendly manager and reasonable value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: miriamking
Reviews.Content: The rooms were clean and had comfortable beds. The air conditioning was great! The staff was nice--gave us great restaurant suggestions and helped with travel back to the airport at the end of our stay. The location is amazing. We walked just about everywhere. It is located near the Bourghese, American Embassy and Spanish Steps. It was convenient to walk to the Trevi Fountain, Pantheon and other historic locations. If you aren't up to walking, there is a stop for the #10 (red) Hop On Hop Off bus.

Reviews.Title: “Great things come in small packages”
Reviews.Author: LPLee
Reviews.Content: The hotel is small but the service is better than a 5 star hotel. Owners are extremely helpful. The entire hotel is immaculate. The only thing they are missing is a lobby or common area. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: Osenior
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were very impressed with the family/owners. We met both brothers, a sister, mother and daughter-in-law. It was a friendly homey atmosphere and the room was quite sufficient. We had access to their computer and were able to use it at any time, day or night. The location was excellent and we were able to walk to the Termini and to the Spanish steps. It is located on a quiet street with several restaurants in the area. It is close to the Bourghese and the American Embassy. We were able to take a bus from the Termini (if we were tired) which had a stop very close to the hotel. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly people, clean Room , Nice location-hotel Golden rome”
Reviews.Author: backpacker2107
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in a Twin room , it`s a realy nice and clean hotel , hotel staff is friendly but don`t speak much there is free internet use at the reception, at check inn you get a city map. It`s a nice hotel , room is ok nice beds and a small TV and a small fridge, bathroom is nice and shower is so nice. It`s close to VB park and near underground walkway to Metro (near Harry`s bar). I would definitely stay here again. Breakfast in the morning is in charge of a very hard working girl there are some nice sweets and tea and coffee incl. in room price. It`s a calm hotel with sophisticated people, so no drunken youth or rude people.....it`s nice

Reviews.Title: “A darling hotel that lives up to its name”
Reviews.Author: crisnpatlijek
Reviews.Content: If you have already looked at the photos for the Hotel Golden, you probably noticed the one with the rather pitiful view of an abandoned courtyard outside one of the rooms. That was our view. Okay, our little room may not have been the room with “a view,” but we weren’t in Rome to look out the window. In every other way this darling little hotel lived up to it’s name… Golden! Location… The hotel is an easy walk to the Trevi Fountain, the Spanish Steps, and the Borghese Gardens, as well as bus and subway stops. Cleanliness… The Hotel Golden is family owned and operated… and it shows! The room, bath, breakfast and common areas were meticulously clean and inviting. Breakfast… Good coffee, fresh fruit, eggs, meats, cheeses, cereals, pastries and always a little homemade surprise. We left the hotel each morning well-fueled for a day of sight-seeing. Cost… Rome is pricey. Keeping that in mind, the Hotel Golden an excellent value for it‘s location. Marco and Mario gave us a number of hints that saved us cash. One of my favorites was an effective way of dealing with unscrupulous cabbies… clever and effective! When we were ready to leave Mario arranged for a car to take us to the Fiumicino airport (a good distance out from the center of the city) for a very reasonable €40. Friendliness… the family (especially, Marco and Mario) were wonderful. The brothers made reservations… recommended a great little neighborhood restaurant that became one of our favorites in Rome… gave helpful advice about the best time to visit the Vatican museum and avoid the lines… provided tour books for our use… and if that weren’t enough, Mario was even able to identify the bright green birds I noticed at the Borghese Gardens with an entertaining story of their escape from the zoo! If you are looking for a traditional European-style hotel for your stay in Rome… If you want a hotel that reflects pride in family ownership… If you are looking for value in an amazing location… The Hotel Golden is the place you are looking for!

Reviews.Title: “Great experience, no problems.”
Reviews.Author: PWJT
Reviews.Content: Hotel location, service and value fully met my expectations.These were set as a result of "internet research" and I was not disappointed. I would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Taste of Roma”
Reviews.Author: Bernard B
Reviews.Content: We visited Rome in October, 2011 after two weeks of sailing the Amalfi Coast. We stayed 5 nights at the Hotel Golden which we had booked in April on-line. We were not disappointed. The family-owned business is first-class and well located. Guiseppe gave us terrific recommendations for restaurants and travel tips. With his help we were able to take advantage of the "hop-on/hop-off" bus system and other conveniences of local travel. The hotel's rates are very reasonable and the included breakfast, a welcome benefit. We would highly recommend HG and would certainly stay there again if we were in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Non-Smoking Hotel, Great Location, Very Good Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: AndiamoBrian
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights in October 2011. This family run (Marco, Guiseppe, & sister) totally non-smoking hotel is on the 2nd floor of a building near Via Veneto. The hotel is very clean, the bed was comfortable, the breakfast was really outstanding and included an omelet, hard boiled eggs, bacon and ham, cereal, rolls, really good coffee, And the location is good too - easy walking to Trevi Fountain, Spanish steps. Borghese Gardens. One of the few hotels we found that was non-smoking and reasonably priced for expensive Rome. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location Clean and Simple”
Reviews.Author: syriapoet
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights in mid-September, 2011, upon flying into Rome and were delighted to stay the last to 2 nights of our Italy trip before heading to the airport in early October. Hotel Golden is a small family run hotel a block from the busy Via Veneto and 5 minute walk to the Borghese museum, 15 minute walk to the Trevi Fountain and Spanish steps. This is a perfect location at a great price. We definitely will book again when in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: emre_ozaydin
Reviews.Content: Me, my wife and our 16 months old daughter had stayed in Hotel Golden for 2 nights in the last days of September 2011. We stayed in room 107. We choose HG because of the location. It is very close to the car rental agency that we will drop the car off and it is very very close to Rome's probably the most important street Via Veneto. It is also 4-5 mins walk away from the beautiful Villa Borghese park. We did not use any public transport so I have no idea about the convenience for it. It is not so far away from Spanish Steps and Trevi Fountain on walk. One other important thing to mention is the breakfast, it is probably the most beautiful, delicious and varied breakfast we had all around the Europe. Most of the things cooked freshi served fresh. You just eat next to the kitchen. A special thanks for the breakfast. The hotel staff is very helpful and have a very good English. They also arrange hotel to airport transfer with a good value. The thing that I did not like about the hotel is the room. It is really small, we asked them to put a cot in the room but it is not possible to have a cot in the room and to use the wardrobe so we skip wardrobe. Also the curtains are very thick and make the room dark. One morning we did not realize that the sun rised! The room was clean, no problem about it but it was really small. I also find the hotel a bit pricey compared to the hotels I stayed in Tuscany. I recommend Hotel Golden to the visiters who do not spend time in hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and convenient”
Reviews.Author: anna320
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at this hotel and were very pleased. We booked it because we had read favourable reviews and they were right on. We knew the location and were very pleased that we could find affordable accomodations in an upscale area. This is not a place if you are looking for an opulent lobby or amenities like pools and gyms. We were not, as we prefer to stay in more authentic places while travelling in Europe. The security is top notch, our room was spacious and spotless, the breakfast more than ample. Guiseppe is outstanding in helpfulness; the rest of the family may be knowledgeable, as well, but because of Guiseppe's excellent Englsh we felt confident with tips that he freely gave us re tourist attractions, restaurants, transportation. The hotel arranged taxis for us for pickups to/from the airport and train station; their rates were very reasonable. I highly recommend this hotel. Special thanks to Guiseppe who, in my opinion, is the heart of The Golden.

Reviews.Title: “Location, price, and helpfulness outweigh its quirks”
Reviews.Author: Mickirish
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Golden is a very reasonably priced hotel, located one block away from the exclusive Via Veneto. It's very convenient to the Villa Borghese Park. The nearest metro, Barberini, is a 10 minute walk downhill from the hotel. For the uphill return journey, we were fortunate enough to catch the #116 electric minibus that goes along Via Veneto and terminates in the Villa Borghese. The room, a triple, was clean but small, and the air conditioning was powerful. This helped block out the outside noise from a nearby restaurant. The third bed, however, was actually a convertible chair, and it had seen better days as a bed (we never saw it as a chair). Giuseppe was extremely helpful and spoke flawless English. He gave us a very thorough orientation and excellent restaurant recommendations. He could give 5 star hotel concierges lessons in customer service. There was a disconnect, however, between what Giuseppe said and what actually happened when his father was manning the front desk (usually the night shift). Whether this was due to a language barrier I cannot say. The breakfast is also peculiar; there is a great variety of choices, but everything is presented in miniature form: mini omelets, mini french toast, mini pancakes, mini bread, mini cereal bowls--perhaps because the breakfast area is so tiny. We soon learned to pile up our (small) plates as if we only had one pass through the buffet because once the breakfast room was full it was very hard to navigate and jockey for position between the tables and the food display. For location, price, and the advice and helpfulness of Giuseppe, I would not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “I genuinely believe this to be an excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: cindygolden
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a family-run, pride-in-ownership, traditional European hotel in an amazing location, this is it. We began our European/Mediterranean vacation here at the beginning of September based upon the positive reviews on Tripadvisor. We were not disappointed and, in fact, it more than met our expectations. Our room (103) was beautiful and spacious. Everything from the room, its bath (most important), the reception area and the quaint, lovely breakfast room were pristine. Giuseppe and Marco speak excellent English and "tolerated," with a smile, my rudimentary Italian. The location was perfect at the entrance to the Borghese Park and walking distance from the Spanish Steps. The family could not have been more helpful. They arranged for the car to pick us up at Fiumicino, as well as the same car service to take us to the port at Civitavecchia - which was much less than if we had "caught" the cruiseline "bus" who-knows-where! They also offered to arrange for the service to pick us up 13 days later at the port to take us to the airport. The car service was excellent, too. Reliable, on-time, and courteous transportation is certainly a fear for travelers in a foreign country. Our three experiences were very good and Hotel Golden was key to linking us with that company. ALWAYS exactly on time and excellent drivers!!!! The value of the hotel makes it even more unbelievable! Excellent choice! Our genuine thanks to the family for making the beginning days of our vacation so special.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Dianna J
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed in the family suite at the Hotel Golden . This was a nicely run small hotel on the second floor of an older building with a super location just below the Borghese Gardens and Gallery. The suite was large and nicely decorated. This gave our group the space to relax and plan our days. The breakfast was good and the staff were very helpful. We highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful service, central location”
Reviews.Author: MarySP
Reviews.Content: It is a family hotel, with just a few rooms and very considerate and helpful staff. The room was a bit old dated, but it was clean and beds were good, so it wasn't a problem at all. Breakfast was included in the room rate and it was good. Hotel is located close to Via Veneto, in a very central location near Fontana de Trevi and Villa Borghese. The only problem is that it is uphill and not very close to the subway station (about 10 minutes walk), but it wouldn't stop me from staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Conveniently Located Family-Owned Hotel”
Reviews.Author: pickinpr77
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful time at this hotel. Marco, Giussepe and the rest of the family were very helpful. The hotel is very nice, clean and located in a safe and quiet area. The hotel is located close to the Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps and other historic sites.This was our first time in Rome and we really enjoyed our stay at Hotel Golden which included four nights. The breakfast served in the hotel is very good and the wi-fi worked well from the room. We would definitely stay at this hotel again. Eddie & Claudia

Reviews.Title: “Golden was great!”
Reviews.Author: PWJA
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Golden in June, 2011 with a group. They were very accommodating to us all. The rooms were small but very comfortable and the air-conditioning was appreciated. The breakfast was excellent. The hotel is close to the Borghese and was a good location for our sightseeing. We would definitely choose to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value. A gem in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: Shuswap-Girl
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights. The rooms were very nice and large. We hade the family suite. Two bedrooms, a living area and a bathroom. Great when traveling with four people. The family that runs the hotel are very friendly and helpful. And the breakfast in the morning is very nice with a good variety for continental. A great place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Golden Rome”
Reviews.Author: gillian l
Reviews.Content: A wonderful 3 nights at Hotel Golden. From the moment we rang the buzzer on the outside door we were treated with friendliness and efficiency. Guiseppe was extremely helpful adivising about restaurants (we visited all three which were great), detailing walking routes on maps, minding our luggage as we had a late departure back to Australia and organising our cab to the airport. This hotel is in a great location, a ten minute to many attractions. Highly recommended - clean, small, family run.

Reviews.Title: “A gem of a hotel!”
Reviews.Author: deemur1
Reviews.Content: My mum,sister and l stayed at the Hotel Golden for three nights last week in two rooms.My mum and l stayed in a small double room and while it was compact it was comfortable and spotlessly clean.My sister stayed in a single room and she found it a good size.and again very clean. This family run hotel lived up to all the reviews l had read on Tripadvisor.It's in a great location just off the Via Venetto and very near the Villa Borghese which is definately worth a visit.The breakfast room is quite small but we weren't waiting any morning eventhough there was plenty of people staying there.Breakfast is plentiful and a good choice.Definately take the hotels reccomendations for restaurants as we tried two and they were excellent and good value.Already we hope to return to Rome again and if so we will definately be staying at this super hotel again.Just a tip if you are going to Rome book tickets for tourist attractions in advance eg.Vatican Museum, Colliseum etc as you will really save yourself a lot of time!

Reviews.Title: “A peaceful haven in a busy city”
Reviews.Author: AFCBcherries
Reviews.Content: We stayed for five nights at Hotel Golden and were very impressed with the quality and cleanliness of the accommodation. We were greeted by Maria Teresa who gave us a map of the city and marked places we might like to visit. She advised on buying tickets for the Colosseum and also recommended a couple of nearby restaurants, which we tried and were extremely pleased with. Her brothers, Guiseppe and Marco, were always on hand to offer advice when we needed it and were extremely friendly and helpful. The hotel is in a very good position, within easy walking distance of many of the sights, but in a very quiet location with no traffic noise. There was a good choice of food for breakfast. This was served in a rather small room and we had a short wait for a table on two occasions but this wasn't a problem. We stayed in the junior suite, which was large, clean and very comfortable. We would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone visting Rome.

Reviews.Title: “First Class, Friendly and Family Run”
Reviews.Author: cathy_b_62
Reviews.Content: We could not have been happier with our stay at the Hotel Golden. We booked here based on the good reviews and stayed in a family suite. The two brothers spoke very good english and were always friendly, helpful and available. The suite was very nice and we were pleasantly surprised by how spacious it was and how comfortable the beds were. Our kids loved the old cage styled elevator. The grandmother efficiently ran the kitchen ensuring that there was never any shortage of food in any of the dishes. The dining area was comfortable and well sized. The food was good with plenty of choices. The location was excellent with most locations in easy walking distance or access to the metro for more distant attractions like the Vatican. Our hosts were happy to arrange bookings. They even gave us a ride to the train station when we found that a cab large enough for the five of us was not available. This was service well above and beyond anything we have experienced travelling before. We will return!

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money!”
Reviews.Author: maybemoon
Reviews.Content: Clean and comfortable rooms, abundant breakfast buffet. The two brothers were very helpful and gave us lots of tips for nice (and cheap) restaurants nearby and in other parts of Rome. The hotel is situated in a very quiet street, but only a 5 minutes' walk away from Piazza di Spagna. To get to the Villa Borghese Park, which is a great escape from the city noises, you only have to cross 2 streets. I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Old World & Q U A I N T”
Reviews.Author: jacjsc
Reviews.Content: Small famiy owned lodging hardly visitble from street. Brothers Guiseppe & Marco speak great English and are so helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location - great city!!”
Reviews.Author: agatha f
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel to be just perfect - its clean, comfortable, central, very safe and in perfect location for seeing all the sites in Rome. Our rooms were spacious and clean! Breakfast was lovely. Marco and his family made us feel very welcome - they were very helpful with anything we asked them. I would recommend this hotel to everyone and i would definitely recommend Rome!! We would definitely stay at Hotel Golden again :)

Reviews.Title: “very helpfull and friendly Mario”
Reviews.Author: js c
Reviews.Content: They had a room for us only for one night, but they arranged an excellent price in another four star hotel for us. The tenants are very friendly and extremely helpfull ! Thanks again ! They had a room for us only for one night, but they arranged an excellent price in another four star hotel for us. The tenants are very friendly and extremely helpfull ! Thanks again !

Reviews.Title: “A Hidden Roman Treasure”
Reviews.Author: FergyWarwick_NY
Reviews.Content: Finding the Hotel Golden was like finding a hidden Roman treasure. Giuseppe and Marco were caring and friendly and took an interest in making sure we enjoyed our first visit to Roma. They helped with our daily itineraries, dinner reservations, and made sure our room was comfortable for three adults as we traveled with our college age daughter. The days began with a wonderful spread of breakfast treats prepared by Alina and Teresa. Teresa even made sure that we had coffee the morning of our departure as we had to leave very early in the morning. The hotel was perfectly located between the beautiful and relaxing Villa Borghese and the exciting Via Veneto. It was a wonderful, and quiet respite for the busy tourist. The Loria family made us feel a part of their family and we look forward to a return to Hotel Golden in the future.

Reviews.Title: “" Hidden gem...warm and nurturing"”
Reviews.Author: Brenda Z
Reviews.Content: Golden is special.. Family enterprise and it shows.. Caring and responsive to all travel querries..Lovely breakfast , clean rooms ...travel library available for tourists.. Neighborhood very convenient to everything, especially Via Veneto.. Entrance captures the feelings of entering a lovely roman courtyard with wought iron lift.. We loved our stay and hope that you get to experience this lovely hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel choice near Villa Borghese, Via Veneto, and more”
Reviews.Author: Paul M
Reviews.Content: We (two adults, two teens) had a wonderful stay here and would definitely return on future trips. We stayed in a family suite which was very spacious, comfortable and well appointed. The hotel is family-run, clean, very quiet, and near many good neighborhood cafes and restaurants. The location is excellent, near Spagna and Barberini metro stops, buses, Villa Borghese, Via Veneto, etc. Beyond all this, what differentiates the hotel is the hospitality and great service offered by the host family. From very good breakfasts to sightseeing recommendations to arranging very early transportation to the airport, we had the impression our hosts' foremost concern was our safety, comfort, and enjoyment of our stay at their hotel and in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay at hotel golden”
Reviews.Author: MarzMelissa
Reviews.Content: Clean spacious room. Friendly service from all at this family run business.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful family run hotel”
Reviews.Author: silvergirl267
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I have just returned from staying at this wonderful hotel for a week and we did not want to return home. It is situated just off Via Veneto, within easy walking distance of the Villa Borghese, Spanish Steps and the Trevi fountain. The family who own this hotel are so helpful and friendly! They gave us many tips on how to make the most of our holiday. The room and bathroom were both of a good size, unlike a lot of European hotels. We highly recommend this hotel and thank Giuseppe and his family very much for helping us to have a wonderful holiday! Grazi mille!

Reviews.Title: “Meet the Roman family you never knew you had!”
Reviews.Author: CindySanti10
Reviews.Content: Rome, the Eternal City, is like New York - it never sleeps. Finding a quiet haven in Rome is miraculous. From a previous visit we knew the Villa Borghese area could be relatively peaceful. Based largely on TripAdvisor reviews, we chose to stay in April at the Hotel Golden. This is not a place to see-and-be-seen, nor a high-style boutique hotel sporting the latest trendy decor. But this is the place to stay with the Roman family you never knew you had! The hotel occupies a residential building on a quiet street less than a block from Villa Borghese Park – a godsend for families with children because there is plenty of room to run around in the park. We arrived via the car service hired through the hotel – an easy, stress-free option. The small reception area and tiny breakfast room are on the 2nd floor – there is no lobby. We were upgraded to the family suite, and while two of the extra bedrooms remained locked (and unseen), the space we had available was enormous, particularly by European standards - a large, high-ceilinged bedroom (king bed + twin day bed), a dining room, bathroom and large vestibule. We were wallowing in space! It’s difficult to overstate the care with which the family caters to their guests. We overslept the first morning, missing the open hours in the breakfast room. Without asking, Mama whipped up coffee and breakfast for us. On another day, when we planned to dine elsewhere for breakfast, they held the kitchen open until we appeared because they thought we’d overslept again. Such attention is unheard of in a typical hotel! Being in the family suite on the 3rd floor required a family member to escort us to unlock the outer door, so someone was always on hand with a smile and concern that our day was a happy one. Kudos to the Loria family for a charming, well-run inn! We absolutely recommend the Hotel Golden to anyone looking to be treasured by family in Rome. My photos are on my blog at: http://exuberanthome.com/travel-tuesday-the-hotel-golden-in-rome

Reviews.Title: “Make a great decision and stay here!”
Reviews.Author: issylh
Reviews.Content: We had only 3 days in Rome as part of a longer trip and the Hotel Golden was a great find. Upon arrival, it seemed we weren't in the best location, you had to ring a bell to be let in, but my fears immediately disappeared upon entry. It is almost right on Via Venato, the "rodeo drive" of Rome, a is walkable to Borghese Galleries, Trevi Fountain. We did take a taxi to the collessum as that was a bit farther and the weather was hot. The family is absolutely wonderful in helping you maximize your time and plenty of suggestions for local restaurants, etc. The room was lovely and such a great value. We arrived by train and their tips on what to pay the taxis to the hotels that they included in our confirmation saved us about 15 euros! In the evenings, we had cocktails along via venato and watched the people walk by; then, 3 minutes walk to the hotel for the evening. Felt safe at all times.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: fairacres2
Reviews.Content: The Loria family runs a quality hotel. Giuseppe and all provide a clean, quiet, and comfortable stay near the Villa Borghese. The rooms, though on the small side, are clean and well maintained. If you need recommendations for restaurants, the staff does not steer you wrong. We ate well and affordably based upon their recommendations. Recommendations on transportation and anything we asked were answered politely and thoroughly. This is a quiet gem of a hotel. We will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Place to Stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: hbh2011
Reviews.Content: We loved the Hotel Golden and the family took such good care of us. This was a terrific value. Giuseppe and Marco had wonderful recommendations for us and were able to provide access to any services (airport pick-up, tours, etc) that a large hotel could. Families, book ahead so you can get the family suite, which is spacious, modern and has great air conditioning. Breakfast was delicious.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful hotel with an excellent location and very helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: GregBaz
Reviews.Content: There is no reason to stay anywhere else in Rome. The people where very friendly and always willing to help with the little things that made our stay a real pleasure. The rooms were a very pleasant surprise. The hotel is situated within easy walking distance of all the main sites in Rome, including the Colosseum if one is prepared to spend a half hour or so walking through the city which, for me in any event is always the best way to experience new environments.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful family suite with amazing hosts”
Reviews.Author: ci2z_4
Reviews.Content: This hotel was recommended to me by a friend and I booked it after reading a lot of reviews. We traveled with a family of 4 and we booked the family suite which was so much more than we expected. It’s definitely not your typical hotel experience, You have to buzz the door to get into a building, and there is just a small reception area, no lobby, and a small breakfast room. It is in an older building as well and the hotel occupies 3 floors of a larger apartment building. We were a little hesitant at first but once we got into our actual suite, it was amazing. The rooms were HUGE with beautiful 12 foot high ceilings. The furniture and bathroom were all clean and looked very new. It was a great deal for us rather than booking 2 separate hotel rooms .Breakfast was adequate and cozy, although the room is a little small but it was fine. Most of all, Marco and Giuseppe and their parents were so extremely nice, friendly and helpful. They showed us how to plan our day around Rome, including what metro stops to take, or what route to walk, and best of all, gave us excellent recommendations for restaurants that served local Roma food, cute little trattorias owned by local mom and pop shops. It was like living in our own apartment in Rome but with a very helpful neighbor right downstairs. Location was good, about 15 minute walk to Trevi Fountain and Spanish Steps. It was a 10 minute walk to the nearest metro. It was close to the park and on a very quiet street. Overall, I would highly recommend this hotel – very reasonably priced, beautiful hotel room, good location, and the most gracious hosts.

Reviews.Title: “Felt like home with this wonderful family”
Reviews.Author: mona0711
Reviews.Content: This is a great family run business secure and so friendly. Alitalia lost my brother in laws suitcase and they OFFERED to speal to the airlines and go through the hasssle that often comes with lost luggage up to the very day we departed. It's a great family run hotel and they make you feel like there family. Great breakfast cooked by the mom and the hpsitality in general was like none I have ever xperienced anywhere! Thank you so much for EVERYTHING!

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Stay in Roma!”
Reviews.Author: Travelerot
Reviews.Content: A Wonderful family owned hotel in a great location, nice area (Via Espana) close to the Metro and walking distance to the Spanish Steps and other sites. The staff was very knowledgeabe, helpful and always willing to help with directions. Every morning a very nice complementary continental breakfast was offered. We always felt very secure during our stay. We would most definetly recommend the Hotel Golden in Rome. FELT LIKE HOME!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in the middle of everything”
Reviews.Author: skflowers
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the family suite from July 13-17. It was perfect for our needs with two huge, beautifully decorated bedrooms, a very large common area and 1 modern, very clean bathroom - with LED shower lights that changed colors! We traveled with our two teenage nieces who loved the shower lights and thought it was cool. Considering the location, the hotel is reasonable priced for Rome. It is well maintained, very clean and across the street from Villa Bourghese Park, 2 blocks away from a major shopping area/street and a 5 minute walk to the Spanish Steps. Restaurants galore. The hotel itself is located on the 1st floor of an apartment-type building and has a standard European lift for luggage. It is owned and run by one family - siblings: Marco, Maria Theresa and Guiseppe were very helpful and accommodating and took care of reception and administrative needs. Their mom was always busy making and keeping the complimentary breakfast fully stocked and available for guests coming and going from the dining area. The breakfast is your typical light European breakfast - cereals, hard-boiled eggs, ham and mortadella and various breads from 7:30am till 10:00am. The dining area is small and a bit tight so finding a seat and making your way to the buffet table area is tricky when more than 8 people are there at once. The hotel does provide free Wi-Fi access, but only provided us with one account. Sufficient with most guests, but not ideal with two teenage girls who are constantly on their iPhones and laptops updating their friends through Facebook, IM'g or skype'ing. The hotel also arranged roundtrip car service from/to the airport for us at 70 euros each way. Car service was prompt, drivers professional and competent both directions. Overall, we were very pleased with this hotel and would stay here again should we visit Rome again.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite hotel”
Reviews.Author: treberb
Reviews.Content: Hotel Golden was our favorite hotel during our 2 1/2 week trip through Italy. We were a mother/daughter team, and Rome was the first city on our trip. Thanks to the Loria family (hotel owners) they answered all of our questions on how to get around Rome using the bus, metro, how to get tickets, and most of all where to get the best gelato in all of Rome! The hotel only has 12 rooms, adding to a cozy feeling. Everything was neat and clean, and the area was very quiet allowing for great sleeping at night. We heard many tourists staying at other hotels complaining about lack of sleep due to noisy streets, so we truly appreciated ours.

Reviews.Title: “A family with class”
Reviews.Author: vestpocket
Reviews.Content: Hotel Golden is in a beautiful, safe, location within walking distance of many of Rome's attractions and close to several lovely restaurants. It is almost impossible to get lost because you can always find the Borgese Gardens on your map and they are just below one of the gates. Run by a family, Hotel Golden provides the utmost in professional care and attention to detail. They help you with maps, find taxi's, give good tips on restaurants, and are never out of sorts. The price is certainly good and the breakfast is outstanding. Nice and quiet at night, and cool in Rome's July heat.

Reviews.Title: “Great inexpensive hotel near Via Veneto and Borghese Gardens”
Reviews.Author: yakity_3
Reviews.Content: We stayed a week in this incredibly clean, small family run hotel in a historical mansion. Breakfast was included and English spoken. All requests both before and during our stay were answered in detail, including a driver to pick us up at the airport, maps and great directions to all of the sights. We dined on wonderful local food in their recommended family restaurants and followed breezy shaded paths and rode buses through Rome while the crowds milled in the 80-90 degree weather just a block away. Located in a quiet street near to buses and taxi stands with local bakery/gelato and restaraunts on one side and part of the Borghese garden on the other.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!!!”
Reviews.Author: jensager8
Reviews.Content: We would stay here again without a second thought. This family run hotel was lovely and the family so accomidating. A nice quite place to stay in the heart of Rome. Great breakfast and coffee. Walking distance to historical sites and Via Veneto. A truely wonderful family run hotel with a great staff!

Reviews.Title: “We loved this hotel! We'll definitely be back!”
Reviews.Author: mweis1969
Reviews.Content: This was the perfect set-up for a family. Like a little apartment, the kids had a spacious room and the parents had great room of our own. There was a nice dinning area for spreading out our daily maps, snacks and activities. Above all else, it was immaculately clean! The staff was wonderful and very helpful. A great way to stay when in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value near Villa Borghese and Via Veneto”
Reviews.Author: fritkis
Reviews.Content: We found the room spacious and clean, the bathroom modern and large. The breakfast room is uncomfortably tiny and quiet, but the food selection was pretty good. The family members we encountered who run the hotel were helpful and warm to us. Although the location is quite a distance from some Rome sites, we had planned to visit Gallery Borghese as one of our main stops so that was a lovely short stroll though the park. Being off of any main street meant we could open the windows and it was not too noisy. Air conditioning works great.

Reviews.Title: “Our home away from home when in Italy”
Reviews.Author: precine
Reviews.Content: Return stay (3rd) and our 25th wedding anniversary.Warm and friendly atmosphere,and staff,very comfortable rooms and amenties.Breakfast selection of fruits,juices,pastries, meats cheesesand hot beverage nicely presented. Have recommended to many family and friends from Canada,everyone pleased with their stay. Walking distance to many attractions and restaurants. Truly " Five Stars" in our books!

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and we will stay there when he return”
Reviews.Author: GRM5425
Reviews.Content: This was a hidden jewel resulting in an excellent experience. This hotel is family owned and operated. They were very friendly and accommodating. The room was good, the breakfast was excellent and the location was great. The subway entrance was about one block from the hotel and there were good restaurants near by. My son and daughter-in-law overlapped out trip and when they arrived at their hotel, which was Hotel Memphis, their room was not available because the hotel had overbooked. Hotel Memphis booked my son in a dump. My son called me looking for a room and the family at Hotel Golden felt bad so they rent a newly remodeled suite with three bedrooms to him for the cost of a single room. My daughter-in-law left her I Phone in the room and they sent it to her in the U.S. I will stay in this hotel when I return to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: harold38
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the family run Golden Hotel. Guiseppe and Marco were very helpful with any information we needed and their mother's pastries for breakfast were delicious.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel good for city break.”
Reviews.Author: seversitral
Reviews.Content: Hotel Golden where I stayed with a nice location , just fews minutes from city center. Room a little small but very comfortable for 1 or 2 persons, also, l like the mattress,very cool and thin, well-decor as well. This was a so romantic city with too many things to to, discover and have some funs , just taking out a little time for drink around the city center, it very easy for you to see a pretty girls, too many clothing shop , jewelry shop as well. I have to mention about a very weird restaurant where once a guest coming in, he has to received some impolite postures from waiters or waitress, so amazing restaurant at a romantic city.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet location off the beaten path; would stay again”
Reviews.Author: vancouverik
Reviews.Content: Hotel Golden is located about 10 mins walking from the Metro, between the Spanish Steps and the Trevi Fountain, just outside the Borghese Gardens. The front desk is manned 24 hrs a day by members of the family that owns the hotel. They are helpful in orienting visitors and suggesting an itinerary for their length of stay, as well as recommending restaurants and modes of transportation. There is also a continental breakfast served daily - simple, but fuels you for the day ahead. We stayed in two double small rooms at different parts of our trip - which were very small, but had all the amenities for a comfortable night's stay. The bathrooms have an enclosed shower, bidet, sink and toilet. Not all the rooms have a fireproof safe attached to a wall, and not all the rooms look out onto a street, so ask about those items if they are important to you. The decor is pretty traditional old-school Italian, and could use some updating, but this can be said of many hotels in Europe in general. One wifi account was provided for the room for free, and the TV (albeit tiny) had satellite TV. Overall, I would say the hotel is good value for money in Rome, and keeps you away from the loud touristy areas while still being very accessible to discovering Rome. We would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful family-run hotel with great location”
Reviews.Author: FryitzLynn
Reviews.Content: Wonderful, comfortable feeling at this family run small hotel not far from the Spanish Steps. The rooms are clean and comfortable and the breakfast is excellent. They provided great tips for wonderful small restaurants in the area and it is in a perfect location for walks throughout Rome. Quaint and cozy, yet still has nice bathrooms and plenty of room. We would certainly go back!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable room at a good value in Rome.”
Reviews.Author: hajile99
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Golden in Rome for three nights with my partner. The hotel was located on the second floor of what appeared to be an office building. The family that runs the hotel is always there is you need assistance and very friendly. The room was small, but pretty typical by European standards. The decor seems a bit dated, but overall, the room was very comfortable during our stay. The 4-piece bathroom was actually very roomy for a European hotel room. The shower was small, but the water was always hot and very soothing. The room was always kept clean and organized by the staff. Our room overlooked Via Sardegna which did provide some noise issues during the day, but the area did seem very quiet at night. Breakfast is provided in a small dining area. The breakfast was adequate with yogurt, cereal, breads and cheeses. It wasn't the best breakfast in the world, but for a free meal, it was definitely appreciated. Free wi-fi is provided by the hotel, which was extremely helpful in planning our days in Rome. I highly recommend a pizza place just down the street on Via Marche. Take a right out of the hotel and it's a few blocks down on your left. I don't recall a name, but the pizza was delicious! I also recommend a nearby gelato shop down on Via Sardegna called Caffe Lotti. Their gelato is absolutely to die for and the lady running the shop was very friendly and welcoming. For transportation, the Spagna metro station is technically the closest, however I would recommend the Barberini station instead. It's a little further, but the hill is a bit more gradual up to the hotel than from Spagna, which starts downhill and then takes you back uphill. The Villa Borghese is just steps away from the hotel and a great place to just walk around and explore. You can rent bicycles, go to a movie, visit a museum all in this little area. Definitely a worthwhile place to visit.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely experience”
Reviews.Author: DFD57
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a week at Hotel Golden,a small independent family run hotel in Rome.Several of the Family spoke very good English and were delighted to offer help and advice on a variety of subjects both before and during our stay. Our room was comfortable and immaculately clean and breakfast was an excellent variety.There were many good restaurants within walking distance and a taxi rank around the corner.
