"My Star Tip" is that it is vital in some cases and preferable in the rest to book well in advance for some galleries.Some can be booked via E Mail and Giuseppe kindly helped us with one where that was not possible.We felt that we were amongst friends and the holiday truly was a lovely experience of living in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Golden was excellent!”
Reviews.Author: Mr_and_Mrs_Early_50s
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were very pleased with our six-night stay at the Hotel Golden the last week of June 2011. The hotel is situated in a nice location, one block away from both Via Veneto and Villa Borghese. There is a metro station maybe three blocks away, but we found that the bus system was the best way to get around and the bus stops were even closer to the hotel. We had booked a room with a double bed but were treated to an upgrade with a larger room which was very spacious (especially by European standards) and comfortable. The facilities were immaculate. The complimentary breakfasts were delicious and there was quite a selection to choose from every morning - the breakfasts in the hotel also allowed us to get a head start on our sightseeing each day. Guiseppe and Marco were very welcoming, making us feel right at home. They were helpful in showing us local restaurants which were very good, along with the various bus routes to use in getting to locations in the city. The Spanish Steps and Trevi Fountain were both about 10 minute walks away, and a section of the Aurelian wall is half a block from the hotel entrance. Having read alot of the other reviews on Trip Advisor (this is how we found Hotel Golden when we were looking for a reasonably priced Rome Hotel), we can only add our five stars and say that we were totally pleased with every aspect of our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, good location”
Reviews.Author: Stuman1
Reviews.Content: Very pleasant hotel. Reasonable rate. Friendly and very helpful staff..

Reviews.Title: “a nice respite from the bustle of Rome”
Reviews.Author: avidwalker3
Reviews.Content: stayed in the family suite, which was large, modern and very quiet. It worked for perfectly for a family of 5 (3 teenagers); the suite was kept very clean and cool (definitely need AC); breakfast room is small; breakfast is adequate, although they don't serve espresso; front desk staff was always present and while not outgoing, was helpful

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: LaPV
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel for 2 nights with my son. I have nothing to complain about. The room was well decorated and comfortable, location is great, breakfast quite good and on the top of it all is the staff (including the owners), very helpfully and always polite. I also recommend the transport they offer to and from the airport, cheaper and safer than a normal taxi.

Reviews.Title: “Just as great the second time around”
Reviews.Author: Dorchester
Reviews.Content: My wife, my mother, and I spent four nights at Hotel Golden in June of 2011, after my wife and I had such a pleasant stay there for five nights in 2008. Once again we were delighted with this hotel, and the generous and helpful family that runs it. Guiseppe and Marco provided invaluable recommendations for restaurants, and they were able to obtain an excellent rate for our return taxi ride to the airport. Hotel Golden is very comfortable, clean, attractive, and offers a wonderful buffet breakfast. The neighborhood is extremely safe and enjoyable, offering an array of fine restaurants, impressive architecture, the Via Veneto, and the Villa Borghese. It is clear that the family does a great job maintaining the hotel's fine standards. Therefore we highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “They Welcomed our Family”
Reviews.Author: LiraFamily
Reviews.Content: After a long day in Rome, we were welcomed at the Golden Hotel and found it to be clean, spacious, air conditioned, with flat screen TVs, modern bathroom, rain shower head and plenty of towels ! The large table in the central area of the hotel room provided a great place for the kids to play games and spread out our maps to plan for the next days travels. Giuseppe and Family provided directions to a local restaurant within walking distance (where the local folks eat) and we enjoyed a great regional meal at a very reasonable price. I recommend the Golden Hotel because of its quiet location, large clean rooms and friendly staff. The kids enjoyed breakfast in the morning which is included in the room price. Don't be put off by the exterior of the building - its not fancy and there is no pool or bar in this hotel - but for a great price value, comfortable spacious rooms and comforts of home, Golden Hotel is a perfect for families or couples alike. We are pleased to provide this recommendation. The Lira Family USA

Reviews.Title: “Very satisfied and would return”
Reviews.Author: SekaiViaggista
Reviews.Content: I can only concur with the very positive reviews of Hotel Golden on Trip Advisor. I stayed for 2 nights at the end of a busy two week trip around northern Italy and adjoining countries. Although Rome is a tiring place solo and with luggage (and perhaps even without), the hotel provided a haven from the noise and need to search for clean amenities, with a high level of family style personal service that I very much appreciated. It is small , but my room was immaculate, recently refurbished and well set up, providing more amenities than I found in some more expensive hotels. I loved the location, close to the Villa Borghese, Pincio, Palazzo Barberini, Via Veneto, etc, and especially appreciated the overview given to me on check in with a highlighted map showing how to get to the main sights and areas. It was an easy to follow one pager for getting around my whole visit. I also discovered good artisanal gelato at a pasticceria down the Via Marche from the hotel (Bisnonna Carla, #62), and really enjoyed a modern Italian restaurant close by called Lo Stil Novo (Via Sicilia, 66/B). I think this is a real gem in the relatively inexpensive hotel category (by Rome standards, at least). I should note that my room only had an internal building aspect from frosted glass windows, so if you are looking for Rome with a view or much natural light, you would need to check if there are any rooms to suit you.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and we will certainly be back”
Reviews.Author: Carine097
Reviews.Content: Hotel Golden is well localized in the center of Rome, the reception is perfect and you feel at home, i surely recommend it to any person who wants to visit Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service!”
Reviews.Author: hamalua
Reviews.Content: Wasn't sure what to expect of the hotel but based on reviews here, decided to go with it due to lack of other choices. Was very pleasantly surprised with the level of service we received. Run by 2 brothers and a sister, this hotel takes very good care of its guests. Our room was a quad room and was the typical cramped European hotel. 1 double bed and a double sofabed. There was not much room to move about. The bathroom was pleasantly large by European standards complete with bidet. Wished the shower stall was bigger since there was room for a larger one. However, I can overlook all this because of the excellent service. They had very good restaurant recommendations nearby and made sure we will taken care of from the time of check-in to the time we boarded our taxi to the train station. Wanted to book for our last night before we leave Italy but they were fully booked.

Reviews.Title: “Great time, loved our family suite!”
Reviews.Author: kbuffing
Reviews.Content: The hotel is family run, beautiful, clean and right in the city!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, quiet, Location!”
Reviews.Author: RTandRT
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a building and up one flight, don't be put off by having to ring the bell for entry. Family owned with evident pride. A bit small, but not uncomfortabky so. Rooms close by a major artery, but extremely well soundproofed. Breakfast room i small but adequate, Momma serves a well prepared and tasty spread. We had to catch a very early plane, they offered to package a meal for us! Really great location, steps from Villa Borgese and park, close by excellent shopping, easy access to attractions. A comfortable, welcoming, and clean hotel well worth considering if you are staying in this upscale area.

Reviews.Title: “We loved the Hotel Golden; wonderful hotel in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: Renie3875
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with our holiday at the Hotel Golden in Rome. The friendliness & helpfulness of all the staff were beyond words. Location was fabulous: on a quiet street near Villa Borghese, the rooms were very clean and well-appointed, and the breakfast was delicious and offered an excellence selection. Our stay with Hotel Golden made the trip so much more wonderful. We would highly recommend it to other visitors who are looking for a reasonably price hotel with a convenient location, helpful staff and lovely rooms.

Reviews.Title: “A great family-run hotel in the heart of Rome”
Reviews.Author: tomstru
Reviews.Content: We spent a week at the Hotel Golden in May, 2011. This small hotel, occupying two floors of a building just a block off of Via Veneto and across the street from the Borghese Gardens, was a complete and total delight. It is run by the Loria family, and a family member is always at the front desk to handle any special needs or requests. Everyone was anxious to answer our questions and give us advice to make our stay in Rome more pleasant. We arrived in Rome by ship and the hotel arranged for a car service to pick us up at the port and take us directly to the hotel. Although we arrived in the morning, one of the two rooms we had reserved was available so we could store our luggage and freshen up before heading out for the day. They took great care to provide us with maps and directions to the highlights of Rome, many of which, like the Spanish Steps and the Trevi Fountain, were within easy walking distance from the hotel. 'We had booked a 'standard room', but we were told upon checking in that we had been upgraded to 'superior'. Our rooms, while not large by American standards, were very comfortable and spotlessly clean, with all the amenities we could ask for, including free wi-fi and an ample breakfast. Since the hotel lobby and guest rooms are on the second floor (called the first floor in Europe), a flight of stairs or a creaky old elevator must be used to reach them. This was not a problem for us. We would certainly stay at the Hotel Golden again when visiting Rome. It is a delightful place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Break!”
Reviews.Author: mtuk100
Reviews.Content: My wife, son and I stayed in the "junior suite" at the Hotel Golden fora long weekend. The suite itself consisted of a large bedroom with a large double bed and sofa bed, separate large "dining area" with table/chairs for 6 plus a lovely bathroom. The quality of fittings was excellent and fully complemented the original features such as high ceilngs, intricate coving, etc. The hotel itself is located in a traditional apartment block just off the Via Veneto - where you find the swanky 5* hotels - and around 10-15 mins walk from the main attractions. You enter the hotel through a shared marble entrance hall and make your way to the first floor where the hotel is to be found although the suite itself is on the second floor. Marco and Guiseppi were very friendly and gave great advice about transportation, restaurants, etc. Breakfast was comprehensive including omelette and bacon as well as the usual continental breads, cakes, etc. Overall, a super friendly little traditional little hotel that is great value for money. My only minor gripes are i) requirement to go to hotel reception to get Marco/Guiseppi to come up and open the door to suite very time we left the room ii) the "safe" in the room is not bolted to the wall and therefore effectively useless. You won't be disappointed with the Hotel Golden!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: nenebug1947
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Golden while making a short visit to Rome. The location was wonderful-great neighborhood and an easy walk to much of what we wanted to see and do. The bedrooms are tiny but very clean and well organized. The breakfast was quite good and the little dining area charming. We enjoyed the staff, who assisted us with good recommendations for places to dine in the neighborhood. All and all, I would highly recommend this hotel for those visiting Rome on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, average hotel”
Reviews.Author: dobiedeb
Reviews.Content: We didn't want to pay 300 euro/night in Rome and the Hotel Golden has a great location close to Villa Borghese, not far from metro and bus stops and had read all the reviews, good and bad, breakfast room was small but not as bad as some have said, out room, #110, was however, hot, due to the layout of the room & the a/c, we could make it work in May with the windows open. On the upside, Giuseppe helped us in every way he could with directions, reservations, he went out of his way when he could.

Reviews.Title: “"Second stay, as pleasant as the first."”
Reviews.Author: guille857
Reviews.Content: We were in Rome five years ago and had a short stay in Hotel Golden. They were completely booked at the start of this journey but were available at the end of our trip, so we booked then and were as pleased with our stay this time as we were the last time we visited. Since our stay was short we rented the same small room, more than adequate for a couple of nights, but I don't recommend it for an extended stay. I was shown a larger room and they are the way to go. They have a new two bedroom family suite that is ultra modern and very spacious. Our room was immaculate, the bathroom spotless. Quiet, clean and air conditioned. The owners are incredibly pleasant and helpful. A couple of notes: Read the other reviews for more info., no need to repeat what's been said. It's best to reserve the Palazzo Borghese on-line weeks ahead (available 3 weeks prior?), and stay away from Cafe Lotti ( south side, on Sardegna-- a huge tourist rip-off). Stay at Hotel Golden, you will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Great family run hotel that cares about your experience in Rome”
Reviews.Author: dfaraci27
Reviews.Content: We stayed here five nights in mid May. The hotel was beautiful and really makes you feel like you are staying in a Roman home. Momma has a good breakfast waiting for you in the morning and it is in a good location with multiple restaurants and pizza places close by. Giuseppe and his family were more than anything we could have hoped for. We arrived on a Sunday and got married in Rome the following Thursday. The family went above and beyond to help us arrange things for the wedding since we were arranging everything. They helped us find stores, florists and restaurants for the dinner. I think every morning we had a new set of questions and they were there more than happy to help. It felt like we were staying over at a good friends house. Hotel Golden was the best overall experience on our two week, four hotel trip. We can't thank them enough and would recommend this hotel for anyone going to Rome. Can't wait to get back.

Reviews.Title: “Second time around---just as wonderful”
Reviews.Author: goingstrong
Reviews.Content: We were at this hotel a couple of years ago -right before a cruise and loved the hotel. So when it came time to return for another cruise-Hotel Golden was an obvious choice. Location, rooms, service can't be beat. Very personal attention-they mapped out a walking tour for us and right before the cruise-told us where the local supermarket was to pick up wine for the cruise. Breakfast was good and they helped us with transportation. We will be back again-really liked our experience there.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Staff”
Reviews.Author: pbishi
Reviews.Content: We were at Hotel Golden for 4 days in Rome and had a great experience. The staff was very helpful with directions and overall how to go about exploring Rome. The location was great, right next to the Borghese gardens and walking distance to Trevi Fountains , Spanish steps and the Pantheon. We will definitely stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: anocas96
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fantastic. Great location and very good staff. If you want to visit Rome, this is the perfect choice to your trip. The rooms are clean and very quite.

Reviews.Title: “I will return.”
Reviews.Author: JudyBrookline
Reviews.Content: I spent 4 nights here recently and enjoyed my stay very much. I was by myself and felt very safe and well taken care of. The location, the price and the breakfast were all great. The owners are very helpful. My room was small but very clean and comfortable. Do not expect a US style hotel. There is no lobby to speak of and it is located on the second floor of a multiuse building. That being said, I will definitely return to the hotel and Rome. What a place!

Reviews.Title: “Thanks for making our first stay in Rome so good!”
Reviews.Author: PrairieGirl28
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Golden made our first stop on our first trip to Italy an easy transition. They organized a pick-up from the airport, gave us lots of good touring tips, and made us feel at home. The hotel is located in a quiet neighborhood just steps away from the Borghese Gardens and the Via Veneto. We enjoyed the family atmosphere and the quiet comfort.

Reviews.Title: “Freindly place to stay”
Reviews.Author: misurina48
Reviews.Content: Hotel was very convinient to walking to all the sites we wanted..Vatican. Colloseum, Spanish steps etc. Staff very freindly and helpful..we were upgraded to a bigger room without asking. Rooms were clean and fairly quiet so sleeping was not a problem.

Reviews.Title: “Excellently situated and good value for money.”
Reviews.Author: jastorrar
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic little family run hotel with helpful and friendly staff. It is conveniently and centrally situated for all the main sights, yet it is in a quiet back street location. This makes it a good base for a short break in this city. The standard rooms are small but in this great city you will not want to spend much time in them. Some rooms have street views some face inwards.

Reviews.Title: “What a nice place! Will stay again for sure”
Reviews.Author: jacksan1
Reviews.Content: We have chosen Hotel Golden Rome on the basis of the strongly positive reviews here on TripAdvisor.com. We were not disappointed. First of all, the location is fantastic. Initially we were worried when finding out that it would be about a 10-minute walk to the two closest Metro stations (Barberini and Spagna). Turned out that major sites such as Pantheon, Fountain of Trevi, Piazza Navona, and Spanish Steps were all within an easy walking distance from Hotel Golden. And the walks to the Metro stations, esp. to Barberini along Via Venetoi, were also very pleasant and not inconvenient at all. Even the Vatican was walkable, if you would not mind walking for half an hour. Second, the hotel was spotlessly clean and well cared for. We were, thanks to the kindness of the owners' family, upgraded to the superior room for the price of the regular double, and everything was immaculate. And the room was very large by the European standards. Last, but not the least, the owner's family was so wonderfully helpful. They showed us immediately upon check-in those places where the locals would eat and drink, so that we would not pay the extra "tourist prices." The map marked with the "right places" that we received upon check-in was invaluable. We felt very welcome, something you would not get in a large chain city hotel. Needless to say, we will stay here again the next time in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what we expected”
Reviews.Author: trekkingtrio
Reviews.Content: We must commend the Lazio Family for their hospitality during our recent stay. The hotel is a bit of a walk from public transportation especailly when pulling luggage. But overall it was an easy walk to many sites. All staff was very friendly and speak very good English. The rooms were a nice size. OUr only complaint would be the harness of the mattresses and we have come to expect that in European hotels. Actually their's were better than most. There is a grocery store near by along with several restaurants. We ate our last evening's meal at a nice place called La Bruschetta (I believe). Good food and service and very inexpensive. We would love to return to Rome and would indeed stay at this location again. Thanks to all the Lazio Family! P.S. take time to enjoy a walk through the Villa Borghese Gardens which are s short walk from the hotle. Very relaxing after the hectic pace of the tourist areas.

Reviews.Title: “Great location,clean room and exellent service - all what you need in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: suzanna66
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel after looking at ratings for hotels on tripadvisor.com. and booking.com.And we were not disappointed!Great area just off Via Veneto, but on quiet street.We are travelling a lot, but first time we had so friendly and exellent service in reception.Giuseppe and Marco do a tremendous job of making you feel warmly welcomed and they go above and beyond to make sure your stay in Rome is a memorable one. They have great tips for sightseeing, getting around Rome and places to eat. Also rooms are very clean and breakfast is varied. Whenever we return to Rome there is no question as to where we will be staying.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent little hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Lajoux
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed here for three nights. Although the room was very small it was extremely clean and decorated very nicely. The staff were most welcoming and friendly. This hotel is in a lovely part of Rome - right next to the Villa Borghese with excellent restaurants nearby - notably San Marco and Pomordorino. Highly recommend. We would definitely stay in this hotel again - it was excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “Grate location and value freindly hotel”
Reviews.Author: meniku
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife, stayed in the hotel for 5 nights. It is close to the city center, And easy to walk to all of the attractions of Rome. The family that runs the hotel is very friendly and ready to help you in any matter. The room was very clean and convenient. Breakfast was good, but the dining room Is very small, and we had to wait sometime for a place in the dining room. For the price we paid, it’s a grate value for the money. We enjoyed the stay and I Recommend the hotel to all.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hosts, Like Staying With Good Friends”
Reviews.Author: RoomZoom
Reviews.Content: Recently had the pleasure of staying here. But it was more than a stay, it was an experience. Our hosts were available both before and during the stay to help arrange drivers and a variety of tours with trusted guides or to arrange reservations to popular attractions. The room was spacious, clean and comfortable and the morning meal was always deliciously prepared. Restaurant recommendations nearby were welcomed and accurate. We will never consider staying anywhere but at the Hotel Golden in Rome for future visits. Thanks again to the whole family for making this such an enjoyable first experience in Italy!

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly located small family-owned hotel with very heplful staff!”
Reviews.Author: Ingrid_K_S
Reviews.Content: Small but really nice and clean hotel with the most heplful hotel-staff I have ever met. They gave advices about where to eat, how to get around town, what to see. If you wanted to buy tickets for events- they knew exactly where to buy it. Located in a qiet surroundings with lots of luxury hotels and embassys, and wonderful Villa Borghese within a five minutes walk, Spanish stpes within ten minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Welcoming Home Base”
Reviews.Author: oneofthree25
Reviews.Content: A small family hotel in a quiet corner of Rome for a great price. Welcoming atmosphere from owners and a nice breakfast to begin the day. Close to Borghese Museum, 2 Metro connections, lots of buses and Via Veneto. Small neighhood restaurant, San Marco, for when you don't feel like forging out again after a long day. All in all, a nice respite and a safe neighhood to wander in.

Reviews.Title: “What a gem!”
Reviews.Author: JClift
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel after looking at ratings for hotels on tripadvisor.com. I can't imagine why this hotel isn't listed by Rick Steves or Fodors or by other travel guides. The MOST helpful front desk staff we encountered during our 2 week trip to Italy! Fabulous breakfast every morning, rooms were spotless, beds very comfy. I felt safe knowing that the hotel would "buzz you in" from the front. Great area just off Via Veneto and convenient to Metro and buses. Just a lovely place and not only would I recommend Hotel Golden to anyone planning a trip to Rome, I would love to stay with them again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and lovely hotel staff”
Reviews.Author: Dudleyfox
Reviews.Content: Three of us shared a room at Hotel Golden. The room was clean and pleasant. The mini bar fridge was a good price which was nice. The hotel staff were all family and really nice and helpful. I had a really bad ear infection whilst I was there and they assisted me a great deal. They even let me have our room for longer on our last day so I could rest before the flight home. The breakfast was really nice and there was a good variety of food. The hotel is in a great location too.

Reviews.Title: “Making you feel like family in a gem of a hotel.”
Reviews.Author: GPT77
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Golden over Easter break 2011. We were sold on the location, the value and the positive Trip Advisor comments. When reading some of the comments I thought that many were too good to be true. Well after experiencing three nights in a family room all I can say is the positive comments are all an accurate reflection. Three things are the biggest positives of the hotel. First, location. It's perfectly situated just a block from Via Veneto and you get the same great location with many sights within walking distance. Great having the Borghese palace within 100 metres of your hotel. Great place to picnic, run and get some great photo's of Rome from above. Second, the cleanliness. The rooms are pristinely clean and well maintained. Lastly, and the best part, the service. The family do a tremendous job of making you feel warmly welcomed and they go above and beyond to make sure your stay in Rome is a memorable one. They have great tips for sightseeing, getting around Rome and places to eat. They truly act like an extended family with your interests at heart. You are treated as honoured guests. A bonus treat is the well stocked breakfast in the morning. Enough to get you going and keep you going the entire day. The free internet is also a bonus; especially for those of trying to stay connected with work.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulously location”
Reviews.Author: OleErnstJensen
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed five nights at this very nice family hotel and enjoyed our stay very much. We were meet with great hospitality from all members of the staff, and the management was very helpfull in advising us to nice locations and restaurants. The location of the hotel is optimal for exploring the city. We will give our best recommendations to Hotel Golden - small, nice and quiet ...

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, quiet hotel with wonderful, attentive service”
Reviews.Author: jpstrich
Reviews.Content: We were very happy with our stay at the Hotel Golden in Rome. The owners were very friendly and attentive to our needs. It was very clean. The room was quite small but adequate, the bed very comfortable, and it was fairly quiet for a city hotel. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Golden is not worth it”
Reviews.Author: toronto014
Reviews.Content: We were looking so forward to our 8 night stay at Hotel Golden, mainly because of the positive write ups on Trip Advisor. We were very disappointed. Although the bathroom was small and the room itself was poorly lit, we were okay with this as this is quite common in Europe. It was the indifference of the owner/staff that was the real disappointment. The front desk of the hotel is staffed by the 2 brothers (40ish) who are pleasant, but the older couple (likely their parents) are just rude. The father does not seem to care to say good morning to you - and will think nothing of walking in front of you while you are struggling with your luggage. The mother rarely grunted a hello to us...I think it was day 6 when she said good morning. Hotel: the hotel is made up of 15 of so rooms, but they are all located on the second floor of a 5 storey building that has mixed uses in it. To gain entrance into the hotel, you had to use an intercom buzzer at the front door. We felt like we were entering/leaving a prison. There is no sitting area or waiting room if you every wanted to step out of your room for a while. The breakfast room in very tiny, only 6 tables and we had to stand and wait for a table several days. Breakfast - truly not at all like the pictures on the webite. They only put out enough eggs for one person at a time....odd...and the "mother" stands in the kitchen doorway and watches the food you put on your plate...it made you feel very uncomfortable. One morning we entered the room for breakfast 1/2 hour before the breakfast time was over and there was not bread (not a bun, croissant, nothing). We asked the older woman (not the mother) for some bread and she just shrugged her shoulders and said under her breath in Italian "that we should have come soorner if we wanted bread"! Restfulness - not at all. We heard other guests complain that they could hear everything in the next rooms. We were unlucky to have the room across from the reception desk (again, the entire hotel is all on the 2nd floor of this building). We heard everyone coming in and out and talking to the hosts at the front desk. And again, unlucky us, our room was beside the "parents/owner" of the hotel who live there on site. They had no courtesy for us as guests to keep their voices down even after 11pm to allow their paying guests to get a restful sleep. Sometimes it seemed that they were all yelling at each other about the running of the hotel - I know, sounds comical, but not when you want to rest after a busy day of sight-seeing in Rome. Location: In the north end of the walled City. I suggest you take the transit out to your furtherest destination and then explore/make your way back on foot to enjoy all that Rome has to offer. If you are wanting a restful sleep and to be treated with courtesy, I think you would be better at another hotel. As an aside, every time I was laying in the bed, my legs were extremely itchy....bugs?

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: whitney305
Reviews.Content: This hotel was recommended by a friend of ours and I have to say we were not disappointed. We arrived at 11am, however our room was not ready. (The people had not left yet). Giuseppe, was more than helpful, he offered us towels to wash up, use of the restroom, held our luggage and suggested we go see the spanish steps and come back within the hour. We came back and the room was ready. The room was great, beds good and bathroom good. The breakfast was great, huge selection of foods and the mother kept the area stocked with fresh food. The hotel arranged our trip from the airport and everything went very smooth. Excellent recommendations of restaurants. I have to say, that we felt we were guests in the family home. I would never hesitate staying at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hospitality and Helpfulness made Rome touring enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: aggmcl
Reviews.Content: The family of Hotel Golden makes one feel at home. The brothers were helpful and knowledeable about traversing the city of Rome by public transport giving us maps and understandable directions. The hotel is located in an older building but had all the modern conveniences we needed and still was within our budget. The breakfast room is small but able to handle all the guests staying at the time we were there and mom runs an efficient operation. The hotel is small enough to get to know other guests if one wanted to do so. The only thing lacking was a sitting room or place for my brother in law to hang out and read and one night there was a gentleman in the next room who spoke loudly on his cell phone for a long time. All in all we had a pleasant 5 days and would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Look no more- this is the place to be in Rome”
Reviews.Author: avi
Reviews.Content: First- thank you Trip advisor- we have chosen the Golden hotels having read the reviews- and it came out to be very accurate. Now- to the hotel itself- since they won their reputation by hard work. The very caring "mama" is like an "energizer"- she hurries all the time and takes care that nothing is missing for the guests. We wish her good health and many years of happiness with her loving children. It is centrally located- only one block behind the known famous hotels. We can tell you for sure- it gives you much more value- both of your time, and we also believe of your money. They clean very tidily the room every day, and there is a small bar in the room. And since they keep on with the good service- we believe they are becoming at least as famous amongst those travellers who wish to feel real atmosphere of domestic Rome. They will help you with all the information needed- day and night. Breakfast is excellent, and if you wish to get supply for the rest of the day- a block away from the hotel you will find two Supermarkets (SPAR, CAREFUR) open 7:00-21:00 We are a frequent travellers (not as frequent as we would like to- but frequent enough) - and there is a family consensus- the best hotel that we have stayed in till now. We arrived to and from the hotel by a minivan the hotel arranged for us, & paid less than any other way. We recommend this family run hotel firmly, and wish we will have the opportunity to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “The Friendliest Hoteliers EVER”
Reviews.Author: irene5269
Reviews.Content: I've never experienced such kind service from a hotel. They were absolutely wonderful and so sweet with my little girl, even remembering her name in a very thoughtful email they sent us after our stay conveying their gratitude for chosing their hotel. Perfect in every way!!!!!!! Whenever we return to Rome there is no question as to where we will be staying. The breakfast was also quite varied with fruit, yogurt, eggs (scrambled AND hard boiled), cereal, pastries, meats, cheeses, coffee and tea! Something for everyone :o) Thank you Hotel Golden!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, family run hotel in the best location possible.”
Reviews.Author: AlannGill
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a four day stay at Hotel Golden. The family who own and run the hotel were simply excellent. No enquiry was too much trouble and everything was done in such a friendly and warm manner. Advice on getting around Rome, great places to eat (you must go to the Trattoria Cadorna) and what to see was given with the enthusiasm of people who genuinely love their business. Assistance with booking tables, taxi , return flight check in were done efficiently and quickly. This is not an anonymous international chain hotel, it is a real family business throughout. The location is superb, just a two minute walk from the Via Veneto and access to all the major destinations and ten from the Borghese gardens where you can go just to relax by one of the many fountains oir under the trees. The room was comfortable, scrupulously clean, with good shower/bathroom facilities. Breakfast in a small dining room was more than adequate, with a variety of cold meat, eggs, cakes, and so on. This is a hotel with time for people, not a place with 40" plasma screens. If you love finding out about the place you are in, talking with people, experiencing things first hand then this is the place for you. When we return to Rome (which we will, it is so wonderful) this is the place we will stay.

Reviews.Title: “home away from home!”
Reviews.Author: lweger
Reviews.Content: My wife and I traveled to Rome with our 19 month old son and stayed at the Hotel Golden from April 4-8, 2011. We had the junior suite which was huge! Plenty of room for all three of us. Everything was first class from the cleanliness to the service to the breakfast served every morning. The location was within walking distance to every major site in Rome. One of the best perks was how friendly the staff was at the hotel. They went out of their way to recommend pizzerias and restaurants that were nearby. Be sure to book your airport transfer through the hotel...about 10-15 euro cheaper than a taxi. We will definitely return if we are back in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, great location”
Reviews.Author: Maud180291
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located near all of the big hotel chains but is neatly tucked behind them. The entrance isn't grand but once inside and upstairs, the hotel has the appearance that you'd expect. The rooms are very nicely decorated and the shower room/ensuite clean and with a good shower. The room that we stayed in was a little noisy due to being close to reception - so avoid this if you can. The service made the stay - the brothers on reception marked up maps, pointed out good restaurants, buses, walking routes. And there recommendations were good! They even gave us some advice about the potential scams that the taxi driver might pull (which he did) and how to avoid it. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for those visiting all the main sites in Rome.”
Reviews.Author: dougjharris
Reviews.Content: Hotel is family run, clean, friendly and in a quiet location but you can quickly be into the main streets with shops and restrurants. Mero is also in easy walking distance. Hotel staff very helpful and made it easy to plan our program for the 3 days we were there.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly family run hotel”
Reviews.Author: trawler67
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Golden for a week in April. Giuseppe and Marco were very helpful from the start, pointing out places of interest, where to eat and gave invaluable information about public transport. The hotel is in a quiet area however it is easy to reach the centre of town which is great but equally good to leave it behind and retire to a lovely quiet room. It is within walking distance of the Spanish Steps and there is an excellent shuttle bus (116), around the corner that takes you to the heart of town. The Spagna metro is within easy reach at the top of Via Veneto via an underground passageway where you will also find the excellent Carrefour supermarket. The rooms are very nicely decorated and spotless. There is air conditioning, a TV and a fridge in the room. The hotel is on the first floor of a building and so you are let in at the door- this all added to the sense of security. The breakfast is a buffet and the selection is excellent. The food was varied, fresh and there was lots of coffee. We had a great time and will definitely return when we revisit Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great mid-range hotel”
Reviews.Author: muffinjules79
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at Hotel Golden. The location was very good in proximity to the attractions -- just a 10-20 minute walk to all the big attractions, but far enough away that you didn't feel stuck in the middle of a tourist trap, which we liked. The Via Veneto neighborhood is very nice and quiet, but there are still plenty of restaurants around the hotel so you can come back for a late afternoon nap and roll out of bed to find plenty of options for the post-7:30 pm dining schedule that Italy is on. The staff is very helpful, but not overly friendly -- but they are not cold by any means. I think they are just typical Romans. They answer your questions and get you what you need in a very courteous manner and then they leave you alone. The breakfast buffet was very good every morning. Free WIFI. The cable TV was a little screwed up in our room, but we didn't mind that as much because we brought a travel DVD player for the moments we just wanted to kick back. But be aware that you will need the right adapter for their outlets. The regular EU 2-prong adapter only fit in 1 outlet (in the bathroom) -- you need the 3-prong adapter (where all 3-prongs are in a straight row). This was the only hotel on our trip through Munich-Salzburg-Florence-Rome where we needed the 3-prong. Other than that, it was a great hotel and I would go back!

Reviews.Title: “A Home away from Home”
Reviews.Author: Smoodley
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Golden in March 2011 with a party of 8 including 2 teenagers and 2 young children. The family suite that Guiseppe and Marco recommended worked like a charm and allowed the children the time out they needed without feeling like they were stuck in a hotel room. Both Guiseppe and Marco were fabulous at providing advice on where to eat ( particularly given the ZARand and Euro exchange rates), sights to see and where to shop. They also recommended a transfer company who gave us a fantastic rate that included pick up from the airport, transfer to the port in Civitavecchia and then from the port back to the airport. The rates were excellent, Carlos was absolutely punctual and his service excellent ( he even drove back to the port to give my husband his jacket, the only one he carried on the trip). Breakfast was fabulous with a variety of foods from eggs and bacon to croissants, cookies, a variety of cakes, fresh fruit, a vast variety of cheeses and cold meats and wonderful coffee. The rooms were impeccably clean and the staff went out of there way to assist, making our stay a wonderful one. Thank you for your effort. We will certainly use the Hotel Golden again and recomment it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid --- BUGS!!”
Reviews.Author: TuffysDad
Reviews.Content: This hotel stay was an absolute disaster!! Our first visit to Rome, we researched hotels on this site and saw the positive reviews for the Hotel Golden. We booked a triple room for 4 nights. My wife, our 16 year-old daughter and I arrived on 4/4/2011 at app. 7:30 pm. We slept on a queen bed, my daughter slept on a convertible settee. My daughter awoke at 7:30 am with large and painful insect bites on her arm, shoulder, and face that were not there when she went to bad. We complained to the owner immediately, showed him the bites, and he just shrugged his shoulders!! He said the hotel was full and refused us a refund. We were forced to leave the hotel for a last minute, much more expensive one. My daughter had to get topical medication and was very uncomfortable for the rest of our trip! I really had high hopes for this hotel, but what a disappointment!!!

Reviews.Title: “Quiet location, by Borghese Gardens”
Reviews.Author: g0m0
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my wife on our first leg of our honeymoon. We chartered their direct car service from the airport to the hotel. The driver was an older gentleman, and was nice. However, the car was a little old and had a smell to it. No matter! The room we stayed in had a view of the street and was surprisingly roomy for a European hotel. It was in a quieter part of Rome, by the Villa Borghese, so it is a little bit of a walk from Trevi Fountain and Spanish Steps. But if you're in good shape, this is a good location!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: live-at-cedars
Reviews.Content: What a great little Hotel. Staff: Friendly and Helpful, making you feel very much at home. Location: Just around the corner from all the 5 star Hotels in Rome. Easy walk to all attraction. We enjoy walking so never caught public transport, but it's close by if required. Rooms: We booked a small double room. The room was small but very clean and nicely decorated. We were very happy with the room as we really only slept in it. If you like to have a bit more space you might be better to book a larger room. Sky TV in room. Breakfast: The breakfast was great. A large variety and kept us going throughout the day. Internet: There is a laptop at reception that can be used any time for free. If you want a clean, friendly Hotel in a great position this is the Hotel for you.

Reviews.Title: “A hotel that really looks out for its guests!”
Reviews.Author: sand&surf
Reviews.Content: My husband & i had the pleasure of spending 5 days at the Hotel Golden. The hotel was quiet, clean and in a very nice neighborhood. Guiseppe & Marco really gave us the right steer on restaurants , which were local places with reasonable prices. We especially enjoyed Il Pomodorino, right around the corner from the hotel. Their directions to the sights were right on & we bussed it all over the city on our Roma Pass. Thanks to Marco for his sense of humor--we had some good laughs over our mishaps on directions but it all adds to our adventures in Rome. We would recommend this hotel to anyone who wants a centrally located hotel that is reasonable & clean with very gracious hosts.

Reviews.Title: “Golden Days At The Hotel Golden”
Reviews.Author: Fastflys
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Hotel Golden from 29th March until 02nd April 2011. Sightseeing was our main objective, therefore the majority of each day and evening we would be out and about in Rome. At the end of each exhausting day, what was important to us was a comfortable night’s sleep in a clean room with a functional bathroom. We checked out the top 30 hotels in Rome listed on TripAdviser and shortlisted five. We chose the Hotel Golden for the following reasons: Price [breakfast included], location, free WiFi, complete no smoking policy and most importantly the overwhelming positive reviews. We weren’t disappointed. [Tip] I emailed the Hotel and through them, booked the saloon car airport pick-up service. At €40 + €2 airport tax it was cheaper than booking directly. Marco and Giuseppe took care of the arrangements and kept me updated. [Tip] On arrival at the Hotel, the driver will require payment in cash. The Hotel is situated on the first floor and is accessed by stairs or a small antique style lift [we used both]. We were checked in by Maria and Giuseppe who proceeded to highlight on a map the tourist attractions, the best routes to take, the location of public transportation, a local pizzeria and restaurant etc., etc. This map and their local knowledge proved invaluable. Our room was a Classic Double which overlooked a pizzeria. The window was double glazed. The bed was firm but comfortable. There was Sky TV but the majority of programmes transmitted were not in English. Pay per view TV was an option but not tried. There was a mini bar/fridge, wardrobe with small chest of draws and room safe [too small to house a Laptop], a sofa bed, two bedside cabinets, telephone, dressing table and chair, wall mirror and a table lamp on an occasional table where some sweets/candy were placed every day. The flooring was tile. There was an adjustable air conditioning unit above the entrance door but being on the first floor we just opened the window for some fresh air. Our room had two spare electricity wall sockets, three if the table lamp was unplugged. The bathroom housed a “Telephone Box” type shower cubicle with adjustable shower head. The cubicle was small but OK. There was a toilet, bidet and hand basin with wall mirror, extendable shaving mirror and hairdryer. A disposable razor and shaving balm were provided as well as a shower cap and sachets of body wash/shampoo etc., which were replaced daily. Bath and hand towels were white and clean and replaced when necessary. There was also an extractor fan, chair and shelving. The flooring was tile. Lighting was adequate throughout. The rooms were clean, nicely decorated and serviced daily. Room service was available but not tried. Maria, Marco, Giuseppe, if you read this review, two slight criticisms: The shower water could have been a fraction warmer and after we had returned home and revisited your website we realised that the bathrobe and slippers you state that you normally provide, were absent. Overlooking a Pizzeria, we expected some noise but this didn’t bother us too much. If you like complete quiet, I would suggest that you request a room located elsewhere. WiFi connectivity in the room was excellent. The inclusive breakfast was good. Tea, coffee, milk, juice, flavoured yoghurts, cold meats, various cheeses, boiled eggs, omelette strips with bacon, various rolls, butter, cakes, croissants, biscuits and more besides. All were constantly replenished. The breakfast room is quite small with the maximum amount of tables fitted in, so it maybe a little awkward if like me you’re a tad overweight. The Hotel website states that there is also a coin operated laundry, private garage with a collection and delivery service and newspapers available. We never checked out the laundry facilities, had no car to garage and didn’t request a newspaper. We asked Giuseppe to arrange for a saloon car to take us back to the airport. He made the booking, confirmed it and kept in contact with the driver. When the Mercedes arrived, Giuseppe came down to the front entrance, introduced us to the driver and stayed until we departed. The charge [payable to the driver in cash] was €40 as the €2 tax is not applied for journeys back to the airport. This boutique Hotel is family run and has a real family atmosphere about it. The hotel is situated in Via Marche close to the Villa Borghese park in what appears to be a safe area. The main tourist attractions are all within 0.5 to 3 kms approx, nevertheless there was still plenty of walking to be done. [Tip] To make best use of your time, take a taxi ride either to or from an attraction. There is a taxi rank within two minutes walk of the Hotel. Expect to pay €6 to €13 per journey approx. Be aware of dishonest LICENSED taxi drivers using METERED cabs. Two such drivers, parked on a rank in front of St. Peter’s Square informed us that the fare back to the Hotel would be between €23 and €27. That would only be true if they took the scenic route around Rome to boost the fare!! For the more adventurous, there’s always the bus or metro. [Tip] If attending the Pope’s address in St. Peter’s Square [Wednesday mornings, weather permitting], choose a different day when it’s less crowded to visit the Basilica and Vatican museum. Giolitti ice-cream parlour [recommended by Giuseppe] and a short walk from the Pantheon, is a must do although ice-cream purchased from other establishments was also pretty good. So what’s not to like about Rome? For us just one thing - the illegal street traders who accosted us non-stop. Would we return to Rome again: Yes! Would we return to the Hotel Golden again: Yes! Would we recommend the Hotel Golden to others: Yes! Finally I would like to thank Maria, Giuseppe and Marco for making our short stay in Rome a happy and memorable one.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: LisaGriff
Reviews.Content: Lovely family hotel - everything excellent - the information given by the family owners on best way to get to all the tourist attractions, to the local restaurant recommendations, the wonderful breakfast with so much choice and the ensuite room was spacious, comfortable, very quiet. Location perfect for city exploring, recommend booking the airport taxi transfer both ways. Hotel booking was easy and personal. Would definately stay here again when next in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: WOWBoston
Reviews.Content: This hotel was an excellent choice for us! We stayed here for 5 days in a 'small' double room. It was our first visit to Rome. The hotel is located in a safe, elegant neighborhood within walking distance (no more than 20 minutes) to everything we wanted to see/do in Rome. It is well organized and the rates are reasonable. Our room was indeed very small (OK with us!), but cozy with comfortable bed, clean bathroom and good shower. Breakfast was generous - selection of breads and rolls, yogurts, some cakes, cold cuts, cheese, cereals, juices, hard boiled eggs, sliced tomatoes and even some fresh fruit. We were not so fond of their coffee, so we had our cappuccinos in the cafe next door. We found in this family-run-hotel everything we needed/expected and more... Service or rather how Guiseppe and his family interacted with us, assisted us with everything was more than we expected. They are very kind and authentic people! Grazie mille, Guiseppe!

Reviews.Title: “Great Accomadations, Great location and the Loria Family are wonderful hosts”
Reviews.Author: tyar2
Reviews.Content: Great accomadations and great location, the Loria Family was very friendly and helpfull (Thanks Marco for answering all of our first time in Rome questions). 6 Friends traveling together we stayed in the family suite 2 large bedrooms a Iarge eating area and large bathroom with a large shower and a great view of the old city walls. Was kinda worried with 6 of us girls sharing a bathroom but with double sinks and lots of space it worked out great. Several restaurants within walking distance and a taxi stand just around the corner less than 100 feet from the front door made getting around really easy and the subway is about a 10 minute walk. A wonderful breakfast every morning and the coffee was the best I had in the whole city of Rome. Thanks for a wonderful visit will defintily recommend to friends and if/when I return will definitly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel, wonderful stay.”
Reviews.Author: sharden58
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Golden March 18-25. We wanted to stay somewhere in the centre city, but not pay too much. This is a charming hotel, located within walking distance to the metro and to many of the local sites at a very reasonable price. We stayed in the 2 bedroom apartment and it was just perfect for our group of six ladies. The cots were a little uncomfortable for the two that had to sleep on them, but overall we were very, very happy. The breakfast was very satisfactory. Being Americans, we are used to big breakfasts, but the fresh pastries and sweets, along with the meat and eggs kept me satisfied until lunch time!! Marco and Giuseppe were very good to us and helped us find wherever we wanted to go, call us a taxi if we needed and were just very helpful. The hotel is actually on the 2nd floor and the apartment we stayed in was on the 3rd floor. There is a little elevator, that those who didn’t feel they wanted to walk up another flight of stairs could take. The last night of our stay, we had to move into a couple of the smaller rooms on the 2nd floor. They were smaller, but we didn’t go to Rome to stay in our hotel rooms, so I feel they would have been adequate, as well. If I were returning, I would try to get the apartment again, as it is roomier. I would recommend this hotel to anyone and when I return to Rome, will surely stay at the Golden Hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “A hidden gem”
Reviews.Author: Super_Fortuna95
Reviews.Content: Hotel Golden is certainly a hidden gem in Rom. We had one of the family rooms which gives enough space for four. Room and bath are very clean, nicely decorated and well maintained. WLAN access in the room is sufficient (in case you need it). The service provieded by the family run business is very friendly and professional. Considering the the upscale location on top the Hotel Golden provides an excellent value for the cost. The lcoation of our room was quiet enough that we could sleep even with open window. The breakfast room is a bit small, but with a little bit patience one can enjoy very nice breakfast missing nothing (the litle omlet featuring pieces of fine Italian ham is particular tasty.. :-) ). Bus is a few minutes walking away and takes you within three stops to the metro/underground.

Reviews.Title: “Great room with amazing service”
Reviews.Author: M2R1K3
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a trip to Rome and had a great stay at the Hotel Golden. The staff/owners took such good care of us. They arranged to have us picked up at the airport. Though we paid for the service, it was such a relief to have someone pick us up and take us to the hotel and not have to worry about finding my way in a new city after a long flight. They stored our luggage while our rooms were being readied and gave us directions to nearby sights. Were were very close to a Metro stop, walking distance to the Spanish Steps and the Villa Borghese and the Trevi Fountain. Also near by are fabulous restaurants and shopping. We took a side trip to Florence for several days and the Hotel Golden stored most of our luggage for us so we wouldn't have to take so much on the train with us. The safety and security of the facility was excellent! We had 2 teenage girls with us and we were not in connecting rooms, but we were very comfortable with the security measures taken by the Hotel. The free breakfast every morning was excellent as well. It was just a great stay!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “fantastic city and amazing hotel”
Reviews.Author: angelojorge_
Reviews.Content: This is my first review and it is a pleasure to say a few words about this family-owned hotel. Since me and my family arrived at the hotel, We felt as we were arriving in the house of old friends.Guiseppe and his family were always friendly and helpful, giving us good restaurants recomendations, highlighting places to go and especially being always attencious to any of ours concerns!The hotel is very well located, just one block from the famous Via Veneto and few blocks from the metro station and Trevi´s Fontain.It has great rooms ,an excelent breakfast!With no doubt it is the perfect place to stay in Rome and I recommend it to anyone who wants to spend good moments in Rome.It is a differentiated hotel and I hope soon I will be able to return to this fantastic city and this amazing hotel! Angelo and family

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Golden lives up to its name”
Reviews.Author: CSFL
Reviews.Content: We just stayed at the Golden for 7 nights and it was great! We decided to stay for a few reasons...they reply to e-mails within a day, which is good to know when you are booking overseas. They arranged the car to and from the airport, which is one of the best rates out there and timely. Lastly, they have remained high on the tripadvisor list! We stayed in the Jr. Suite, which was amazing. The bedroom had a king bed that had been turned into two twins, for us, and had a chaise that could have been a third twin. There was a flat screen tv with 300 plus channels...but only two in English. Spacious does not even describe this room...not only were there 18 foot ceilings, but soooo much room. Then there was a sitting area off of the room with a table for 6 people. We found ourselves using the table for planning the next day and playing cards:-) Lastly is the bathroom, with a double sink, a huge walk-in shower and again plenty of room! We really thought the lights that changed in the shower were unique, as well as the square toilet! We would recommend this place to anyone going to Rome! If you are staying awhile the Jr. Suite is the best way to go. Hotel Golden is located just a block from Harry’s Bar and beautiful Via Veneto. It is in a safe area and there is a little family owned place down the block called Lotti, where we often ate dinner or grabbed pastries to bring to the room. We loved our stay thanks to this hotel, and the friendly people who run it!

Reviews.Title: “Nice family-owned hotel with very friendly and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Okist
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Hotel Golden Rome in March 2011 as a young couple. The hotel is a family-owned hotel and we both loved the family atmosphere. Staff was *very* helpful and friendly, they gave us several recommendations which made our visit to Rome even more pleasant. Location was good, you can get to public transport in 5 mins. from the hotel, or you can even walk to many places of interest. Our room was big enough and very clean. Breakfast was perfectly adequate. We both enjoyed our stay very much. I can wholeheartedly recommend Hotel Golden Rome for anyone planning to visit Rome.

Reviews.Title: “A golden opportunity in the eternal city”
Reviews.Author: ld
Reviews.Content: Despite the grey skies and drizzle we were met by a cheery driver on arrival who was soon whisking us into the city. Despite a considerable language barrier (mainly due to our very poor Italian) he pointed out a few sights and before we knew it we were at the Hotel Golden. Now I've started with the driver because ultimately this illustrates perfectly what's special about this hotel. The attention to service and detail is quite a revelation in this age of high volume hotels filled with low-paid staff. It is without doubt this element that sets Hotel Golden apart from any other mid-priced (and possibly even upper priced) establishment in Rome. The owners and staff go to great lengths to ensure pre-arrival service is great as well during your stay. If there are two or more of you then the car service is a really great travel option from the airports, which are quite a distance from the city and would require a train journey followed by a mixture of metro/bus/walk/taxi depending on what you want to do. A word on the location, it’s good for both walking the city and access to bus and metro, if you want to be in the centre of nightlife then a little closer to Campo di Fioro or Piazza Navona might better suit. However, if you want to retire to a slightly more genteel area at bedtime then the hotel is perfect. An eye wateringly expensive cocktail at Harry’s bar is a nice treat at the end of a long day and then you can fall into bed after a two minute walk. You can walk to the Coliseum in 30mins and the Vatican in 40mins. The hotel is very well located for getting to the Appian way which is about 7 stops from Barberini metro (Antica Appian or something like that) and then hop on the 660 bus straight off the metro. The bus turns around at the Appian Way and goes back to the Metro stop. So you can't really get lost. A trip out to the catacombs and Appian Way is a perfect antidote to the hustle and bustle of Rome as well. A final recommendation on stuff to do in the area is to go to the Cappucin Crypt located a few mins walk down the Via Veneto towards Piazza Barberini. It’s quite extraordinary and moving in a strange way. So onto the hotel itself, its a small and discreet place and I’ve stayed in similar family run places in Florence and Venice. I'd highly recommend these sorts of small hotel as you get excellent value for money as well as great service. As with others of its kind, there is no flashy entrance or palatial reception. Although if you pay attention you'll notice the entrance to the building is quite grand in an understated way. Up a flight of stairs you find yourself in a small and tidy reception with the hotel rooms and breakfast area all on the same floor. We had room 103 which is a superior with cosy and tasteful decoration, enough space to swing a couple of cats if so wished, and a spotlessly clean bathroom. Our friends stayed in 104, which was perhaps not quite a nice as it has a more awkward shape, but more than adequate none the less. I suspect the standard rooms may be a little on the small side and would definitely recommend going for a superior if your budget allows. The double glazing in the rooms is first rate you can barely here any street noise. That said the sound proofing out to reception is poor and so there is disturbance from general conversations or guests arriving / leaving. I don't think there is anything that the hotel could do about this given its size, so I would merely say to light sleepers you should bring some ear-plugs otherwise you might be woken by people departing early with the dragging of cases down the corridor or check out chatter. Breakfast is in a little room off the main corridor and it can be quite busy or cramped, we had to wait a few minutes one morning for a table to become free. Not such a big deal, but of you are a family of four there are no tables that take more than 3 people, we found families had to take two tables which meant it could be a little busy at times. The food however, is lovely with so many delicious cakes and pastries supplemented by juice, meats, cheese, cereal, eggs you name it. The omelette in particular is delicious as are the cake - a veritable feast by! Finally a few words about the main reason to stay at this hotel above all else - the family who run it. A harder working, helpful and friendly set of people must surely be hard to find in Rome. They gave great advice and guidance about travel, restaurants, how to get from A to B etc that our short stay in the city was perfect. I didn't really appreciate this until our last evening when we were chatting to a fellow traveller in a bar off Piazza Navona who had just paid 115 euro for two main courses and a couple of drinks for two people. We had been sent to fabulous trattoria full of Iocals where people were waiting in the street for tables. We paid less than 100 euro for 4 people for delicious food and great wine and hadn't really appreciated until that point what great advice the hotel had shared with us and how helpful they had been in a very unflashy way. So the hotel is clean, in a good location and well priced, but above all else it is run by gracious and helpful people and that's the main reason to stay there above anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “What a delight...peaceful stay.”
Reviews.Author: FleaBag08
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at Hotel Golden. Guiseppe and his family were friendly and helpful from the beginning. Hotel Golden is situated in a great area, a block away from Via Vittorio Veneto, a major street with lots of shops, restaurants, and outdoor cafes to choose from. Whichever family member is at the front desk will be happy to recommend a good spot for you. PROS: Free WIFI in room, Complementary Breakfast, Friendly Staff, Secure & Quiet Accommodations

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in a wonderful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Sarisima
Reviews.Content: First time writing a review for Tripadvisor, that's what a good experience staying at this hotel was! Giuseppe and Marco were incredibly helpful and friendly, with great recommendations for restaurants and places to go (as well as good directions--we only got in trouble when we didn't follow them). The family was traveling to meet up with my sister studying in London, and they were able to coordinate helping us with taxis from the airport for both flights no problem. We stayed in the family suite on the second floor. It was very quiet and roomy, even the bathroom! An enjoyable breakfast is provided in the morning, with treats like chocolate croissants but also good healthy staples like eggs and yogurt. We have stayed in "four star" type hotels like Hilton before, and I felt far more comfortable and welcome at Hotel Golden. The location is very nice as well. Rome can be a little bit like running the gauntlet at times, noisy and crowded and a bit non stop when you are hitting the more touristy areas. Hotel Golden provides a spot of oasis, located just off Via Veneto right by the Borghese park--quiet and calm, yet still a close walk to attractions like the Trevi Fountain and Spanish Steps and the Barberini metro stop. If you are running late there are taxis that tend to queue just around the corner as well. There were great restaurants around the area, and we stopped in at Lotti almost every night for some gelato. I can't say enough good about this hotel, it was a great place to stay and we would definitely return! Thanks to everyone at Hotel Golden!

Reviews.Title: “My first review? This hotel deserves it!”
Reviews.Author: DannyFallonIE
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Hotel Golden from February 8th until February 15th. We knew we'd be arriving late and had said this when booking the hotel - there was no issue. We took a taxi from Spagna metro station after getting lost - we should have read the instructions received from the hotel instructing us to get off at Barberini, only two stops away from Rome Termini. It's a 10 minute walk from Barberini, all uphill but at a gentle enough incline through Via Veneto - a throwback to Il Dolce Vita and you can still see the 5* hotels on the road along with the US Embassy. Checkin was hassle free, Marco provided a map, showed us the area, recommended routes to walk and places to visit and showed us the nearest convenience store. The room was 103 which was right next to the check in desk, it was a superior Twin, an upgrade from the Classic that we booked. The internet was fast, the room was spotless, the bathroom was large and clean. The A/C is really a heater, so if you want to cool your room down you've got to open the windows - perfect thing to do in February, nice 10C air cools it down fast! The family that run the hotel are all very nice and friendly, especially Marco and Guiseppe who were only too happy to assist us with booking for Villa Borghese, ordering a taxi for the return to Termini etc. They both spoke flawless English, while we spoke very little Italian so they were a real help. The breakfast is the typical continental fare, but definitely adequete though we didn't avail of it much ourselves, preferring to eat on the go. Speaking about 'the go', 45 minutes walking or less will get to you the Colosseum or the Vatican. 10 minutes to the Metro, 7 minutes to the bus 63 that'll take you to Travestere, 15 minutes to the Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps or the Galleria Borghese. 20-25 to the Pantheon and that area. It's a prime hotel location. This is a hotel that cares for it's guests - I left my room after 12pm on some days having heard cleaning going on about 9/10am and still found it had been tidied upon my return. It was really unexpected and really made me feel like a valued guest, one they aimed to please. Top this all off with a lovely post-trip email making sure I'm doing well and asking me to write a review here on Tripadvisor if it wasn't too much trouble - something I'm clearly only too happy to do after all they did for me! If I ever land in Rome again, this is where I'd like to stay! Highly Recommended

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Nice location”
Reviews.Author: Rosie2511
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at Hotel Golden - and it was a very pleasant stay. The staff and the hotel were wonderful - very gracious and helpful. The location is near Villa Borgese park and Museum -if you cut through the Park your at the Spanish Steps.. Very clean rooms, good breakfast - I would stay at this Hotel again. Tip - I would utilize the service they offer - 40.00 Euro (from Airport) (two People) well worth it... Thanks Marco and Guisseppe and family... we enjoyed our time.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly as every review reads...brillant hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lorrainemcn
Reviews.Content: Hotel room...spotless. The most basic room is compact but so clean, and perfect. The breakfast was a great start to a busy day of walking in rome. The family who run the hotel are pleasant and helpful. Great location...close enough to walk to nearest underground station. 2 cracking eateries nearby which Marco recommended. This is just brillant value for Rome....we will be back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Value for Money Place in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Vonics
Reviews.Content: Stayed with a friend in a double room. The hotel and room was in an immaculate condition. The hotel was beautifully presented. The staff were always attentive and well presented. The hotel is located near Via Veneto. This is close to the shopping district in Via Del Corso. It is also close to the Trevi Fountain and Villa Borghese, must see sites in Italy. You are able to organise tours that pick you up from the doorstep of the hotel. The only public transport that it is close to is a taxi rank that is a few blocks away. Otherwise you are walking everywhere. The room itself was great. It had a good, modern bathroom with a heating rack. One thing to note is that the room had tiles. This means that it has a cold floor, so bring slippers. The noise from outside the hotel was barely noticeable, even though we were on the first floor. This is attributable to the modern windows which had sufficient soundproofing to dampen the noise from outside. There was absolutely no noise from our neighbours. The room and bathroom was made up everyday while we were away. Breakfast was always served in the morning in the dining room. I suggest giving it a miss if your into hot food, but I found it more than adequate for my needs. There was a selection of cold meats and rolls as well as the obligatory cereal. There was also fresh fruit. Overall, it was a great place to stay and will definitely stay there again if my travels lead me back to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice family run place”
Reviews.Author: alexcm1985
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed in this hotel in Rome. The location is great. And the atmosphere in the hotel is very homely, it being family run. I would very happily stay here again and recommend it to any friends searching for a nice place to stay that won't break the bank.

Reviews.Title: “We were made to feel very welcome”
Reviews.Author: brupe
Reviews.Content: Very good and welcoming staff, clearly invested in the hotel, given that it's a family business. When we arrived the owner along with a city map gave us some very helpful advice on what public transport to use for the various sights. We were travelling with our 2 young girls, aged 5 and 7, who can be loud, energetic and very active, and the staff dealt with them really well. The arrangment for the family room (double bed and double sofa bed) meant that there wasn't much spare space in the room, but as the idea was to get out and about and see Rome this wasn't much of an issue. It's also likely very typical of any hotel in Rome as space is generally at a premium. Space in the breakfast room is also limited and it's amazing how they manage to offer such a spread in a small area. We were also very pleased with the restaurant they recommended within a 5 minute walk of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable, family-run hotel in convenient location.”
Reviews.Author: Kim255059
Reviews.Content: Hotel Golden is located in a quiet, safe area close to the via Vittorio Veneto. It is within walking distance to tourist attractions and close to the Metro. The staff are helpful with directions and other queries and offer free wi-fi and /or use of a computer. Breakfasts are very nice in a cheerful dining room.

Reviews.Title: “A true gem”
Reviews.Author: xgeorgeAthens
Reviews.Content: For my second stay in Rome I chose this hotel, based on the raving reviews on trip advisor, its location and its budget prices. Well, the reviews are right on, this hotel definitely deserves its top rating. There is not much to add to other reviews regarding the hotel: it is a family ran hotel and it runs like a Swiss clock - everything you read on the reviews is absolutely true, and the hotel comes out as a great bargain. I would go back without a second thought next time I visit Rome. The location of the hotel is especially important, as Rome has two problems: first, the metro does not really serve the historic center and, second, strikes are very common. Regarding the fomer issue, it pays off to be well connected to the buses, and this hotel is two blocks away from bus 116, which goes right through the center of the city - there are also around 5-6 buses in this distance going to various places, plus you can walk in 10 minutes to two metro stations. Regarding the latter issue, it pays off to have somewhere to go when there is a strike, and this hotel is walking distance from many sights, as well as from a host of restaurants, cafes and bars (in Via Veneto and Piazza di Spagna).

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Golden Rome gave us all we needed”
Reviews.Author: engrenato
Reviews.Content: When it comes to holiday travel, my wife and I always have in mind one thing: If you want to turn your visit to a city into something really worth remembering, you must first have a good base of operations for your tourist incursions. And what does that mean? Nothing less than a place in a prime location with good security, quiet and comfort, where you can regain your energy with a good sleep and an enhanced breakfast, after dealing with so many varied emotions of each discovery. In the case of Rome, this magnificent Eternal City, Hotel Golden Rome gave us all we needed for a complete delight of our seven day holiday. Thanks to its good location, we could visit all the main sights of the city from the Colosseum to the Vatican, without even a second of concern of any kind. We recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Golden - Gem of a hotel, made our stay in Rome truly great!”
Reviews.Author: frequentravelertwo
Reviews.Content: Recently came back from our second stay at Hotel Golden, and it really merits top scores on every parameter! Hotel is situated in a great area of Rome right off of Via Veneto, tranquil and green yet a short walking distance to Rome's many sights and to public transportation. Hotel is small, cozy and intimate, with lots of charm, located in a lovely building, and is sparkling clean . Breakfast is plentiful and delicious. Most importantly - hospitality is wonderful. Thanks to the welcoming, terrific staff, it feels like home away from home. Can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “A hotel in which you feel like home”
Reviews.Author: joaoqueiroz
Reviews.Content: My family spent a wonderful Christmas at this nice and cozy little hotel located just one block away from Via Veneto. Giuseppe and his family, owners of the hotel, would do their utmost to make us feel like home, being attentive with each and every question or need we would arise. Breakfast is standard, but they will try to deliver anything you may want. The suites are spacious, nicely decorated and very clean. I definitely reccomend this hotel for all those looking for a relatively low budget trip to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Good located and pleasant small hotel”
Reviews.Author: Daria_from_Moscow
Reviews.Content: Family run hotel with very frendly staff. Room was quite small, but clean and nice. Breakfast was modest, however enough for us. Free wi-fi is a big plus!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: NelsonN
Reviews.Content: I and my family (2 rooms - 5 people) had a good stay in Rome at Hotel Golden. The hotel is simple but the rooms are clean and comfortable. The breakfast was very good and the service at the fornt desk was excellent providing any information needed about Rome. It is a great idea to get some tips abou Rome at the front desk. They also arrange a van at 4:15 am on the day we are leaving Rome in a early flight. The location is very convenient. You can reach Piazza di Spagna easily through underground pass below Villa Borghese or you can reach Via Veneto and then Barberini Subway station. Nelson Narimatu and Family

Reviews.Title: “You won't get better value!”
Reviews.Author: bri_jac48
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit to this gem of a hotel and was an essential part of our return to Rome. Because of flight disruptions we had to postpone our arrival for five days.
