Although very busy, the owners ensured that we were accomodated for the full length of our stay with a minimum of disruption. Safe, very friendly and good value, a hotel experience not to be missed!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly family with an eye for tourist needs”
Reviews.Author: Greenturtle_TG
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel during our December holidays. Upon arrival, we were given a map of Rome and all the attractions mapped out INCLUDING directions to get there by Metro or bus or foot. Wow, we were impressed! A good spread of breakfast, pity we had to forsake the last day breakfast as we left early. As a suggestion, perhaps could have provided a cake or 2 for the early departing customers? Overall , an enjoyable stay at the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “A Gem in the Eternal City”
Reviews.Author: Dale-Chicago
Reviews.Content: We found Hotel Golden on Trip Advisor. After staying there for 6 nights (in 2 rooms) over Christmas break in Rome with our 2 teenagers, I assure you that all of the positive comments from previous reviews are true. If you want great location, great service, nice room, good breakfast and value then you can safely choose the Hotel Golden. Marco & Guiseppe & family take pride in their hotel, are warm hosts, and will make your trip to Rome better than you expected by helping with reservations and suggestions. Molto benne!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Cynthia05
Reviews.Content: Quiet area near Borghese Garden & Gallery. Excellent restaurants nearby and easy transport to busier sections of town. Rome can be very, very busy in some spots. But, our room was always quiet and the hosts very professional. They helped us with all our little requests. Lovely people.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Rome Vacation”
Reviews.Author: beersb
Reviews.Content: The location of the Hotel Golden is ideal. Walking distance to the Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain and the metro. We stayed in a two bedroom apartment, it was spotless, secure and quiet. Rooms were huge by European standards. When we checked in we received a comprehensive guide on how to get around Rome and the best times to visit each of the sites. The advise was spot on every time. They recommended restaurants and the food was amazing. The Hotel Golden is a family run hotel and they take pride in making sure your stay is perfect. Will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, amazing staff”
Reviews.Author: Ica55
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Golden Hotel last August with my husband and we loved the experience. The brothers and sister who run the hotel do an excellent job! The hotel is very well located and the breakfast is plentiful. I would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend!!!”
Reviews.Author: Tuan_Do
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel, family business, very friendly staff, good food, highly recommend!!!

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: Seeingamerica
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Golden is located close to the Borghese Gardens. We conveniently took a bus to the Vatican and walked to the Trevi Fountain. The hotel is close to public transportation and wonderful shops. The room was comfortable with free wifi and the breakfast which includes eggs got us off to a good start. However, best of all, was the man who greeted us at the front desk. He was helpful with directions and recommended restaurants and a wonderful grocery store where we bought the best food we consumed in Rome, marinated artichokes and peppers and freshly baked bread. He also showed us how to get the English channels on TV. This is a family run hotel and this gentleman is a gem. He made us feel comfortable and welcome in Bella Roma. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice 2 star hotel or a 5 star bed & breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: Pedro_Pereira83
Reviews.Content: The staff of this Hotel is the first thing which anyone will love. It's a family business, so everyone will be received as a guest to a family's house. The Hotel is more like a Bed & breakfast, in the 1st floor of a building. It is situated in a quite and secure area, near Vitorio Venetto (the luxury avenue full of expensive buidings and hotels) and USA Embassy. It is also close to bus stop's where you can catch a bus for free (having the Roma pass), and be in the fontana de trevi in 10minutes. Although it is also easy to walk and be in Piazza di Spagna in 15minutes. The breakfast is very generous with everything you wish to eat on your first meal of the day, also delicious and with a big variety. It seemed it was rehabilitated recently, so it seemed simple, but nice. The only bad thing was everytime we arrived at our room, the heat was on and the room was too hot for us (around 25ºC). But I'm portuguese, and we are used to cold houses, so probably it's a good thing for other people. Resuming, if you search for a cheap place, well located (not in the chinese neighborhood as the rest of the cheap places you will find), calm, confortable, with a pleasent staff and a big and tasty breakfast, this must be the best deal you will find. It was for me, but all depends on your budget!

Reviews.Title: “Our brief trip to Rome was greatly enhanced by the wonderful accommodations provided by Hotel Golden.”
Reviews.Author: Dickcissel
Reviews.Content: Hotel Golden is a wonderful hotel run by a very gracious family. The room was clean and spacious and the daily breakfast that was served was outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great service for a great holiday!”
Reviews.Author: kershawlaw
Reviews.Content: This hotel was excellent for two young girls in their early twenties exploring Rome for the first time. Exactly round the corner of a great main road for food and bars and getting to the sites, we felt very safe and confident walking back to the hotel late at night. Very helpful service, especially on the first day as they provided a map and all the best routes to get to the sites. Breakfast was very tasty, but the small room is best when it is quiet. The option of a car pick up for the airport by the hotel should be looked at as it made our travelling stress free. We know that we will be returning to this hotel the next time we go to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel ..... Great Location ..... Great Holiday !”
Reviews.Author: travellerfromBristol
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed at the Hotel Golden for 4 nights in November and would recommend this hotel. The room was clean and cosy, the staff could not be more helpful and arranged airport transfers which went without a hitch. There was plenty of choice at breakfast. The location is 10mins from the Spanish Steps. We walked to all the major sights from the hotel with the help of the map that was supplied. If we return to Rome we would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Hotel Golden”
Reviews.Author: JNLROSE
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 3 night stay at Hotel Golden. We loved it, our room was spacious, very clean & comfortable. Provided all the amenities we needed and the staff couldn't have been better & friendlier. I didn't partake of the morning breakfasts, but my husband did and said it was very nice. We had free high speed internet and the location was very convenient. Via Venetto was 1 block over, Metro stop aout 10 minute walk and a taxi stand around the corner. They recommended a restaurant right around the corner, San Marco, and we really enjoyed it, ate there all 3 nights! We like to eat aout 6:30 and most restaurants don't open until 7 or 8. San Marco opens at 11 am and is open all day. We didn't really have time to explore the neighborhood as we had all day tours planned each day and we were really tired in the evening. Highly recommend Hotel Golden.

Reviews.Title: “very nice small boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: jr2626
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the hotel golden for the 2 nights before begining our transatlantic cruise and we could not have been happier. the staff was very nice and helpful, suggested place to eat, which bus to take, helped get the internet working on our laptop and most importantly tried to find the luggage the airline lost. the room was very nice and the breakfast was great.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: joe_forbes
Reviews.Content: I have now stayed at this family run hotel a few times and i would not change it for anything,this people are one of the nicest families i have ever met and would recomend their hotel to anybody as you would not be disapointed. joe forbes Yorkshire

Reviews.Title: “Perfect choice”
Reviews.Author: CraneandTuesday
Reviews.Content: Very well run family hotel. We were given excellent restaurant and tour recommendations. The location of the hotel is great -- quiet side street within walking distance to almost everything. We plan to stay here again and have already recommended the hotel to family members.

Reviews.Title: “Very good!”
Reviews.Author: HakanG60
Reviews.Content: It is a very good small family hotel at a very good location. The staff is very friendly and helpfull. Clean and compfartable rooms. I stayed in the familiy room with my wife and 2 children. We were all happy.

Reviews.Title: “The Hotel Golden: What a nice little hotel!”
Reviews.Author: RKCromwell
Reviews.Content: Located on the second floor of a non-descript building, the Hotel Golden is truly a hidden gem. The rooms are well-appointed, the beds are comfortable, the breakfast is home-made, the Internet is free, and the staff, all family members, could not be nicer or more accommodating. Very good value for the Euro and certainly the place where we will again stay when we return to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful stay in Rome...”
Reviews.Author: masonbl
Reviews.Content: We spent four nights at the Hotel Golden in late October. This is a family run small hotel with accommodations for singles, couples and families. It offers a delightful breakfast including meat, cheese and eggs - very uncommon! - in a lovely breakfast room. It is very secure, with a buzz-in entrance at the street and the upstairs door. The brothers Giuseppe and Marco are very competent English speakers, and are very helpful with suggestions, directions, and luckily, in our case, cajoling the airline to get our lost luggage delivered to the hotel. They made many, many calls on our behalf, and thankfully our luggage arrived before we left for our next destination. We were able to see Rome, instead of making the calls to the airline, and we are so grateful for that! One other bonus - there is a laptop available to guests at the front desk! A family member is on the premises at all times. We would definitely go back to the Hotel Golden should we be lucky enough to return to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and clean”
Reviews.Author: dryagonfly
Reviews.Content: This was a nice hotel to stay at during our time in Rome. The service was excellent and all the staff we met were very helpful. The only downside was the size of the room which was a little on the small side for the price we paid. However, it was clean and comfortable to stay at. The bathroom facilities were fine and the Wi-Fi internet connection was good. I think we would probably considering staying here again next time we are in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden gem in the heart of Rome”
Reviews.Author: jedonnell
Reviews.Content: Loved our stay at the Hotel Golden. This is a family run boutique hotel in the heart of Rome. The staff is warm, friendly and helpful. They gave us wonderful recommendations for restaurants, excellent directions for getting around the city, and even made reservations at museums. The breakfast is wonderful! We will definitely stay at the Hotel Golden when we visit Rome again.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Golden is a great value in an excellent location with outstanding service.”
Reviews.Author: foxeysandy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Golden for the second time at the end of October. We had previously stayed for two nights in early June, on a pre-cruise visit with several other couples. Again, we found this hotel to be a great value. The rooms were clean, provided space for hanging clothes and suitcases, hair dryers, excellent temperature control, comfortable bedding and in-room safes. A very good, full breakfast buffet is included in the rate. The location is close to the Spanish Steps, Borghese Gardens and Piazza Barberini. Giuseppe and family were extremely helpful in arranging airport and port transfers, providing maps and routes for sightseeing, assisting with luggage, and in general answering all of our questions.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, great value: Everything you want in a 3-star in Rome”
Reviews.Author: TravelIsPerspective
Reviews.Content: In the past we have been disappointed with reasonably-priced 3-stars in Rome & Paris when we found a room so tiny you trip over your luggage, a grimy window opening on a pigeon-populated airshaft, a shower either too small to turn around in and/or keep the water from spraying all over the floor, or worse yet, no shower at all--just tub. You won't find any of those problems at this clean, friendly, family run hotel. Our room was plenty large, with adequate space for luggage, a big armoire, and even several chairs! The two large, clean windows had modern insulated glass and opened on a cross-street view of a giant bust embedded in the ancient city wall. The extra large bathroom had a perfectly decent shower with great water pressure, and a large-aproned sink as well as a table and chair, providing plenty of those typically-rare horizontal surfaces. The Golden is a reasonably-priced hotel surrounded by the most expensive hotels in Rome. It is family owned and run, and it shows in the clear attention that is paid in providing you with a clean, comfortable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic place to stay”
Reviews.Author: michaelharriott
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay, being so close to all the major sites in Rome. Very friendly family run hotel. Delighted with our choice and have no reservations in recommending it to any others who want to stay in Rome

Reviews.Title: “A Gem in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Froggie2010
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently(Sept of 2010) stayed at The Hotel Golden(Rome) for 3 nights prior to our cruise. We had been referred there by friends. We feel it would be difficult to find a better value than this gem of a place. The family owners are simply wonderful in all aspects. The location is excellent( a few minutes walk from the spanish steps)-the service and friendliness of the staff very accomodating. It is more like a bed and breakfast rather than a large hotel. The facilities are sparkling clean and modern. By the way, the standard Taxi fee from the airport to Rome central is 40 Euros-they will arrange for a driver to pick you up and bring you directly to the hotel. "It is well worth it." Best-location and service. Least -none,(breakfast was very good, not elaborate or lavish) LK from Florida

Reviews.Title: “Golden is the right word for it.”
Reviews.Author: IrishPrincess57
Reviews.Content: This family run inexpensive hotel, located in the "expensive" district of Rome, just outside the Villa Borghese, is the way all hotels should be run. The sibling staff of Marco, Guiseppe & Maria Theresa are fluent in English & warm and welcoming. Marco even helped me with my Italian! Momma & Papa are there too with Momma overseeing the fantastic array of breakfast foods in the morning buffet. Being greeted all day with a warm Buon giorno, it was very difficult saying Arrivederci to this wonderful family. We will definitely stay here again on our next trip to Roma.

Reviews.Title: “When you're here, you're family!”
Reviews.Author: RaySJazz38
Reviews.Content: This small hotel is a GEM for the economy-minded traveler who enjoys personalized care and accurate advice while visiting Rome. The hotel is housed in a late 19th Century renovated building with rooms that include ensuite bath/toilet, air-conditioning/heating among other improvements. The ensuite remodel is a "step-up" addition similar to what you'd find on a cruise ship (probably done to accomodate plumbing.) It has a wonderful "quaint" elevator (size of a small closet) that we truly welcomed and enjoyed. We're elderly and needed a lift. (pun intended) It's located in a quiet neighborhood close to the Borghese Gardens/Museum, bus/subway stops and excellent local restaurants. (Be sure to ask for suggestions on restaurants and public transportation. INVALUABLE!!) This is a family-owned and operated hotel. Marco, Giuseppe and the whole family provide a wonderful feeling of being welcomed and cared for. The customer service is personalized and VERY helpful. Giuseppe and Marco speak excellent English and may even provide some tutoring in Italian if needed. I did and it helped immensely. There's an American chain restaurant that uses the slogan, "When you're here, you're family." That slogan can easily be shared by Hotel Golden and their wonderful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Another great find!”
Reviews.Author: MikJen
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel for 4 nights based on Trip Adviser reviews. An excellent find and we can only agree with all that previous reviewers have said. Quiet, very comfortable room, within 40 minutes walking distance of the most distant sights (Vatican City), with Villa Borghese, Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain, Termini within quarter of an hour's walk. Breakfast's excellent, but best (and most unusual) was the help given by Guiseppe and Marco. Their advice as to the best routes - and the best restaurants - was invaluable. DO try both Trattoria Cadorna for a meal and Lotti's for a nightcap - DONT ignore their unspoken advice to avoid the open top bus. We did - spent most of the morning in a traffic jam trying to understand a broken "wireless" guide and found that getting off and walking was muchg more fun and healthier!!.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: lctsf
Reviews.Content: Hotel Golden is a rare find. Very helpful English speaking staff, clean rooms and a great location. The spanish steps are only a 10 minute walk and other attractions are close by. The subway is down the street and there is a bus stop right around the corner. The 116 bus stops at all the major attractions for only 1 euro. For solo travelers, the location is very safe and I felt very comfortable walking to and from the hotel, even at night. I am looking forward to returning to Rome and staying at Hotel Golden again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location, great service, great value!”
Reviews.Author: HarryB_Ottawa_Canada
Reviews.Content: We were not sure what to expect as we reserved at the last minute on the advice of another hotelier, but wanted a clean large suite near everything in Rome at a reasonable price - and we got what we wished for! Helpful front desk, great breakfasts to start our long walks, and only a block from the Villa Borghese one way and the Via Vittorio Veneto the other. The room was clean and large, and at a great price, especially after our stay in Venice! Highly recommended - we like family run hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet retreat in good location”
Reviews.Author: aledowalls
Reviews.Content: This family owned hotel is managed by brothers, Giuseppe and Marco. Marco helped us greatly upon arrival when we had difficulty with the charges of our cab. Our room, a double superior room, was extremely spacious and clean, with a view towards the back of the Villa Borghese Gardens. It was located on a quiet street, just a block or so from more major thoroughfares, about an easy and enjoyable 20 minute walk to the Spanish Steps from above and behind them. The bathroom was extremely spacious by European standards. Both Marco and Giuseppe were very helpful recommending local family owned dining establishments. We love staying at family owned hotels and this was a very enjoyable experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay”
Reviews.Author: loveitaly95
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Golden when we came into Rome and came back when we were leaving. What a nice place, safe,clean and good location. Guiseppe, Marco, Maria Theresa, mom and dad were GREAT!!! Great service. My mom love them all. This hotel for the price,and location is a must for Rome. It is near shopping, good restaurants and convenience of the location is a must. Guiseppe also help my husband out with the Italian language classes. We are coming back in May 2011 and will stay in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with friendly and helpful service”
Reviews.Author: VK13
Reviews.Content: Well located off Via Vittorio Veneto and near Borghese Park. Family run and service is very good. Located on a first floor which is a bit odd but not a problem and there is an elevator if you need it. Only downside is that the small rooms are really small. If you're only looking for a bed then not a problem. Small restaurant too for breakfast so you may have to wait for a table at peak times. Buffet breakfast can become a little tiring after first couple of days. Location is great although don't expect to find many "cheap" restaurants nearby. Well decorated, very clean, reasonable bar prices and the brothers that run the hotel are first class. English is spoken and happy to recommend places to eat etc. Local transport links are good and the little 116 bus is a God send.look out for it. Everything you need is within reasonable distance.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bjcoan
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Hotel Golden for 4 nights and found it to be a great hotel. We arrived at 9am and found our room was ready and we had been upgraded to a deluxe room. I found it very roomy with a large bathroom. The room was quiet and clean and slept great every night. The family running the hotel was friendly and helpful. Its location is great we walked to everything in Rome. The breakfast was great and have no complaints. I highly recommend the Hotel Golden and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and great family run hotel”
Reviews.Author: JBP1111
Reviews.Content: If you are going to Rome, look no further than the Hotel Golden. Guiseppe and his family run a first class hotel. They are extremely helpful on recommended great restaurants and giving directions. Also, their breakfast is first class, especially for Rome standards. I have nothing but positive things to state about this hotel. The rooms are small, but that is pretty much standard for most places in Italy. It is a great hotel and great value in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Trustworthy, friendly, good old fashioned hospitality! Would stay again!”
Reviews.Author: LizzieandIzzy
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Golden for four nights, 16-19 Settembre this year, on my very first trip to Roma. I was so pleased to be met by friendly, accommodating, knowledgeable, and I admit, English-speaking staff. Giuseppe and his sister and brother, who run the hotel, could not have been more caring about whether or not I had a good time in their city. After paying E70 for the cab ride from Fiumicino Airport to the Hotel, Giuseppe informed me that the driver had ripped me off--there is a flat rate for E40 by which drivers are legally bound to abide. I was disgusted. For this reason, he and his siblings arrange for their guests to be picked up at the airport. Little did I realize that that was the reason why. On departure, I did use that service and was pleased to tip the driver well for not ripping me off!!! After my experience with the thief cab driver, I think Giuseppe understood I was naive (even for a New Yorker!) and tried to help me manage his frenetic, crazy, "chancey" city as best he could, with explicit instructions for walking to Villa Borghese, getting to the Metro, finding a special flea market on 19 Sett. He could not have been more kind. Sleeping: The bed, I have to say, must have been nearly brand new--the mattress was nice and "hard" (supportive). I had the best nights' sleep in my two weeks in Italy. It was so terrific that I even commented on it to Mr. Giuseppe. The windows in the small room were excellent, thick enough to block out the evening noise in conjunction with its A+ air conditioning. The bathroom was rather large, I thought, for a single, by Italian standards and even contained a bidet. Little extras like a disposable razor and callous-softening rock were included with the bath give-aways--a very nice surprise, and meaningful for people traveling from countries where you're not allowed to bring razors, scissors, tweezers, etc. on the plane. The little dish of individually wrapped candies was great, too--especially because the candies were delicious. They weren't just junk put there for show. You could tell that your hosts really wanted to make your stay as pleasant as possible. There did come with the room a free breakfast, but unfortunately I never rose early enough to partake of it -- it was vacation after all -- so I'm sorry, but I can't comment on that. But if it follows the kind of standards of service and generosity that the rest of the experience provided by the hotel does, I venture it must be terrific. Over all, although I really didn't like Rome itself -- too frenetic and crazy, not relaxing at all! -- if I ever go back, I would stay at Hotel Golden Rome again. Worth every penny, in a beautiful neighborhood, near buses and the Metro, just a 15 minute walk from the Villa Borghese Museo; two and a half blocks from the bank; two blocks from Harry's Bar and the gorgeous Via Veneto....it was charming and professional and lovely. Thank you, Giuseppe and family, for rescuing my trip to Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Clean Hotel in a Safe Location Within Convenient Distance to Tourist Sites”
Reviews.Author: PhillyTraveler8
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Hotel Golden for 3 different nights during the last week of August/first week of September 2010. I selected Hotel Golden after reading countless reviews on Trip Advisor for various hotels in Rome. I was looking for a hotel that was in a safe location, clean and reasonably priced. Hotel Golden fit the bill. The hotel is located one block off of the Via Veneto (one of the most expensive and exclusive streets in Rome). I felt extremely safe walking to and from the hotel at all hours. We paid 70 Euros a night for two of the nights (i.e. approx $91 USD) & 90 euros for one night (i.e. approx $116 USD) for a small double room. Be aware- a small double room is extremely small. It had a double bed in it and maybe 2 feet walking space around 2 sides of the bed (2 sides were against the wall) and that was the entire room. The bathroom was also extremely small – you could barely move in the shower (I wouldn't recommend this size room for a very tall or larger person). I don't think the room size was out of the ordinary for Europe (although the hotel rooms we stayed in Venice & Positano were much larger) but you should be aware of it. The breakfast was good (the best one out of the 3 different hotels we stayed at in Italy). Breakfast was a simple assortment of breads, eggs, yogurt, cereal, coffee/tea/juice. The hotel is located on one floor of an office building (you have to get buzzed to enter the building) and then buzzed again to enter the actual hotel. There is an old elevator that worked just fine for getting our bags to the hotel (which was on the second floor). We arranged through the hotel for a taxi to pick us up from the airport for 40 Euros (cash, including tax, tip & luggage). The driver was waiting for us when we got out of customs with a sign with my name on it. Driver was courteous and the ride to the hotel was fine- took about 40 minutes. The car wasn't a black sedan (as the hotel's e-mail said) - just a regular taxi but it was fine. I believe 40 euros is the standard rate from the airport to downtown Rome (I saw this price advertised elsewhere) so I think you can get this rate if you don't go through the hotel but it was convenient to have the taxi waiting for us and know that it had been arranged through the hotel. The staff was ok- not overly friendly as other reviewers have said – they did not go out of their way to welcome us but were fine to interact with. They gave us a map of Rome and showed us suggested routes to walk. We walked to all the main sites from the hotel (Spanish Steps about 15 minutes, Colosseum, about 45 minutes, Piazza Navona about 45 minutes, Vatican about 1 hour 15 minutes). A cab ride from the Termini Train station was about 10-12 euros (including 2 bags). The hotel was clean and the air conditioning worked well. There was a computer with internet in the lobby that you could use for free (although 2 of the nights the internet didn't work and the woman at the desk told us she didn't know how to fix it and it's been broken for 3 years. This didn't make sense to us since the next night we stayed there it worked fine). I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for an inexpensive clean hotel in a safe location.

Reviews.Title: “A FABULOUS FAMILY OWNED HOTEL WITH COURTEOUS SERVICE”
Reviews.Author: Shawnsee
Reviews.Content: We were not sure of where to stay and searched many hotels within our budget. We came across this hotel and read many of the other reviews. We contacted Hotel Golden and had an immediate response with a lot of information given. We booked our room and were pleasantly surprised at the hospitality. The driver they sent to pick us up at the airport was a great added feature they provided us. The staff were generous and kind and I would definately recommend this hotel to everyone. Family owned, clean, and so centrally located we walked every where from the hotel. The staff were eager to help us map our way around the city and provided us with maps. Superb stay....Thanks Hotel Golden.

Reviews.Title: “Golden time in Rome and Golden Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tp136
Reviews.Content: I can not say enough to describe how wonderful our stay was at the Golden Hotel. You felt like you were part of the family. The rooms were comfortable and clean, it is located in a quiet area but centrally located. The service was special and everyone at the Golden Hotel was wonderful. Kind, caring and hard working to make your stay special. We will definitly return someday and stay at the Golden Hotel. I threw my coins in the Trevi Fountain to assure that this happens. I would highly recommend The Hotel Golden

Reviews.Title: “Once visited, you wouldn't want to stay anywhere else in Rome.”
Reviews.Author: travellingr0sie
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here on a celebratory trip for our Ruby wedding anniversary.We would echo all the good things that have been written about the hotel Golden especially the family who run the hotel.They are outstandingly helpful and just want visitors to have the best time possible in Rome. As this was a special visit for us, Guiseppe had organised an upgrade of room as a surprise and even organised flowers by prior request from our family. Room 111 was spacious,comfortable and spotlessly clean. The hotel is in an area convenient for some main tourist spots and also quieter walks. We have already recommended this hotel to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Professional Hosts - Guiseppe, Maria and Marco - Outstanding service”
Reviews.Author: ravidadhich
Reviews.Content: Golden Hotel was recommended by a friend of mine. When we arrived (with my family - wife and eleven year old daughter) we greeted with a warm and a welcoming smile from Maria (one of the three owners sibling owners of the hotel). The room was clean, spacious and bed was comfortable. Since we were planning some back-pack trips to Capri, Venice, I asked Guiseppe to help me find a good B&B. Guiseppe was more than kind to actually start making the calls and speaking to hotel owners in Capri and then in Venice to get us a good safe place. He easily spent a few hours for each location and found us a very nice and comfortable B&B. In addition, he was more than willing to hold our luggage while we traveled to Capri and Venice. On our return, the rooms were ready and all our luggage placed in the rooms. Marco was very helpful with guiding us to some of the best restaurants around the hotel. This is a great place to stay in Rome, as the location is perfect, and above all the service rendered by the brother sister team is top notch. Thank you Guiseppe, Maria and Marco - will see you next year. Ravi, Hannah and Maiaa

Reviews.Title: “Superb family service. Nothing too much trouble. Great spot.”
Reviews.Author: Topsy107
Reviews.Content: Small family run hotel, just off the top of the Via Veneto and very near to Villa Borghese park. Quiet side street. Easy to walk to all sights. Staff could not have been more friendly or helpful with maps, advice, carrying bags, etc. Room was plenty big enough even with extra bed for kids. Spotlessly clean. Breakfast buffet was delicious with a big selection of tempting bites. Fantastic find. Would definitely go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place - quaint, friendly, and would stay there again in a heartbeat”
Reviews.Author: atravelingbug
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights prior to a 12 night cruise. We had contacted them via email several times prior to our trip to ask questions and they always responded promptly - usually within a few hours. We used their transportation they arranged from airport to hotel and hotel to cruise port. We waited awhile for the guy at the airport, but that was of no fault of Golden Hotel - the driver was not standing in the area mentioned with our name. A quick call to Golden Hotel and the driver came to find us. The trip to the port was fine, he arrived on time. Guiseppe was so very helpful - as was Marco. We always felt safe in the hotel and area surrounding. The American Embassy is around the corner as is a police station. I would have felt safe walking anywhere around the hotel at any hour of the day or night alone. You have to be buzzed into the building, then buzzed into the actual floor the hotel is on. There is always someone at the front dest to welcome you. They kept the key so you didn't have to worry about losing it while touring around Rome. They recommended two restaurants that were wonderful - can't say enough about San Marco - pizza is excellent as is the four cheese gnocchi. All questions we had they had answers to or found out the answer. One of our friends birthday was the day we left and Guiseppe helped with part of our surprise. Marco helped us with all of our luggage (it was a ton)! We had three rooms and I don't think any of them were unusally small - I have stayed in a room in New York with three other people and our rooms this trip looked expansive compared to that. There was plenty of bathroom shelves to put our toiletries on. Our air conditioner worked well and it was very quiet at night. The breakfast room is small, but the food was great. There were many more options at this hotel than there were in our bed and breakfast in Venice - and the food was much better. The price was great and the hotel was very clean. The Spanish Steps are the closest tourist attraction - and they are about 10 min away, as is the closest Metro station (which we used to go to the Vatican).

Reviews.Title: “Friendly budget hotel in centre of rome”
Reviews.Author: soyguapo15
Reviews.Content: This hotel was excellent value. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful, good breakfast included and very clean rooms. The rooms were quite small and the hotel is up a hill so walking in the July heat from the main tourist sites was hard work. However, the hotel is 10 minutes from the spanish steps and from there you have all other sites within walking distance. Would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “We had a great holiday in this hotel near green oasis of Villa Borghese and within walking distance to historic centre.”
Reviews.Author: Ando60
Reviews.Content: This was a very friendly small family run hotel near Via Veneto and the Villa Borghese and it was only a comfortable 15 minute walk to the Trevi or the Spanish Steps. It was a longer but easy, pleasant and interesting walk to the big sights of the Centro Historica such as the Colosseum and forum. The nearest metro stop is only five minutes walk away at Barbarini and we used the metro to get to the Vatican Museum although that too would have been walkable. The streets near the hotel are much quieter than the main tourist areas but the nearby Via Veneto is a long leafy boulevard with plenty of restaurants. We chose this hotel largely because of its location close to the Villa Borghese and its park and a good write up by previous visitors on the tripadvisor website. We were not disappointed either in the hotel or the area. The staff in the hotel were very friendly, Marco and introducing himself and his brother Giuseppe by name and only too willing to give directions and to ask how we were getting on - also to help visitors connect to the free wi-fi as our ipod-toting son will testify. Our first floor triple room was spacious and although we were initially disappointed that its window looked on to an internal courtyard and so didn't have a view or much natural light it was clean and comfortable. Even though ours was the first room along from the lobby it was quiet and we were never disturbed. There was a good shower and there was never a shortage of hot water.Thankfully the room was air-conditioned as the temperatures hit 32 c (90 F) but the unit did tend to drip. The breakfast buffet was great with good coffee or tea, juice, cereals, breads, very good cakes, eggs and omelette, cheese, cold meats, croissant and delicious cakes. The breakfast room is a bit small but cosy and welcoming and we only had to wait to be seated for 5 minutes on one day out of four. We never felt like we were being rushed to finish breakfast and we always lingered to plan the day and have an extra coffee. Although the Villa Borghese park and hotel appear on the map to be seperated by a large main road, don't be put off as it has good crossing points for pedestrians and the park is a beautiful, cool shady oasis on hot Summer days, largely traffic-free and as safe - early mornings saw runners and walkers using it before the temperature rose and in the evenings many locals seemed to stroll through it. It was a good place to relax after visiting the city centre and our near-teenage son enjoyed it - there are a couple of cafes, bike hire and plenty of space to play or rest. I managed to run every morning but was glad of the drinking fountains dotted around the paths. We had arrived at Fiumcino airport early afternoon and took the train into the central Rome station at Termini. It seemed like a long walk with our cases in the heat from our platform to the central metro stop. When we left we asked Marco to arrange for a car to take us to the airport - it only cost 45 euro which was what the train and metro fares had cost us for the outward journey and was good value. As our flight home was in the evening, the hotel looked after our baggage so we could enjoy our final day unhindered. We were collected by a small air-conditioned mini-bus and driven through central Rome, getting a bonus tour of the centre and it only took about forty minutes to get to the airport terminal. Tips: buy a Roma Card (25 euro for an adult) for free entry to two museums and free travel on metro, trains and buses for three days. It spared us the very long queue at the Colosseum - you can get the card from the Tourist Information offices or kiosks. Children from EU countries get free entry in to some museums but may be asked to show proof (our son wasn't at the Colosseum but would have had to join the admittedly shorter queue for the Palatine Hill to get a free ticket, so we skipped that). We only had to queue for less than 30 minutes to get in to the Vatican museum and we think that it was because we went on the Wednesday morning when a lot of people chose to go to see the papal blessing first - the tour touts (offering guided tours of the museum for 45 euro) had told us that there was a two hour wait when we joined the queue but they must have been mistaken! If you're in Rome for a week then we'd recommend that you spare half a day to visit the ruins of the roman port at Ostia Attica about 30 minutes from Termini by metro and train. Lido Central is a short distance further on the same train line and although our guidebook was a bit disparaging about the town, the beach was good - albeit much of it is effectively private (10 euro per person per day but we got on half price as we only arrived mid-afternoon) and there are public areas but they were busier. We also had our most enjoyable evening meal there at the Golden Cafe (the name is just a coincidence) for about half the price of the meals in Rome. We have recommended this hotel to our friends and would use it again if we visited Rome again - which we hope to do because it was terrific. So great holiday and lovely hotel!

Reviews.Title: “I'll never stay anywhere else in Rome.”
Reviews.Author: taryn615
Reviews.Content: I live near Pisa and travel to Rome frequently when friends and family come to visit. This was my second stay at the hotel and I enjoyed it just as much as the first. Both times, I stayed in the triple room, just off the main lobby area. The room is spacious by European standards, with plenty of space for me and my 2 friends. The shower is great -- warm water and lovely water pressure -- after a long, tiring day of sight seeing. Beds are comfy. Air conditioning works well and was quiet in our room. (I know other reviewers have had different experiences.) The family that runs the hotel is great, always ready and willing to offer tips and suggestions. They genuinely want their guests to have the best visit to Rome possible. It is a bit of a hike to even the closest sights... Spanish Steps are 10 minutes away, Trevi Fountain is a 10-15 minute walk -- downhill on your way there but very much uphill on your way back. Everything else was far enough away that we took the metro. The closest stations are again, 10 minutes or so from the hotel. The hotel sits just behind several 5-star hotels. Nice in theory, except that every restaurant in the area seemed to be over priced and not that great. We had to venture as far as the Pantheon area (30-45 minute walk) to find good, authentic and affordable Italian food. The silver lining is that the area is VERY safe and quiet though. I've walked back to the hotel after midnight and never felt uncomfortable. You also don't get any street noise like you might at a hotel in a busier part of Rome. I've been so pleased with both of my stays, I'd be hard pressed to stay anywhere else when back in Rome. They'd have to be booked solid for me to even think about looking anywhere else. If you don't mind a walk at the beginning and end of your day, this is a brilliant hotel. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Charming, family-run hotel in excllent location”
Reviews.Author: TheTravellingPeleton
Reviews.Content: This is a small, family-run hotel in an excellent location near the Villa Borghese park. The family owners were extremely hospitable and helped with all our sightseeing and travel enquiries. Very reasonable rates including a good breakfast. We can also recommend the airport pickup service; delightful driver who gave us a sightseeing tour as part of the journey.

Reviews.Title: “Everything was great except the air conditioner!”
Reviews.Author: ssparkyg
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights at the beginning of a 3 week trip to Italy and France. We chose Hotel Golden because of it's quiet location to sleep off our jet lag. Unfortunately, the air conditioner fan, which did it's job keeping the room cool, made uneven noise during the night. The noise kept us from getting some of the sleep we hoped to get. Other than that, this hotel is well located, well priced and a real gem. The family that runs the hotel is always available and the breakfast (provided) was excellent. i would recommend this hotel. Just check the air conditioner before you take the room!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: rmgronsky
Reviews.Content: The room we stayed in was small by American standards but had everything that you could need. The breakfast buffet was very good with a lot of choices. The owners were really helpful and speak good English. The location was not as central to the main tourist attractions as I would have liked - it's near the Borghese Park but a 10 minutes walk to the nearest public transportation (we used both the bus and the subway). On the whole, with the caveat about location, I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone who wants a good value for their money.

Reviews.Title: “Really Nice”
Reviews.Author: RobinFromNY
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at this hotel. We booked the most basic room and it was cozy, but it was certainly fine for just the two of us and they kept everything very clean. It shares a lobby entrance with several other places and on evenings and weekends you need to be buzzed into the building. You also need to be buzzed into the lobby of the hotel itself. We found this a nice added security measure. It's located just one block off of Via Veneto so there are plenty of places to eat nearby and the metro is down the road. The family that runs the hotel is very nice and the breakfast was good. The brothers are very helpful in terms of recommending restaurants, transportation, places to visit etc. There english is EXCELLENT. It was REALLY hot while we were in Rome and the air conditioning in the room worked wonderfully (not loud and we could control the temperature). We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: MaggieWWashington_DC
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Hotel Golden during part of our honeymoon and had a marvelous time. The hotel was beautifully decorated, clean, new and quiet. The staff was also very friendly and accommodating (they arranged our airport transportation, and even provided ice when our feet were achy at the end of the day!). Breakfast was good - yogurt, fresh fruit, pastries, meats, cereals, coffee, juice, etc. The bathroom was modern and very clean. The hotel also had good security, and offered a computer with internet access in the front lobby. Although it is not in the heart of the historic center of Rome, it is in a very nice area of town, right next to the Villa Borghese and Spanish Steps. We would recommend this hotel to friends and family!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: Logan25
Reviews.Content: I booked the Hotel Golden based on the many good reviews on Trip Advisor and was not disappointed. Hotel Golden is in a great area by the Borghese Gardens and Via Veneto is one block away with many nice shops and restaurants. You can walk to many attractions. The room was small but I must say it is one of the cleanest hotels I have ever stayed in. The bathroom was huge and spotless. The hotel is on the 1st floor of a building but is very quiet. We didn't hear a sound from inside or outside. The breakfasts were lovely with a good selection. The family that runs the hotel were very nice and helpful. We only stayed 2 nights and weren't in our room for much of it but I have no complaints. They arranged for us to be picked up at the airport and the driver was there waiting and took our heavy luggage right to the front desk for us. We asked rather late in the day for a taxi for the next morning to take us back to the airport to pick up our rental car and there was no problem. The taxi was booked and arrived right on time. I would highly recommend the Hotel Golden to anyone going to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “OK but nothing special”
Reviews.Author: robocop646
Reviews.Content: Rome is expensive so the Golden Hotel was good value. We were however troubled by the fact that we ordered a pickup at 40 Euro by car from the Airport arranged by the hotel. A van arrived which took us and 4 others on a circuitous route taking twice the time it would have been by taxi which would have been 30Euro. This was a rip-off!. The conducted tour buses were also a rip-off and not worth the money. No conducted tour just earphones which did not work. The hotel room was OK and near to the centre of things but this was not really a hotel, more a number of apartments on the first floor of a building. That being said for a short stay it was better than the pretentious hotels we saw elsewhere. The staff or family we saw were helpful but we found the breakfast room cramped. Food adequate. Sleep was OK providing windows kept shut and air conditioning on.

Reviews.Title: “Okay location & very modern clean room”
Reviews.Author: milka_73
Reviews.Content: I chose Hotel Golden because of all the great reviews, but I will not stay at the hotel again. Positives: Indeed, the hotel was very clean, decorated very well, air conditioned, room size was adequate. The location was good if you don't mind taking a public transportation. There are many 5 star hotels around the neighborhood. I have to say that the family is trying to do their best to maintain the hotel. I was especially impressed with the great manner with one of the sons who was at the reception. Recommended for senior travellors & families. Negatives: Service and Room - Perhaps, I just did not have a luck. The room I stayed had a lock issue. I had to ask help to close/open the room each time I go out and come back. To be fair, the son (at the reception) admitted the lock problem and he did not mind at all to help opening/closing the room. However, the father and the another son gave me an attitude that they knew how to close/open the room, but not me. Isn't it hotel's responsibility to make a room where any customers can access easily? Another thing is that I had to receive a receipt because I paid in cash. My check-out time was 8 am and the father said that i had to wait 15 minutes more as he did not know how & his son will arrive in 15 minutes.. I was unable to wait because I had to catch a train to the airport. It might be a cultural difference, but I will probably feel differently if he ever said 'sorry for the trouble'. He just looked at me as if I was wrong to ask for a receipt.

Reviews.Title: “Reason to return to Rome”
Reviews.Author: travelilnrose
Reviews.Content: Hotel Golden occupies one floor of a six story building. The owners live on site and are always readily available to give directions, suggestions, make reservations, etc. They are a warm and welcoming family and make guests feel at home. The neighborhood is residential and quiet. We had lots of non-touristy restaurants to choose from and never felt afraid to be out late at night. The hotel is in easy walking distance of bus stops and getting around is no problem. The breakfast buffet has limited choices, but no one ever went hungry. We had the largest and nicest bathroom we have ever had anywhere in Europe. The hotel is non-smoking and getting to stay there again is reason enough to return to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location & very helpful owners/hosts”
Reviews.Author: PSavant
Reviews.Content: Hotel Golden has a very convenient location - almost on Via Venito near the Villa Borghese. There is a taxi stand round the corner & the train station - Roma Termini - is not too far - about 15 Euro by taxi. The owners/hosts are very helpful & friendly. They helped us with our baggage during check-in and check-out and, on check-in, we were given a map of Rome with suggestions and tips for sight-seeing and dining. We could not get a family room which I was told is larger. We were 4 of us (2 adults + 2 children) in 1 room which was a little tight. The breakfast was ok and the internet access on the lap-top at the reception was most convenient. We had booked tickets for a football match on-line. The tickets were delivered at the hotel before we arrived and the hotel had carefully kept them for us till we arrived and checked-in.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel – no luxury suite”
Reviews.Author: jwcde
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Golden is well situated near the Borghese Park near the center of Rome. You can reach most monuments and sights by foot if you like. The rooms are small however offer everything you need. The breakfast was more than Italian less than American I would say. It is served in a quite small backroom with no windows. For a fast Café and a Biscotti fine – but no welcoming breakfast/brunch area at all. The owner is very nice and helpful. All together a decent place to stay. Considering the price I would have expected more.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: stevieboyUk
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from 5 nights at this hotel. The reviews really do reflect the hotel. The overriding impression we were left with was the helpfulness of the staff. The pick-ups they arranged from and to the airport went without a hitch with drivers who gave us a history lesson as we came into Rome and did not even expect a tip. It was the best transfer we have ever had. The brothers could not have been more helpful with help with directions, bookings, general advice, in fact anything. It is not often that we have received that kind of help from a hotel. We had a small double room. And it was small. However we knew that before we went and as not much time was spent in the room it is not an issue. However if you do intend to spend time in the room in the evenings then go for a larger room. Saying that, it was kept immaculately clean and the double glazing was 100% perfect at removing any street noise. Aircon was much needed as it was hot in Rome! The breakfast room was small but we always got a table. After 5 days of the same breakfast though we got a little tired of it. Some variety would have been nice. The hotel is near enough to walk everywhere, but if you are not great at walking the further sites such as the Vatican are reached fairly easily by Metro. It was never a problem for us. As other reviews mention the San Marco restaurant is just fantastic - so much so we ate there every night. The menu is varied enough for that. Also opposite the hotel is Cafe Lotti, a great family run deli with tables outside. Great for a coffee or a glass of wine. Just to highlight the differences in prices in Rome a cappuccino here was 2.5 euros sitting outside. 1 minute walk away on the Via Venetto at Harry's Bar it was 10 euros!! All in all a great hotel in a great location with seriously helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Tripadvisor was helpfull again. Nice place to stay with family”
Reviews.Author: Motohtori
Reviews.Content: Ok place. service exellent. Clean. Go there.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet Location for people who don't mind a walk”
Reviews.Author: ali1125
Reviews.Content: This is a great place to stay in Rome. They give you information on the lay of the land and how to access wherever you wish to go. The metro is easy to access, an entrance only a block away but a walk to the actual train. You can walk to most all of Rome, but may not be easy if you don't like walking. Hotel Golden provides all the basics, toiletries, hair dryer, breakfast which includes cereal, yogurt , pastries and coffee/tea. You leave keys at the desk when you leave your room and they keep them for you. The building is secure with a buzzer system. I wouldn't use the safe as anyone with access to the room could pick it up and walk off with it. It was nice and quiet for sleeping as the neighborhood is not too loud. I would stay here again. If you like to be right where the action is as well as the noise that goes with that, this is not the place for you. There is a computer available with internet access if need be. We also got internet access in our room for a blackberry.

Reviews.Title: “Stay in home in Rome”
Reviews.Author: cida
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed at Hotel Golden in Rome for 4 days, and recomend this hotel. It is dificult to find good hotels in Rome for a reasonable price, and in a good location. The Hotel Golden is very clean, the rooms are very spacious, the bath room is very nice, the rooms are quiet because the windows are soundproof and the breakfast is very nice. The family that runs the hotel live there and take care of every detail. Giuseppe is very helpful, he told us about everything, how to go to the places, what bus or metro take, the restaurants. The hotel is one block from Via Veneto, from Vila Borghese, can walk to Piazza de Spagna. There is a restaurant very good near the hotel called S. Marco. We love stay at Hotel Golden, I make the reservation based on the reviews I read at Trip Advisor, and they are really true. Cida

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, Affordable, Clean, Excellent Location!! Will come again!!”
Reviews.Author: Pamela1982
Reviews.Content: My mother and I stayed at the Hotel Golden in August 2009 and it was definitely the right choice!! I found this hotel through these recommendations on trip advisor and trust me...we are happy we did as this hotel is fantastic!! We stayed for 3 nights in Rome before heading down to Sicily to visit relatives. The hotel is in a fantastic spot (walking distance to sights, or if you wish, a short walk to the subway), and at an excellent price. The rooms were impeccably clean, a great breakfast in the morning, and the lady who works at the front desk (i forgot her name) is so wonderful. My mother and I chatted with her and she was able to help us with directions to the monuments we wanted to see and was so personable. We felt like we were staying with family. We will definitely come back to this hotel the next time we visit rome. I am a 28 year old woman and would not hesitate to stay alone in this hotel if I come to Rome on my own. Fantastic, safe, perfect experience. Thank you so much to this hotel and their amazing staff!

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommend!”
Reviews.Author: Lisa20100702
Reviews.Content: Location is ideal. Service was superb--very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Golden - A Real Gem!”
Reviews.Author: Molleee
Reviews.Content: Hotel Golden is in a great location in a posh neighborhood - Upon arrival we were given a map with directions to restaurants, tourist hot spots, etc. The front desk man gave us detailed instructions on how to get to Trastavere (complete with bus stops!). It was amazing. The room was gorgeous. When we opened the window we saw a statue right outside - we couldn't believe how lucky we got with the room view! The room came with robes and slippers, a tv, minibar - just about everything you need. I loved this hotel and could have stayed another month there. It's family run and you can feel the camaraderie and love they share. When I come back to Rome I will definitely be staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Homey, welcoming, and convenient family run establishment”
Reviews.Author: cammy226
Reviews.Content: My husband and I visited Rome in March for our honeymoon. We stayed for 3 nights. As soon as we arrived, Marco made us feel very welcome, as if we were guests of his own home. He even upgraded our room for us. We expected our room to be small according to the horror stories we had heard regarding hotels in Rome, but to our surprise it was very spacious, accommodating and most importantly clean! The only negative is that the shower was small and confined (but I think thats a European thing). Our room was on a street, but with the window's closed we couldn't hear a thing. There's free Wi-Fi available. Free breakfast also available, consisting of fresh pastries, meats, fruits, coffee, juices, etc. replenished frequently. Customer service is impeccable. Marco and his brother are very helpful in advising you on what sites to see, and the best way to get there. We were able to walk to the Spanish Steps, and Trevi Fountain, and to many great places to eat. We had our tour's pre-arranged, but I'm sure they would be very helpful in advising you in this regard as well. The Colosseum as well as Vatican City are just a short cab ride away, or if you want you can use the bus system to save money. All in all, we enjoyed our stay at Hotel Golden and would definitely stay here again if we're ever in Rome again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic, Welcoming and Friendly!”
Reviews.Author: mwcarpediem
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from a 4 night stay at this wonderful little Roman Hotel. From the minute we arrived, the family run establishment could not do enough to make our stay any more pleasant. The room we were allocated was spacious, exceptionally clean and had a magnificent view of the Aurelian Wall directly behind the hotel. Breakfast was a treat, with a plentiful supply of enough variety to tempt any traveller. Located within easy walking distance of Rome's main tourist attractions (10mins from Spanish Steps) it will provide any traveller with all they could need to enjoy their stay in the "Eternal City". If you do travel to the hotel, make the most of the Villa Borghese park right on your doorstep. The beautiful walk through the park to the Pinchio lookout over Piazza Del Popolo, with its fantastic view over the whole city is a must!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience AT HOTEL GOLDEN”
Reviews.Author: RMelendez
Reviews.Content: I had a great time in Rome. One of the things that made my visit truly amazing was choosing to stay at Hotel Golden. My sister and I stayed at Hotel Golden with my two sons (Ages 8 and 4). The hotel is very quaint, clean, and in a great location. The Spanish Steps is just a 15 minute walk from the hotel. A light breakfast consisting of danishes, yogurt, fruit, and chesse is served every morning and the hotel staff was very accomodating. Marco and Guiseppie arranged all of our tours, gave excellent directions to the local sights, and even suggested great restaurants for us to dine in. Most importantly, the cost of this hotel, for the service we received, is excellent for the frugal traveler. The next time I am in Rome, I will definitely stay at Hotel Golden.

Reviews.Title: “Anytime You're in Rome, Stay at the Hotel Golden (nr Borghese Gardens)”
Reviews.Author: ukchic1
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Hotel Golden in Rome was fabulous. Located right outside the Borghese Gardens in Northern Rome, the hotel is perfectly situated. All the rooms had soundproof doors and windows so we didn't hear any noise from the street. All the rooms are well appointed and very clean and spacious (by Rome standards). We stayed in the new 2-bedroom suite, which was much larger and more newly decorated than the other rooms. A little more modern. There is an elevator at the Hotel, which really helps if you have a lot of bags. The Hotel staff--Marco & Guiseppe--were terrific and spoke fantastic English. They answered all our questions and were extremely helpful in assisting us in getting around to sights, finding restaurants, calling cabs etc. They were just like our extended family and made us feel most welcome. Nothing was too much trouble. Could not fault them at all. Breakfast was served in the small dining area, but was much better than just a basic continental - eggs, cereal, juice, pastries, fruit, cold meats and cheese. Everything was fresh and replenished frequently. All the major sights (Colosseum etc) were a short cab ride away, or walkable. We made it to the Spanish Steps and Trevi Fountain in under 10 mins walking - the Hotel provides a great map. Hotel also provides free WiFi connection to all guests (throughout the Hotel), and has an internet point at the front desk as well. All in all, this Hotel was great value and the customer service top notch. If you want a memorable experience in Rome, stay with the Hotel Golden...Via Marche 84.

Reviews.Title: “Really, really great!”
Reviews.Author: kathy_and_lauraa
Reviews.Content: Hotel Golden is a very small and sweet family run hotel, Marco was very very helpful in recommending restaurants and shops, and he helped us with any queries we had about anything. He always gave us a nice smile whenever we walked in and a great welcome. Marco organised for us to get picked up from the airport, and dropped off to the train station at the end of our visit. The other family members are very helpful, we had a great breakfast each morning in the little breakfast room which was cute but a bit cramped. We had a twin room and a double, both were lovely with good colour schemes. The rooms were clean, secure, and the service was excellent. Marco spent a while helping me to get my internet working, and we got to use it in our room whenever. You can really feel safe here, with 3 locked doors between you and the street. It was also very quiet. I loved every bit of the stay here and would easily recommend it to other travellers who are looking for great service and small but nice rooms in a good location off the Via Veneto.

Reviews.Title: “Cosy, comfortable and convenient”
Reviews.Author: MMcMDublin_Ireland
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel having read all the positive comments on Trip Advisor and were not disappointed. We were welcomed warmly and given maps, information and a nice, comfortable, clean room. Breakfast was a buffet which was fresh and varied and set us on our way. The hotel is well located beside bus and metro stops, approx 5 or 10 minutes walk from each. Would not hesitate to stay here again when we return!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: maradem
Reviews.Content: Perfect location for sighseeing highlights of Rome. Very clean rooms, no tea or coffemaking facilities. Average breakfast. Can be little noisy, we had not problems with it. Nice staff(sometimes old man little grumpy!)

Reviews.Title: “Its trully a pearl in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: Hobie-Acores
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for 4 nights with my wife and we loved. The location is ok, its close to the bus stop in Via Venneto, make sure you get the bus # 63 to go downtown. The rooms are small but very clean and quiet. The only thing is the breakfast the room is small and the food quantaty could be better. The two brothers at the reception they are friendly and will guide with good tips to get aroung Rome. Conclusion: For the price...I dont think I will get better and can no complain!

Reviews.Title: “Truly Golden!”
Reviews.Author: efp
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Golden for a week this January. In January 2009 we stayed in a four-star hotel in the same area (Hotel Ludovisi Palace) and absolutely loved the area. Since we were on a tighter budget this year, we were looking for less expensive accommodation in the same district. We chose this hotel based on great reviews on both Tripadvisor and Booking.com and would absolutely stay there again, as well as recommend it to friends going to Rome. The location is unbeatable - in an upscale, safe neighborhood minutes away from the Spanish steps and walking distance from most tourist attractions (we didn't use public transport at all and got everywhere on foot). The hotel itself was a very pleasant surprise - the room we got was the largest we've had during all of our numerous stays in Italy (three and four-star hotels both in Rome and in smaller coastal towns such as Lido di Jesolo and Rimini), very spacious and with a large bathroom. The room looked freshly renovated, was very comfy and clean. Great bed and mattress too, we always felt well-rested in the morning. Breakfast was very decent. The staff are pleasant, helpful and professional. We found the room to be better (more spacious, bigger bathroom) than the one we had at the four-star hotel last year, and the whole experience more warm and friendly, as the hotel is small and family-run and people seem to really care about what they're doing and take pride in their job. The only difference was the small reception area with no street entrance (the hotel is inside a residential building on the second floor) but we were looking for a comfortable stay, not a fancy reception hall. I think the hotel is excellent value for the money and if we come back to Rome next year we'd definitely stay here again. From the moment of booking to our taxi back to the airport everything went without a hitch. Thank you to Hotel Golden for making our stay in Rome perfectly enjoyable!

Reviews.Title: “great family hotel”
Reviews.Author: klotoida
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Golden for 3 nights. The staff was very helpful, and the rooms are clean and quite spacious. All the sights are accessible on foot so we didn't use public transportation much. The only downside is a bit noisy airconditioning, which we didn't mind because we were too tired after all the sightseeing :)

Reviews.Title: “Quiet but convenient location, run by courteous, friendly family members.”
Reviews.Author: JaydeeNewSouthWales
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to the Hotel Golden, situated right across the road from the beautiful Borghese park and in a quiet street at the top of Via Veneto. Run mainly by two brothers, who were friendly, helpful and efficient, this is a small family hotel run on good old-fashioned service and attention to detail. We are no strangers to Rome and have stayed in various categories of hotel in the city but although by no means the most expensive, ithe Golden may well become one of our favourites, due to a combination of well-appointed and relatively spacious rooms (go for the top-of-the-line), typically simple but appetising breakfasts and excellent attention to cleanliness. The rooms are sound-proofed and double -glazed but you can open the windows and shutters. The room was a good size as was the bathroom. Our hosts gave us excellent recommendations for local restaurants and one in particular, a small, cosy, family-style trattoria frequented by many locals, will certainly be on our list for future visits. Our four nights there were most enjoyable and we will use this hotel again. My only slight gripe: the wi-fi did not work all that well in our room. My mini-notebook was new and worked well elsewhere in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location/Service and Value”
Reviews.Author: happywanderer070
Reviews.Content: My huband and I have stayed in Rome on a number of occasions the first time in this Hotel. It is a small Hotel and family run. Marco and Guiseppe were very helpful, gave us great tips on where to eat and they organised our pick up from the airport which went off without a hitch. Breakfast is continental and filling with a good selection. Rooms are very clean and reasonable size. Everything you would want to see and do is within easy walking distance, there is also a Metro station nearby. Definately would consider staying there again and would recommend to family and friends

Reviews.Title: “Good memories”
Reviews.Author: FelixBoston
Reviews.Content: We left hotel Golden with the best memories. We stayed there for 3 nights in October 2009. After a long flight from the US to Italy and difference of time, we overslept breakfast in the hotel. At 10:00 am, when the time for breakfast was usually over, we got a call from the staff, and they offered us to come down, and that they would wait for us. We really appreciate that they took care of us. All members of the family who runs the hotel are very friendly and benevolent. Whenever we asked Giuseppe and Marco questions, we always got valuable advice. Galina & Felix

Reviews.Title: “Great location in a quiet neighborhood!”
Reviews.Author: p0rt0bell0
Reviews.Content: This small hotel is in a great location. We stayed for 5 nights and our room on the second floor was large with a small sofa and desk in the room. It had a large bathroom with a huge sink that could hold all your toiletries. They had fluffy white bathrooms and slippers which was a very nice touch. We slept peacefully in the evenings and enjoyed how quiet it was. The staff was very nice and helpful. The hotel lobby is located on the second floor and although the building has an old fashion elevator we chose to walked the stairs. The location was in a great neighborhood near the Via Veneto where all the exclusive hotels and boutiques stores are located. We walked to all the major tourist sites (Coliseum,Forum, Palatine Hill, Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain, Pantheon, Travestere, Vatican City and the Borghese Park and Gallery is only a block away) from the hotel. I think the furthest destination was Vatican City (St. Peters) took about 45 minutes to walk there. The Borghese Park next door was a great getaway from the crowds. It isn't as well kept as Central Park in NYC but it is still beautiful. You could enjoy a nice walk or run or sit on a bench and read the paper after all your sightseeing. There is a great bakery/gelato place across from the hotel. I don't recall the name but you will walk by it if you stay here. The most delectable treats tempt you easily. It was a good thing I discovered it on our last day. Otherwise, I would have been there every day. We loved Rome and had sunny warm days while we were here in late October. I'm know we will find ourselves back to visit again and we would definitely stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, Comfortable, Clean, Reasonable and good location”
Reviews.Author: ontola
Reviews.Content: Writing reviews, is not something I'm particularly good at . However that said I wanted to "give-back" to this forum. We have been to Rome several times before, but this is the first hotel we would return to. The rooms are clean and efficient. But the family owned service was outstanding. They always helped with detailed instructions in perfect english on how to get around town. Their recommendations for restaurants, was never disappointing. They were at the elevator to help up with the bags, and help us down with our bags without any wait. We hope to return one day and it will be comforting to know at the end of our long flight, we will be greeted with warmth and a comfortable bed.

Reviews.Title: “Impeccable cleanliness and professionalism in perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: Avidtraveller44
Reviews.Content: I am not easy to please when it comes to hotels and was not convinced staying at a 2 or 3 star hotel would have been wise, but decided to invest less in the hotel and more on the life outside of the hotel. HOTEL GOLDEN WAS A GREAT CHOICE!!!! First, it was spotless. I have stayed at 5 star hotels with much smaller rooms. I found the room size spacious for Europe and a comfortable bed. I felt very secure when outside the hotel. The location is next to the Spanish steps, Via Veneto and about a 15-20 minute walk to Via del Corso... up tp 10 euro taxi ride will take you anywhere if its too cold to walk. The family that runs the hotel is so professional. I had a nightmare with my luggages, was without for 3 day and brothers Giuseppe and Marco made every effort to try to help me locate them. I am not big on breakfast but those I traveled with found breakfast quite adequate. I am a coffee person and I had my latte at the coffee shop downstairs the hotel every morning as it was delicious!!

Reviews.Title: “What a gem!!”
Reviews.Author: kaybeeFlorida
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Golden for 3 nights prior to our cruise. Everything was great from the initial booking right up to the time of checkout. They answered every question we had e-mailed prior to arriving as well as directing us to restaurants, pharmacies and grocery stores during our stay. The airport transport they had arranged for us was waiting just outside baggage claim even though our flight arrived earlier than scheduled. They also arranged our transfer to Civitavecchia. This family run hotel is one of our new favorites. If we ever get back to Rome, this is where we will be staying. Thanks, Giuseppe, Marco and family for making our visit special!!

Reviews.Title: “We loved Hotel Golden”
Reviews.Author: tlahuele
Reviews.Content: Very good location. Near Metro station, taxis, Villa Borghese, Spanish Steps, and shopping. Staff at this hotel are wonderful. They anticipated our needs and provided knowledgeable and friendly guidance for nearby restaurants, sites, coffee shops, and even a grocery store. Very honest and professionally run hotel. We had a quiet, comfortable room with a full sized bathroom. Their family pride in their business is obvious and well deserved. We felt more like friends than visitors. We hope to return to Rome and will consider no other hotel. Excellent value for the price.

Reviews.Title: “The other reviews are accurate”
Reviews.Author: hoogo
Reviews.Content: Even the less favorable reviews of the Hotel Golden are accurate. With only about 15" around the bed, the standard double room really was tiny, as was the shower. We found it cozy. The staff was most helpful, the breakfast satisfying, and the location great for us. Those who want large modern rooms should look elsewhere. Recommended by the desk clerk, the Pizzeria San Marco, just a couple of blocks away, was excellent

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Service”
Reviews.Author: chachabell
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 4 days at the Hotel Golden prior to a cruise. The transportation that they arranged for us from the airport to the hotel was convenient. This small, family owned and operated business completely met our needs and exceeded our expectations. It is conveniently located near the Trevi Fountain and Spanish Steps with the Metro within easy walking distance. The knowledgeable staff is extremely friendly and helpful in providing restaurant recommendations, maps, suggestions and anything we asked them. Our room was very comfortable. Free WiFi is provided and a laptop computer is available for use in the reception area. They provide a nice assortment of continental breakfast foods in the mornings. All of this provided at a very reasonable price. We will definitely stay here again the next time we are in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, No frills”
Reviews.Author: NJtraveler069
Reviews.Content: I choose this hotel after seeing reviews from tripadvisor. While the hotel was in a decent location (a long walk to the Colosseum, not far from the Spanish Steps and many other sight seeing locations, and a stone's throw from the Borghese Museum) it was not what I expected. The hotel is on the 2nd floor of a building where you have to be buzzed into the hallway by the desk where the concierge sits. Other than a small room off the main hallway that is open for an assortment of breads, pastries, and cheeses (no hot food), there were no other amenities. The room itself was only large enough to house the bed and a small walk-in area. It could only fit one small nightstand, so the person on the side of the bed without the nightstand had no place to put a book, drink, etc. If one person wanted to rest, there was literally no place in the hotel for the other person to go. The bathroom was clean and offered a stall shower without any problems with hot water. It also had a bidet. The only computer available (we needed to check our flight) was a laptop on the concierge's desk, so checking email or surfing the net was uncomfortable at best standing at the desk. If you're looking for a clean, inexpensive room, then this place is for you, but I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with excellant service”
Reviews.Author: Jatennessee
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in Rome for two nights prior to our cruise in mid-October. I researched hotels in Rome for almost 6 weeks before deciding on Hotel Golden. I finally decided to make a reservation based on value, the limited number of negative reviews about the hotel and the fact (at the time) it was rated the #25 hotel in Rome. We were not disappointed.
