I was only able to reserve a small room at the hotel at that time due to the fact that it took me so long to make my decision about where to stay. However, Hotel Golden does have some very nice larger rooms that are available if you reserve them ahead. All the rooms are well appointed and are very clean. The thing that differentiates Hotel Golden is the service and the staff. They were very helpful in many ways - from helping us to understand how to get around Rome, where to eat (or not), which tours are best, to logging on to wifi. They even made sure we had reliable transportation to the port and (later) from the port back to Rome's airport. We will definitely return to Hotel Golden.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay with the Hotel Golden”
Reviews.Author: tmarczak
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a night here before heading on during a week-long trip in Italy. The hotel staff were extremely friendly and helpful, just what you would expect from a small, family-run operation. They watched our luggage for the day since we checked in early and assisted with getting around Rome and made our reservation for the Villa Borghese, a short five to ten minute walk from the hotel door. The neighborhood is quiet, being in the financial district, but there are some great restaurants (not touristy) close by. The only real drawback is that it is not too close to too many big attractions, but if you don't mind walking or taking public transportation, it is a great find. Rates are reasonable, breakfast is decent and the rooms are tidy and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Anniversary Trip”
Reviews.Author: jynda
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. Very nice owners. Clean rooms. Good breakfast. Many restaurants within walking distance. Across the street from the Brogheses Gardens. What more could you ask for?

Reviews.Title: “Location. Location. Location. Beautiful rooms.”
Reviews.Author: azohunvey
Reviews.Content: The title says it all. On top of location and beautiful spacious rooms and bathrooms all freshly and splendidly renovated, there is a friendly staff, excellent breakfast, free internet. it is not cheap but well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Highs and Lows”
Reviews.Author: devonroamer
Reviews.Content: Just arrived back with lots of thoughts that should help. Position, its a long way from everything except the Via Veneto and Villa Borghese, unless you want to taxi. You can walk 10 minutes to a Metro but the Metro only goes in 2 directions!. Rooms, the standard double is very small, walk sideways along the bed and get stuck in the shower doors, ok, I am not a size zero but it was very small. Gloomy outlook onto an inner courtyard of crumbling walls and air conditioning units. Very clean Friendly staff at reception but local knowlege was a bit light, I seemed to know more about some of the sights from a guide book. Excellent choice at breakfast, if you are ok with cold, only boiled eggs were warm. Some very good local restaurants nearby but no atmosphere at night, need to go into town. The vast majority of people go because of the trip advisor reviews, maybe a little of the self perpetuating myth?

Reviews.Title: “I Can't Wait to go back!!!”
Reviews.Author: SharonThornhill_Ont
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Hotel Golden for 2 nights in October after a med cruise. It was very centrally located, near the more expensive areas of Via Venetto and Borghese Gardens but was far less expensive. We actually were able to walk to the Spanish Steps and Trevi fountain, after being given a map from the owners/brothers Marco and Guiseppe and were close to the subway that took us to the Vatican Museum. This is a family run hotel, with a very home like atmosphere. The father works overnight and the mother does breakfast in the am. All in all, this was an excellent hotel for the price, close to everything, in a neighbourhood, where we felt safe to walk at night, They directed us to a wonderful inexpensive restaurant to go for dinner and we were1 block from a supermercato where we bought water, pop, buns and cheese for our lunches. Marco and Guiseppe could not have been more helpful, giving directions, explaining the different keyboard on their computer, arranging our transportation to the airport and they even stored one of our suitcases when we went to southern Italy. I think next time, and I know there will be a next time, we will pay a bit more to get the larger room, we had issues with the small shower but all in all, it was a wonderful 2 days in Rome at a wonderful hotel. Thank you again Marco and Guiseppe, I hope to see you soon, Ciao, Sharon and Frank Pitto, Toronto Canada

Reviews.Title: “Small friendy family run hotel”
Reviews.Author: WorcsOwl
Reviews.Content: Super location close to the heart of Rome, within walking distance of all the main sites, this hotel was the ideal base for our brief stay. The hotel is small but clean and the family who run it could not have been more helpful. They made sure we knew the best ways to maximise our stay, recommending restaurants and travel arrangements around the lovely city. For a reasonabley priced hotel this is a little gem.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience in Rome thanks to Hotel Golden!”
Reviews.Author: alr312
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Golden for four nights in April, arriving early on Easter morning. The family was welcoming and helpful, providing us a map and easy walking path down to the Vatican, across town. Each morning they greeted us and helped by answering questions about our day's itinerary, making helpful recommendations. Twp evenings they guided us to outstanding nearby restaurants, one of which was perhaps my favorite meal during the two weeks we spent in Italia! (Pizzeria San Marco, a couple blocks away). The other two nights they helped us with bus routes to and from our destinations. Our room was large, comfortable and clean. The free internet was fast, easy to connect and reliable. Breakfast provided by the hotel and included in room price was ample and delicious, with a wide range of breads, cheeses, and cereals. On the down but comical side, the woman keeping the breakfast buffet stocked was less than friendly, and the room got a bit cramped if multiple sets of guests showed up at the same time. The location of the hotel is a bit out of the way of most Rome attractions, tucked in a quiet residential neighborhood. Its a short 5 minute walk to the subway and also to the Spanish Steps, and a block away from the beautiful Borghese Park. We loved the quiet neighborhood, visiting the small cafes, and being away from the seemingly inescapable 'touristy' side of Rome that is a given while seeing the sights all day. We highly recommend Hotel Golden - it was a great place to stay in Rome and we hope to visit again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Pampering? No. Everything else? Really good”
Reviews.Author: CHAKConn
Reviews.Content: If you need a full service hotel with room service and a complete staff, this is not your place. It is a family run hotel that has the feel of an inn/B&B. From the first, there is no lobby on the first floor and have to take an old elevator to the 2nd (only holds one person and lugguage). You never keep your keys as you hand them in to front desk when you leave and collect them when you arrive. (Again, not for everyone, but really no problem). A definate family feel which is positive. I am puzzeled why the breakfast is slammed so much. The room is a bit tight but can fit 4-5 tables just fine and there is a very large selection of both carbs and protein. Coffee is good. The place is spotless and location near the park is close but out of the way a bit. Visit the park and Borgeshe Gallery. This hotel is a great value in Rome and if you can deal with the minor quirks, you will like it.

Reviews.Title: “Cosy family run hotel off Via Veneto at decent prices”
Reviews.Author: aukahkay
Reviews.Content: Rome is an expensive city - more so when you are just a stone's throw from ritzy Via Veneto. I stayed at the Hotel Golden Rome for 2 nights during my recent trip to Rome in September 2009. The brothers manning the front desk, Giovanni and Marco, are friendly and offered useful information on how to get to major tourist attractions. It is a short 3 minute walk to the northern end of Via Veneto and a 5 minute walk to Villa Borghese. The hotel arranged for my arrival transfer from Fiumicino airport and although I arrived at the hotel at 9 am before check-in time at 12 noon, the room was ready for me. I would recommend Hotel Golden Rome for any traveller to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “OK but not that good”
Reviews.Author: juliew57
Reviews.Content: Not sure why the reviews are so good. OK the hotel is nice and the staff/owners friendlu. But the rooms are basic and small and the breakfast buffet a disappointment. The location is OK but it is quite a walk to the metro/underground alhtough buses go from nearby and their is a supermarket nearby.

Reviews.Title: “First class little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mrukk
Reviews.Content: We were thrilled with this hotel. We got a really good deal, and found that the service was better than we had hoped for. The whole family goes out of their way to help you and make you feel at home. We were particularly impressed when we were offered a free Rick Steves Rome guidebook to borrow for the 5 days we were there. Nothing was too much trouble for them. Internet was available, and the breakfast each morning was very nice with a good selection. Our room wasn't huge, but it was very clean and comfortable, and for the price we paid, excellent value. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “cheap and cheerful, close to all sights”
Reviews.Author: mimicc
Reviews.Content: this is nice clean hotel. The small double rooms however are tiny and if you are above average sized you may not fit in the shower!! good if on a budget and nice breakfast.. staff very helpful however i wass told that i was not entitled to bathrobes and slippers as detailed on site as i was ONLY in the smaller room!! i knew then i had booked budget but still i would recommend on grounds of safe, friendly, good location and clean

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: Olivia77
Reviews.Content: A lovely small friendly hotel in a very convenient location, just ten minutes from the Spanish Steps. We even walked to the Vatican from here and it took us about 40 min. at a leisurely stroll. Had a Superior Double Room which was larger than most European hotel rooms with a big bathroom. Beautifully decorated and very clean. The breakfast was served in a small but cosy room and there was a good selection of cold meats, cheese and pastries which was constantly restocked so you would not go hungry if you arrived late. The family was extremely helpful and recommended a great area called Trastevere over the other side of the Tiber for excellent Italian restaurants - please go there, its has very pretty side streets with bars and restaurants offering wonderful food at cheaper prices than the restaurants near the attractions in the historic centre. The price of the taxi fare there and back was worth it as you save that and more in the price of a few drinks or meal especially between four of you. We found the metered taxis very reasonable - on par with London prices. No bathrobes or slippers which was on their hotel website as being included but I certainly didn't miss them!

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: summerescapes
Reviews.Content: Another excellent stay. Very comfortable single room in warm red and gold tones. Well located on a very posh street, minutes from the Borghese Gallery, and an easy walk to Trevi and Spanish Steps. Breakfast is plentiful and staff is very kind. Highly recommended from a well seasoned traveller.

Reviews.Title: “Great place - but far from nightlife"”
Reviews.Author: CiaoBella02115
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights here in early August, based on Trip Advisor ratings. No complaints about the hotel at all -- the rooms are clean and comfortable, and it's a terrific value. It's very close to Via Veneto, a beautiful, tree-lined street with upscale hotels and shops (think 4-star hotels, Harry's Bar). Younger travelers should be prepared for a bit of a walk to more affordable shopping and dining in the Campo di Fiori or Piazza Navona.

Reviews.Title: “Very good location, simple and clean”
Reviews.Author: JDTDMV
Reviews.Content: Very good service, friendly and simple. The people at front were always willing to help. Travel books everywhere. Very quiet and easy to sleep. Clean.

Reviews.Title: “A hidden gem near Borghese Park”
Reviews.Author: mfk3
Reviews.Content: I selected this hotel based on the excellent reviews it was given. I only stayed there one night and was very pleased to discover that all of the positive comments I had read about Hotel Golden was true. My single room was quiet, comfortable, tastefully decorated, and extremely clean. The lobby's laptop use was free of charge. The surrounding area had many restaurants to choose from and I chose to dine at the one recommended by the hotel staff, just two blocks away. Unfortunately, I left too early in the morning to experience the breakfast. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful, even arranging my 3:45 a.m. ride to the airport. As a solo, female traveler I felt very safe in the neighborhood and was most impressed when I was escorted downstairs to my awaiting taxi for my very early (and dark) departure.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel but you need to be fit.”
Reviews.Author: vicfromcanterbury
Reviews.Content: Had a great 3 days with the family in this great value hotel. Rooms are clean and functional although the air con minimum setting can make sleeping in hot weather a little uncomfortable. Staff are efficient and functional rather than overly friendly and this probably knocked the place down to very good rather than excellent for our overal rating. The breakfast on the other hand is a memorable experience; a kind of 'breakfast shrine' with food set on a mini-altar , candles all around and piped music akin to an italian version of the 1960's merseybeat. Gerry and the pacemakers eat your heart out! Location is a bit out the way but in a safe and well to do area with 2 cheap pizarrias nearby. The staff at the Lotto gealataria around the corner are great. If you are like us and want to walk Rome then this is a place well worth considering at the price. Visit the Hotel website directly for the best deals.

Reviews.Title: “great value in great neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: JDM22
Reviews.Content: We just spent three nights in our first visit to Rome. The Hotel Golden is run by a great family. Both Marco and Giuseppe were so kind in helping us even before our stay, providing information to us. When we checked in, Marco provided some great recommendations including a local neighborhood restaurant (take their recommendations!), which did not feel like a tourist trap. The room was beautifully decorated, with good air conditioning ( a real plus in a Roman summer), a great bath room, and free wi-fi. We started each day with a breakfast that had great home baked pastries and an array of food. The hotel is just off of Via Veneto, which provided a beautiful walk along one of the nicest streets in all of Rome. It was a great, quiet retreat from the busy nature of Rome. If you don't mind a 10 minute stroll down Via Veneto to the major sights(Spagna, Trevi, Pantheon, etc), you can't go wrong with Hotel Golden. Thanks to Marco, Giuseppe and their entire family for making our first visit memorable. We will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Overall very, very good”
Reviews.Author: animaltown
Reviews.Content: Hotel Golden was in a perfect location close to all the attractions. We have stayed for 7 days from 6-13 july Good price. We used the transfer from airport to hotel that was ok. The rooms were spotless and all elegantly updated. Very good beds. We lived in room 101 (small) and 109 (bigger). In 101 there were some noice coming from the reception. I think an extra door in the rom would solve that problem. Marko and Giussepe was excellent and gave us perfect recommedations for any questions we had from dining to walking routes. Breakfast could be a little better - there was to much sweet bread/cakes. We liked very much all in all and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “A real luxury!”
Reviews.Author: batcos
Reviews.Content: Hotel Golden was in a perfect location--about 5 minutes from the Borghese Gardens where there are museums, cafes, restaurants, playgrounds, bike rentals, etc. The rooms were spotless and all elegantly updated. The hotel staff was excellent and gave us perfect recommedations for any questions we had from dining to walking routes. Also a 5 min. walk from the metro and there's a cab stand around the corner, along with a cafe, small market, and numerous restaurants/bars/shopping. All this and breakfast included--what a great deal!

Reviews.Title: “HOTEL GOLDEN A GEM IN THE HEART OF ROME”
Reviews.Author: Leigh003
Reviews.Content: After scouring trip advisor I came across Hotel Golden in Rome. Well ... I am now the next traveller to highly recommend this hote. A wonderful family run hotel in an excellent location in Rome. While were were in Rome the G8 was in town and this hotel is on the door step of all the 5* hotels but no doubt at a fraction of their asking prices. Easy to find, airconditioned and very clean. Room was small in size but fair for what you would most probably get in most smaller hotels. Marco and Guiseppi were most helpful and accommodating. If in Rome again, I would most definately reserve a room at the Hotel Golden again.

Reviews.Title: “Great small family run hotel in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: mikeanello
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 6 nites in June22-24 and July 6-10, 2009.Great location to see all the sites in Rome. Very nice hotel with a good breakfast. Stayed in a very small room but it was very inexpensive (68 euros/nite). It has to be the best deal in Rome. Very clean and very quiet. Very helpful family that runs the hotel. I highly recommend the hotel, especially if you want to be close to all the sites and keep the costs reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't fault location or staff”
Reviews.Author: AmberNewSouthWales
Reviews.Content: We stayed in early June after reading Trip Advisor reviews. They were all accurate - a great location, a large room, excellent,cheap restaurant recommendations, good breakfast and staff who were friendly and helpful. Would stay again next time I'm in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: cardinalgal
Reviews.Content: My family of four stayed here for two nights at the end of a two week trip. TripAdvisor is one of our biggest resources and I am surprised that this (at current writing) ranks in the top 30 -- not that it isn't a fine hotel, but it is a small family-run business off the beaten track. When you arrive, you must ring the bell at the outer entrance. The hotel takes up the first floor (what Americans would consider the second floor) of a building about two blocks from the Villa Borghese park. Once inside, you proceed up the stairs to another secured door, and there to the front desk. It is a very secure hotel - no worries there at all. The neighborhood isn't at all touristy (and there is actually a mens club down the street) but it was very safe. The only "beware" is that, while lots is in walking distance, the walk back to the hotel will be uphill! The rooms, while small, were scrupulously clean. Another reviewer wrote that a long stay might be difficult with the space considerations but we had no issues for two nights, except my youngest child had a hard time with the small shower. Also, the toilet is only about a foot from the shower, so you might have difficulties if you have long legs. The owner and his family were especially helpful, giving us a really good restaurant recommendation as well as booking a car for us to the airport for the morning of our departure for 50 euros. If I had to change one thing about our stay, I would have preferred that my kids' room was closer to ours. We had room 102 and the two children were in 107, which was down the hall, around the corner, and down the hall again. However, the beds were comfortable, the rooms were clean, and the owners were terrific. It is not in the middle of the tourist district, but as others point out, not a far walk to the Spanish Steps, the Trevi Fountain, or the metro, and Villa Borghese is very close.

Reviews.Title: “Look No Further! 2 Star Price - 4 Star Quality, Excellent Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: HullJohn
Reviews.Content: What a find - this is a rare gem, fantastic quality service, very clean newly refurbished rooms (no corners cut, excellent furnishings & fittings). This is family run hotel where the staff are genuine lovely helpful people. Not a corporate chain staffed by disinterested part-timers! Perfectly situated in a quite area within easy walking distance of all tourist attractions except perhaps Trastavere. We were absolutely spoilt for choice for places to eat out. There are so many reasonably priced places to eat out with great atmosphere that we ran out of time! A week is not long enough in Rome! We are looking forward to returning to Rome sometime and look forward to staying again with Guiseppe and his family.

Reviews.Title: “Great family run place a block back from the via venetto”
Reviews.Author: mandasanval
Reviews.Content: The car service they booked from the airport was a great and reasonable convenience at 40E. A driver picked us up, carried our bags, didn't allow us to get in his chic mercedes until the air conditioner had kicked in, and pointed out many landmarks as we drove for an hour in heavy traffic. We felt very taken care of. The hotel room was small but very clean & affordable, great location. The family made great restaurant recommendations and was very helpful. Best breakfast room on our trip to Europe (except for silly American xmas music playing in May-haha). Laptop w/ internet for guest use was a great extra.

Reviews.Title: “Small but sufficient”
Reviews.Author: EnglandMum50
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Golden is in a pretty good location and very reasonably priced for Rome. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The rooms were clean and comfortable but the bedroom and bathroom were very small. We stayed 3 nights and the room was fine for this long but might have felt cramped if we'd stayed for a whole holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: Horns05
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Golden family and staff were excellent from the first time we emailed them 3 months before our trip to the last day we stayed there. We were in room 111 and it was very quite and roomy. The bathroom was a nice size as well. Everything was very clean. The toilet would be a little tight for a tall person, but was fine for me(5'9") and my wife. Breakfast was simple and very good every morning. Giuseppe and Marco gave us great recommendations for places to eat and how to get around town. I would highly recommend this hotel in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and comfortable family run hotel with dedicated hosts”
Reviews.Author: matarsakzendeh
Reviews.Content: Location: This hotel is ideal for those who wish to stay close to Via Veneto at a reasonable price. Rome being the almost-village that it is, one can easily walk between all parts. Thus, location-wise, my personal preference after many stays in this enchanting city is for the more bustling neighborhoods. But if a quieter and more upscale area is what you prefer, then the hotel location is ideal. I found public transportation options in this area poor compared to staying in a number of other locations, and especially the Termini area, where easy connections to any spot in Rome and vicinity are possible, especially later in the evening. After a certain hour, public transport to the hotel is definitely not easy. The taxi stand is around the corner and convenient. Rooms: The rooms are spotless and cleaned well daily. They are very basic, with relatively comfortable beds, clean linens and sound-proof windows. Although you can hear guests in the hallway, you can’t hear any street noise at all. The bathroom we had was a very good size, but the shower stall and sink are of the miniature variety found throughout Italy which larger size guests may find a bit inconvenient. Water pressure was OK, but hot water availability was variable. Our TV did not work, it has multiple broken images, but we didn’t really want to bother them about it as we did not need it. If we had mentioned it, I am sure it would have been replaced or fixed. Internet: A huge bonus is the great free internet service! Super-fast and efficient, this was the best we saw throughout Italy. Breakfast: Breakfast provides more variety than most hotels in Italy, and the care taken in the beautiful ornate place settings, and the constant attention to the food display was almost touching. Staff: This is a family run hotel, and you’ll likely get to meet every family member over the course of coming and going from the hotel at various hours. They take the running of the hotel seriously (a bit too seriously at times), but its nice to see their level of organization and dedication. They went out of their way for all the guests, repeatedly. Altogether, this is a very well run hotel, but not in my favorite location. For others, location may be perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Very simple, but very nice, hotel.”
Reviews.Author: rejaka
Reviews.Content: Hotel Golden is right by the Villa Borghese, in a really beautiful and charming neighborhood. I loved the location because it didn't feel overwhelmed by tourists, but was only a ten minute walk from the Trevi Fountain and the Spanish Steps. The neighborhood actually managed to make Rome feel like a small, comfortable city for the few days we were there on this trip. Oh, and excellent wifi. And blessedly thick windows...the considerable street noise was totally shut out. The hotel feels very safe...you have to buzz up and identify yourself to be let in, and the concierge keeps your keys at the desk for you. The service is excellent. The proprietor of the hotel gave us a great map and outlined an easy route to take us past all of the sights in Rome, and circled a few good restaurants in the neighborhood as well. Also, I got sick while I was there, and he recommended a nearby clinic and was very helpful and concerned. He also arranged a car service to the airport for us. The room was small but really nicely done, with a comfortable bed and linens, nice tiled floors, and a clean and newly renovated bathroom. Everything seemed recently renovated, modern, and spotless. Almost all of the guests were American, it seemed, and I could see why. It wasn't exactly a quaint, historic inn, but was instead a very clean and modern and comfortable hotel, which is sometimes exactly what you need in an overwhelming city like Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Three perfet days!”
Reviews.Author: rafaellorenzojr
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 days, and it was excellent. The family run business really shows the care that they have put into every aspect of the Hotel. Maps with directions and ideas as to what to see, do and eat were provided. The room we has had to big windows which provided lots of brightes and fresh air. The continental breakfast was beautifully presented, with lots of options. Teresa, it was a joy chatting with you, you made me feel like a member of the family. The location was excellent!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: shoneyghan
Reviews.Content: This hotel was clean, and centrally located. It is family run with a warm friendly atmosphere. The rooms are modest but definately workable. The shower is very small. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: armass
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Golden for three nights. It was our first trip to Rome and we were very happy that we chose this hotel. For a very reasonable price for Rome we got a clean room in a good location. The included breakfast was excellent as well. We stayed in the triple, which was plenty large enough for two people. The hotel is a family operation and the younger brother was extremely helpful. Can't say the same for the older brother. Also, they provide free Internet access from a laptop in the lobby (although you have to stand up to use it). If you are budget conscious, it would be hard to beat the Golden.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: ladylawyer42
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a week-long stay in Rome, during which we stayed at this beautiful hotel. It is family run, and the family are all very friendly and helpful. We booked a small double, which was indeed small, but beautifully decorated and well laid out. The bathroom was perfectly laid out, featured a large shower, and was absolutely spotless. The bed was very comfortable, and we found extra pillows in the cabinet. They have the most sound-proofed windows we have ever experienced. Although the street below was quite noisy, closing the window blocked out virtually every noise. The mini-bar in the room had very reasonable prices, so we took advantage of this, to have cold water when needed, and a glass of wine in the evenings. The included breakfast was very nice, in the European style (cold cuts, cheese, yoghurt, cereals, a variety of breads, cakes, and sweet or savory pastries, juice, coffee). The restaurants recommended by Marco were indeed very good, and offered delicious food and wine at reasonable prices. We also enjoyed being around the corner from the Via Veneto, and spent some time in cafes on that street, people watching. The location -- virtually across the road from the Borghese gardens -- was excellent. Since we had been to Rome before and had seen many of the major sites, we wanted to spend time in the Museo Borghese and the Etruscan museum, both located in the gardens. The gardens themselves were a quiet and cool oasis in the midst of the bustling city. Many of the sites, from Campo di Fiori to Piazza Navona, to the Pantheon, were a comfortable walk away. We even walked to the Vatican from the hotel, which was quite a hike, but doable. We would stay here again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Value and Location”
Reviews.Author: ufmiked
Reviews.Content: First of all, it's an average room in a big city. It's small, the bed isn't the most comfortable thing in the world, there are only a couple of pillows, and it doesn't have the features of a chain hotel. Pros: Just off of Via Vento which is the equivilant to New York's 5th ave. That's to say, ti's a very nice, safe part of town. The price is right. About 108 euros a night is what we paid. For that price, in Rome, you can't really argue. Breakfast is included. The bathroom was very spacious. The hotel is very safe -- you have to be buzzed into the building. Cons: As nice of an area as it is, the nearest metro and bus stop is about a half mile away. It gets a little annoying walking back and forth to the metro. The beds aren't that great, the breakfast wasn't great, and it's a bit aggravating to buzz into the building if you're coming and going. Overall, a good option if you're on a budget or traveling alone.

Reviews.Title: “Little Gem in Rome”
Reviews.Author: flyformoney
Reviews.Content: A small family run hotel in a good location near the US Embassy. Just off the beaten path and around the corner from some very expensive hotels, the Hotel Golden is a small family run inn with nice clean rooms and a very friendly and helpful staff. There are some really good eateries in the area and you can easily walk to most tourist area in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Family Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CezNorthWales
Reviews.Content: Just arrived back from spending 4 nights at the Hotel Golden, It was like staying with family. The Hotel is clean and the rooms spacious. The breakfast room was quite small but perfectly adequate for its purpose. We used the transfer facility and it worked like a dream . The Hotel is situated in a good part of town and we were able to walk to all tourist attractions. We used the "Little Tomato" restaurant and The San Marco Restaurant which was reccommended by the hotel, these were excellent. We also discovered a small bar/ restaurant called Lotties in a side street by the Hotel, this was handy for a drink or coffee before returning to the Hotel. All in all a great Hotel and excellent value for money. There is no getting away from it Rome is expensive but then so is most of Europe.

Reviews.Title: “It's Great!”
Reviews.Author: MLK422
Reviews.Content: What a pleasure it is to write a review for the Hotel Golden. My daughter and I stayed there recently and had a great experience. The hotel shares a building with other establishments (a common occurrence for urban hotels in Italy) on a small, quiet street in a prime area of Rome, just off the Via Veneto and near the Villa Borghese. Because we were staying for just one night and on a dollar-based (rather than euro-based) budget, we booked the small double room. Yes, it was small, but so is a diamond, and like one, the room was sparkling and beautiful. There were elegant curtains and bedspreads, an extra pillow in the closet, a nice little refrigerator, television with international cable stations, and free internet which we could access on our laptops. The bathroom was very well appointed with a big shower (this is rare in a three-star hotel in Italy) and wonderful water pressure. Moreover, it and the room were in absolutely first-rate condition, not just immaculately clean, but well-designed, beautifully tiled and equipped with fine fixtures. The breakfast room was tucked into a small, bright space, where the tables were decorated with elegant tablecloths and lovely dishes. Breakfast to me is primarily coffee, and the Hotel Golden’s was very good. There were also various kinds of bread, croissants, jams, cheeses, meats, fruit and cereal, all very nicely displayed. The Hotel Golden is a family-owned business, with family members running the front desk and the other services. They do so in the most professional manner, while at the same time treating you like guests in their home, rather than simply customers. For example, they remembered my name, anticipated several of our needs, and were more than happy to answer questions about Rome and places we might see during our brief visit. As a result of all this, as soon as we returned to our temporary home on the Adriatic, I booked another stay at the Holden Golden for later this spring, and we are eagerly looking forward to it!

Reviews.Title: “Recommendable Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ArbutusCa
Reviews.Content: We are very satisfied with this hotel: it is clean, conveniently located with helpful staff. You can walk to Villa Borghese, Spanish Steps, and even to Trevi Fountain, Pantheon, and beyond; to Pantheon is about 25-minute walk. The metro station is quite near at Spanish Steps, so we generally take metro to the Forum, Vatican, and other churches as well as Ostia. The breakfast is ok-simple but sufficient. There are a few restaurants not far from the hotel, serving good dinners. But in Italy, they often add charges in the restaurant bills for items that we didn't order, for example breads and cover charges-a few Euros here and there. For Vatican tour, we direcly booked from Vatican; it was an excellent decision-no lineup with excellent tour guide and lower cost. Beware of Angel Tour: our trip to the Forum was ruined. After confirmation through emails, they just didn't show up. When we complained, they put a blame on us that we were probably not tourists, but we were their competitors to smear their reputation. Their mentalities are strange and extremely not professional. You may need to join a tour bus from Rome to Pompeii if you are going there. Because the local train from Naples to Pompeii ( you need to transfer in Naples station if you are going to Pompeii from Rome) is rather uncomfortable and scary; many vagabonds and mean looking fellows stared conspicuously at you or your girlfriend or your wife; on our return trip, one guy even provocatively kicked his shoe to my wife's foot and spoke something in Italian. But when we finally couldn't tolerate him anymore and spoke to him in English, he went away and continued ranting. Do watch out if you travel with teenage daughters; Italian men like to flirt aggressively; they may not be mean but can be quite annoying. Naple area seems quite forbidding. Gelatos and tiramitsus are generally great. Enjoy but be alert, because we visited during off-peak season; perhaps summer is a lot safer with more tourists, but you have other inconveniences.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Friendly Service, Great Location - Small Room”
Reviews.Author: mistabandc
Reviews.Content: We stayed here at the end of February 2009 and had an excellent time in Rome - partly due to how great the service was at the hotel golden! The room was very small however we knew this when we booked it. Even though it was small it was perfect for us, it was kept very clean, had a small but modern bathroom, was very secure and we heard no noise and slept well the entire weekend! The staff were amazing, and please do (unlike us on our first night) listen to their recommendations on where to eat - they recommend some great places, packed with locals so you know it must be good! When we first got their they gave us a map and pointed out all the attractions and good walking tours - tailored to what we wanted to do - and throughout are stay asked us how we had got on - very nice touch. The hotel is in a great location, just a short walk from all the tourist attractions but out of the way so you really feel like your escaping after a long day of sights! Breakfast was nice, quite a big choice of all you would expect! To top off the great service we explained that we were leaving early on our last day - before the breakfast opens - and asked if there was anything they could do. 5 mins later we had a knock on our door and they had organised some fruit, cartons of orange juice and croissants along with some cookies - a very, very nice touch! Would certainly recommend hotel golden.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, quiet hotel.”
Reviews.Author: ColoTripPlanner
Reviews.Content: Four of us (adults) stayed, in two rooms, in this lovely hotel for 5 nights in June. We liked that it was a small, family-run hotel. Our room was quite large and had a marvelous bathroom. The type of door and windows they had kept all the noise out! Note that not all area hotels have their air conditioning turned on in June but this one did. Also, there was a computer in the lobby that guests could use. The hotel's breakfast food selection was broad and nearby restaurants for dinner were reasonably priced with well prepared meals. In fact, we ate at Il Pomodoro two nights. My emails with the hotel before we went were always answered quickly. They were a delight to deal with. My only wish was that Hotel Golden was a bit more centrally located. However, it's very near Villa Borghese - a wonderful park you must visit. We laughed ourselves silly riding a "bicycle for four" there on Father's Day. I would stay at this hotel again and highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “A Hidden Treasure”
Reviews.Author: IanCountyAntrim
Reviews.Content: Giuseppe / Marco Thank you both for your kindness you showed to my wife and I during our short break in Rome. Your hotel is excellent and a hidden treasure within a beautiful city. When we return we will book with you again and I will advise my friends of your wonderful hotel. Best wishes Ian & Jennifer Herriot

Reviews.Title: “A Real Gem!”
Reviews.Author: Reeta1
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel in a great location, within walking distance of Spanish Steps and Borghese Gardens and Gallery. Easy to access bus and metro, as well. We stayed twice: first with our adult daughter in a room for three; later just my husband and me in a double room. Not unexpectedly, the rooms are smaller than U.S. hotel rooms, but we were out all day seeing Rome and were hardly in the hotel. The rooms are clean and the beds comfortable. Guiseppe and Marco are so helpful, recommending restaurants (don't miss Gioia Mia!), getting reservations for us at the Borghese, giving directions and arranging for a driver to pick us up at the airport. We highly recommend this lovely hotel and will certainly stay here when we return to Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Super little hotel, clean, friendly”
Reviews.Author: elfie7
Reviews.Content: Just back today from a great stay at this hotel. Friendly staff, recently modernised and clean. There was plenty of hot water and clean towels every day. Breakfast was a small selection but even my fussy eaters found something they liked. Hotel is only a 15minute walk from the Spanish steps and tourist area of Rome. Take advantage of the offer of pick up from the airport. This is much easier than trying to find a taxi and we had a lovely journey to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “loved this hotel and the staff (owners)”
Reviews.Author: duckmt
Reviews.Content: Guiseppi was so very very helpful to our entire family. my mothers luggage was lost by the airline and Guiseppi spent hours on the phone with the airline helping us locate her luggage. his helpfulness was over shadowed by how much we all enjoyed the rooms and breakfast. this hotel was clean and comfortable and wonderful place to stay in Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Great for sight-seeing”
Reviews.Author: Maggie73
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked a weekend break at the Hotel Golden following good reviews on here and from friends. It was a small hotel, with a clean room and generally good location for walking around Rome. It was our first time in the city and we walked everywhere. The owner on the front desk was helpful and gave directions and good tips on places to eat. The room was clean and comfortable though the stone floors were a little cold and probably more suitable for warmer weather. Our room was very close to reception / front door so it was a little noisy with doors banging. Overall it was quite basic but the room was great value and in a good location so I'd recommend it for those on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: libeh
Reviews.Content: The staff is friendly and helpful with language, maps, directions, and information about cultural attractions. The room was very tastefully decorated and spotlessly cleaned each day. This hotel is at an ideal location, quite and still close to the subway stations. Overall, this hotel was a great value for the price paid.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, excellent value”
Reviews.Author: PamlaJane
Reviews.Content: For the location, you cannot beat the price of this hotel. The room was not huge, but still larger than others we'd stayed at in Italy Three of us traveled together all around Italy, and it was a challenge to find hotels with room for all of us. Hotel Golden is right near all the nicest hotels in Rome, the US Embassy, and a nice stroll to the major monuments in Rome. The bathroom was huge, something I love, though it did not have a bathtub. The room had a mini-bar, robes and slippers for all of us. It was very clean and well-maintained. Wireless internet access was included (though we had to ask the night manager to turn it on late one evening) and satellite cable TV. The negatives: parking is difficult to find in the neighborhood. We parked on the street, and someone broke into our car (without breaking a window) and stole a few things that were in the back seat in plastic bags. Nothing expensive - and we know better than to have left the bags in the car overnight, but we arrived late and in the rain and just didn't have a chance to get everything out of the car in one trip. It is also a little tricky to get into the building the first time. You do not use a key to get into the building, but buzz the front desk. There is no doorman to help with the bags (and we had a lot of them). I had no complaints with the breakfast though I read here that others did not like the small breakfast room. Breakfast was pretty typical to me for a small European hotel. The management was very helpful - they showed us how to get everywhere in town, drawing the routes on a map. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Here's what we thought about the Hotel Golden”
Reviews.Author: cherimich
Reviews.Content: Rooms (we stayed here twice, at the beginning and end of our trip)--very clean, quiet, if a bit cramped, possibly because they were doubles masquerading as triples--the third bed was a foldaway ottoman thing that was at the foot of the two twins and took up most of the maneuvering space. The beds were comfortable, the foldaway not as much, but my 16 year old didn't mind. The air conditioning was adequate for an intensely hot period (even Romans were complaining). The bathroom was extremely clean, with terrycloth robes and slippers. One thing--floor of the shower is very slippery, especially as it becomes soapy--I'd recommend a towel on it to prevent falls (that's what my mother did). Breakfast--we thought the food was fine--no slimy salami or warm yogurt, as someone found, and there was a wide selection, although the fresh fruit seemed somehow more decorative than available--and the tiny room wasn't really a problem, although we, too, felt the need to keep our voices down a little, just in consideration for those who need a little quiet in the mornings. Location-for us, the proximity to the Villa Borghese and the adjacent gardens was great. My son and I walked to the coliseum and forum one day, tho it was too hot to walk back--it's all uphill. But the Spanish steps are close, and it's a pleasant walk downhill to get there--you arrive at the top of the steps, and can then continue down to the Trevi fountain, Piazza Venezia, etc. The neighborhood seemed quiet and safe, even late at night. The family who run the hotel were pleasant and helpful with directions when asked, but they weren't effusive, which is just what I find comfortable. We found that the antique elevator and the need to get buzzed in every time we returned just added to the flavor of being in another culture. I don't have anything to compare this hotel to in Rome, but we were comfortable and happy, and it didn't feel like we overpaid.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value; Caring management”
Reviews.Author: alfl
Reviews.Content: We selected Hotel Golden after reading the reviews in TripAdviser. It is rated a 2 star, but service and room we had are 3 or 4 star. This is an apartment building and the Hotel Golden occupies the 2nd floor. There is no lobby, no restaurants, no concierge, no WIFI. you have to be buzzed into the building, just like an apartment building. It has a good location, one block from the Borghesi Park, and one block from the very expensive Hotels and restaurants. It is not very close to a metro stop (about 15 walk to closest metro). Very quiet and safe area, very upscale. It is 4 minutes from the bus stop. Rome has frequent buses, but very difficutl to figure out where each is going. This small hotel (about 12 - 16 rooms) is family run. Guiseppe, one of the two brothers who run things, is outstanding. He truly understands customer service and realizes, as a small hotel, he must deliver excellent service to succeed. He helped us arrange day tours, and transportion. How many hotel owners would actually help you carry your bags to the waiting taxi? Guiseppe is a real gentleman and gem. (His brother is not so eager to help.) The room we were given was excellent - nice size, quiet, large bathroom with shower, well maintained. I did not see the other rooms (one other single guest said her room was small). The breakfast was fresh, nice variety and well served, although the breakfast room is very small. Rome Hotels are expensive. For the money, I do not believe we could have done better. When we return to Rome, we intend to stay at the Hotel Golden again.

Reviews.Title: “Relax in Rome”
Reviews.Author: bonvoyageNC
Reviews.Content: We just stayed 3 nights at this hotel at the end of a 2 week trip to Italy. A lovely place to stay! Not only is the hotel completely non-smoking (the primary reason I picked it), but the family that runs it really goes out of their way to look after their guests. We felt so welcome! Their service was topnotch! I loved having a bathrobe and slippers provided to relax in. Their recommendations on restaurants were wonderful as was their advice regarding public transportation. We were there with our 2 year old, and they were very solicitous of how we were traveling with her in her stroller. The shortcut to the Metro at the Spanish Steps was particularly appreciated on a rainy day. They also called to set up reservations (on the spot) to see the Villa Borghese. The breakfast was very good and definitely plentiful. We enjoyed it very much. All in all a wonderful experience, and we hope to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic value hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Mythoslivethedream
Reviews.Content: A great hotel with a fantastic location, great if you are travelling on a budget. Marco and the other people at reception were very friendly and helpful. Our room was quite spacious and it was clean, modern and agreeable. The breakfast room is a bit small and airless, that's probably the only downside to the hotel. Trust Marco in his restaurant recommendations and head to Pomodorino, just round the corner. Friendly service and great pizza! If you want to have a more sophisticated meal, try San marco, which is very close too. Tip for veggies: try the Naturist club.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel---Great Location”
Reviews.Author: MinnesotaSam
Reviews.Content: What a GREAT hotel! We chose this one for the price and especially for the great reviews I read on Trip Advisor. We want to be one more of those positive reviews. The hotel is immaculately clean, safe, and comfortable. And the King Size bed was Wonderful after a day of sightseeing!!!! The staff was extremely helpful at all times. The breakfast was very good. This was important---if you need to arrange an airport pick up, you can contact the hotel via e-mail/or phone and they will gladly do it for you. The location is absolutely perfect---very quiet for sleeping but easily walkable--if you can walk for 30 minutes ( or else take the Metro--it is easy to do). The Spanish Steps are 10 min walk, Trevi Fountain--10-15 min walk, Pantheon-15 min walk, Colliseum and Forum 25-35 min. We were very nervous about picking a hotel to stay in at Rome, however this was a WONDERFUL choice that we made. When we return to Rome we will come back to the Golden Hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Hotel”
Reviews.Author: difrombalwyn
Reviews.Content: My adult daughter and I stayed for two nights at the Golden Hotel at the end of September. Room pretty ordinary but the location and the friendly staff made up for it - and who spends much time in the room in Rome anyway. The location is great and we felt very safe walking around the area at night. The staff were really helpful with directions and transport etc. Well worth a visit for your next trip to Rome. Just read a review which said Il Pomodiro was awful - we had a lovely meal there - pasta and fish with zuccini - we were surrounded by huge family groups of locals on a Sunday night. We had a helpful waiter whose English was good and he helped us choose our meals - who knows why our meal was great and another reviewer's meal awful!!

Reviews.Title: “recommended hotel”
Reviews.Author: frommydesk
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Hotel Golden for four nights at the end of october. Our room was very comfortable with effective sound proof windows and a lovely bathroom. The staff were very helpful and provided a good city map with directions to the main attractions and recommendations to local restaurants. The location is excellent , being in a pleasant area just off Via Veneto and within walking distance of lots of interesting places. Other hotels in the area cost much more so the Golden is very good value and we would happily stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Thanks to Trip Advisor for a great find”
Reviews.Author: KiaOra1
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Golden this past week for three nights. I had booked for five nights, but because I needed to change my flight, I had to cancel the last two nights. Giuseppe and Marco were very gracious and understanding about the cancellation. Although my room (a single) was extremely small and rather dark, it was very clean and fairly comfortable. The bathroom was quite a good size and the shower stall larger than most I've been in at hotels in Italy. The family was gracious, extremely helpful and very hospitable. The breakfast was very good, with an amazing variety in such a small space. One very nice touch, which shows you how considerate the owners are--I had to leave very early in the morning for the airport, and Giuseppe had his mother prepare some breakfast items for me the night before so I would have something to eat before I went to the airport. That is the kind of personal touch that makes Hotel Golden so special. The hotel's location is great, close enough to most sights, but out of the hectic part of the city. I thoroughly enjoyed my stay there and will stay there again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic family-run hotel!”
Reviews.Author: CJcruzer
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights at the Hotel Golden, and by the end of our stay, it felt like we were saying goodbye to family. The hotel is located in a very nice neighborhood of Rome, close to the Borghese Gallery, Via Veneto, and Barberini metro station. Very easy walking to Trevi fountain, Pantheon, Piazza Navona - or else you can take the Electric tram (I believe the #116?) which also stops close to the hotel. Giuseppe and Marco gave us wonderful advice on transportation, eating, etc...and arranged our reservations to Borghese Gallery and our tickets for touring Tivoli - The rooms are spacious and the bathroom was beautiful and enormous! Everything was in tip-top shape, sparkling clean, fresh, and very comfortable. The morning breakfast in the dining area was always freshly prepared, well presented, not a thing out of place. We never left the table hungry! In addition, 24-hour free internet service is provided. I definitely recommend this hotel - it's in a beautiful area among hotels that cost at least twice as much! Even so, you could never replicate the personal touch that Giuseppe and family give to make your Rome trip that much more memorable. I hope to return soon to my new-found "family" in Rome. Carol & John / Ontario, Canada

Reviews.Title: “Great lttle hotel - super value”
Reviews.Author: longostein
Reviews.Content: We found Hotel Golden on TripAdvisor and we were not disappointed. We found the other reviews accurate - a great little family run hotel in a perfect location at a reasonable price. My wife and I went to Italy to celebrate our 20th anniversary and the Hotel Golden provided us with a great room (bigger than we expected in Rome), nice amenities and helpful staff. They even provide a computer to use at their desk. The bed was comfortable and the rooms were nicely furnished. We took advantage of the airport transfer service and he was waiting for us at the airport as promised. The breakfast, contrary to other reviews, is more than adequate (baked goods, Italian meats, cereal, fruit, coffee, tea, etc.) and constantly replensihed by the attentive staff. The desk staff, mostly family, gave excellent dining suggestions and transportation advice and their single sheet map that they hand-marked with the hotel and other spots was what we used most of the time. The location, just off the Via Veneto, is close to the Borghese garden and gallery, Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain and pretty much everything else in Rome. It's only a 5+ minute walk to two Metro stops which are easy to use and convenient to many places, including the Vatican. The price is excellent, especially compared to other hotels in the area. We highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint and quiet”
Reviews.Author: rrmask
Reviews.Content: My father and I stayed at the Hotel Golden 9/8 through 9/11, 2008. They set up our transpotation from the airport to the hotel which helped eliminate a lot of stress for me in getting there with my father in a wheelchair and luggage. The room was spacious, clean and beautifully decorated. We were provided bathrobes and slippers to wear. We had a delicious breakfast each morning before starting our day to include cereal, fruits, meats, boiled eggs, pastries, juice and coffee. The hotel is family owned and operated and they all were so helpful. They recommended places to eat close by and helped with directions and a map. During our stay my ankle began swelling. They were ever so nice to provide me with ice each evening to pack on my ankle. The family went out of their way to make our stay comfortable. The hotel was one block from Via Veneto and within walking distance to most anywhere. My problem was Rome is not very accomodating for people in wheelchairs so it was a little tricky trying to maneuver Dad around. We fell in love with the family and their hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel with Personal Touches”
Reviews.Author: Netoy
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in one of the nicest neighborhoods in Rome and is near to almost all the tourist sights. We were able to walk to the Trevi Fountain, the Spanish Steps, and others. One of the things that I liked about this hotel is that it is run by a family that caters to your needs. It is a small enough hotel (15 rooms) that the service at times becomes pleasurably personal. The breakfast is prepared by the family matriarch and it is one of the best breakfasts we had during our Europe stay. Good location, good staff, good service. What more could you ask for?

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel”
Reviews.Author: bigtevellers
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Golden In mid September this year. This hotel is perfectly located in Rome and is within easy walking distance to all one may want to see. The Borghese Museum and Gardens are steps away and the Spanish Steps, excellent shopping, and reasonable restaurants are all close by. What makes this hotel so special, however, is the family who own and run it. Their attention to detail is exceptional,from slippers and robes in the rooms, to a most delicious breakfast, to the tasty candies on the hallway tables and in the rooms. We had a little medical emergency while there and Guiseppe and his mother and family were so helpful and concerned. All was well in the end but it was a comfort to have them to guide us in a foreign city. They couldn't have helped us enough. There are different size rooms at the hotel. We stayed in a smaller room with a great view over the street below. The sounds of a city waking in the morning, getting their coffee and chatting made us feel part of the life of the wonderful city of Rome. This hotel is located in a very nice part of Rome and the family take pride in their hotel. We would definitely stay with them again and are looking forward to another visit in the near future. We cannot say enough about what a wonderful experience it was to stay at Hotel Golden and highly recommend the hotel for its location, rooms, breakfast, but most of all, for the family who own and run it in such a professional , yet comfortable and welcoming manner. Vancouver, Canada

Reviews.Title: “What a delight!”
Reviews.Author: KCounts
Reviews.Content: As soon as we returned home from our trip to Tuscany and Rome, I sent the following email to the staff (actually a delightful family) of the Hotel Golden: I want to thank your for an extremely relaxing and comfortable stay on September 11 and 12. We chose your hotel after much research, paying particular attention to the many positive comments on the Trip Advisor website. We found your accommodations quiet, spacious, extremely attractive (beautiful wallpaper!), and sparkling clean. Also, your breakfast buffet was beyond compare. With the Borghese Gardens, Via Veneto, Spanish Steps and Trevi Fountain within a few minutes walk, the location is ideal. Perhaps most notably, your helpfulness and welcoming spirit underscored our general impression that of all delights to be found in Italy, the most treasured is that of its people. Should you decide one day to visit our part of the USA, we would welcome you as OUR guests. You have our address! Karin Counts and family, Easton, MD

Reviews.Title: “Fantasic hotel”
Reviews.Author: jess99
Reviews.Content: Fantastic little hotel at a great price. Great staff members. A bit of a distance to the main attratctions, but we enjoyed the walk each day. Would definatly go back.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: livmack
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Golden for 5 nights in July/August. It was so nice to have a nice place to come back to get out of the summer heat! We had a small room but we only paid around 80 euros per night and we knew before we got there that it would be small so we were happy with it. The floors were tiled and our bathroom looked new. It was very clean, the bed was comfortable and I loved the bathrobes as a nice touch. The breakfast was fine. We just had croissants with ham and cheese. I tried to have a bread roll one day but I couldnt bite into it - it was too hard! The buzzing in made me feel like I was inconveniencing whoever was at the front desk but it made the place feel secure. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: TravelCaymanIslands
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Golden in Rome while on our honeymoon in July. It was the best little holel, family owned and with perfect location. The hotel is run by two brothers and their family and they are all very helpful with all requests. The breakfast is also very good with plenty of choices, and if you are looking for restaurant options, ask at the front desk as there are a couple of excellent choices in the area where Italians eat, great food and much lower prices than those on Via Veneto that are purely designed for tourists therefore triple the price! We took taxis from the hotel to visit most of the sites but the spanish steps are within walking distance via a an underground metro walkway which is very safe and efficient. Also on the walkway there is a supermarket where we bought water at very very low prices compared to everywhere else. I would recommend this hotel over all others, considering the prices are so reasonable and only one block up you would be paying triple! Very very happy with our choice thanks to the many reviews on tripadvisor.

Reviews.Title: “great find in Rome”
Reviews.Author: jmlcb
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Golden Hotel. always a pleasure talking to the owners who gave great directions and advice. will definitely recommend this hotel. very clean, great location, great price and very comfortable room. The air conditioning was essential this July and it delivered! Thank you for making our Rome visit so memorable.

Reviews.Title: “The truth about the "gem"”
Reviews.Author: Marc07
Reviews.Content: While reading all the positive reviews about hotel Golden one can get really enthusiastic... just as we did. We stayed 3 nights during our trip in Rome from 28-31 July - room 102. After this we moved on to Florence (Firenze) and after that to lake Garda. It is called many times "a little Gem", but is it? My intention is to give a fair and balanced review and not to write the obvious: its is clean, it is located very good (near villa Borghese) the rooms are small, the breakfast area is small, no outside noise, good value for money. After our trip from Rotterdam (Netherlands) to Rome in the night it felt really good to arrive at the hotel in the morning. A sir named Marco checked us is and gave us a good explanation of the city highlights. When we got our room something seemed to be wrong with the electricity. Me and my girl both heard a ticking noise when the lights were off. Although it was not very loud, one could easily hear it: it was really annoying. I called Marco and explained my inconvenience about the ticking noise. He replaced two light bulbs but didn't seem to care about the complaint: he could not hear it, but it was probably the transistor in the bulb. (I can tell you this was not this case because of my technical background). There was nothing he could do he said with a lacking attitude. I don't know if anyone ever listened to ticking noises while getting a good night sleep, but it drives you nuts. I understand that some things cannot be noticed by hotel staff or fixed during a stay, but the least thing they can do is to say "We are truthfully sorry about the inconvenience or I will get someone to look at it. None of this was the case". I fixed the problem by removing some light bulbs and removing the key card, so the electricity was off. Not very nice in case of a nightly toilet visit. Mr Guiseppe is in my opinion a much better hotelier as he is more attending and friendly. I'm not bashing his brother here, but in a family hotel one should make people welcome. When you say nothing when a hotel guest comes in or goes out, you aren't doing a good job. Second thing a new traveller should be aware of is the small and not so good breakfast: the food is pre fabricated and in some cases warmed up. You expect to have at least some piece of decent bread. The largest piece was about 5 inch; really small. Although the woman handling the breakfast is really kind, she should in my opinion have at least serve some fresh things. The fruit is also canned..not very good. My advise is to charge 5-10 euro extra for a room and include a fresh breakfast. Taking all things together I would say that for its price level it is still a good pick to explore Rome. But I can say its a warm and welcoming family hotel. Its average but has a lot of potential. A small tip for dinner is the small restaurant around the corner (right). So just walk out of the hotel on the right side and take a right turn, it is about 20 meters on the left side. Very good food.

Reviews.Title: “Best value hotel in Rome - 'nuff said!”
Reviews.Author: chainstrainer
Reviews.Content: We booked this place months in advance of our July 2008 stay based on reviews on Venere.com and here at Tripadvisor. Everything was just as described by the many glowing reviews from pleased guests - which now include us. The Hotel Golden is simply a great find for those wondering where to stay in Rome. This small,15-room, family-run place is a comfortable, clean, modestly-priced, hotel located in a desirable neighborhood that represents a great travel value. The property is very small and therefore has no amenities beyond a tiny elevator (the hotel is on the floor immediately above ground level - 1st floor in Italy) and a small breakfast room, but the price, location, room features and friendly staff (brothers Giuseppe and Marco run the front desk) more than make up for this. The guest rooms are all very comfortable and clean, though some are cramped in size and occasional noise in the hallway is a detraction for a couple of the rooms near the front desk (ask for the more remote rooms). On the plus side: the included breakfasts have a wide selection of continental-style foods and the coffee is excellent; the rooms are very clean and the beds comfortable; the bathrooms are modern and well-equipped with toiletries and even plush bathrobes and slippers; the location is convenient in a quiet, fashionable neighborhood off the top of the Via Veneto near the Spanish Steps (several $$$$$ 5-star hotels in this same area), the #116 bus stop and the Barberini and Spagna metro stations. I would highly recommend this hotel to travelers who are going to be out of their rooms much of the time sight-seeing and not expecting a resort-style experience but just want a reasonably-priced, safe, quiet and clean place to sleep in a convenient location near the central heart of historic Rome. Eating nearby: Pomodorino, just a short block east of the hotel, is a large and vibrant neighborhood place for great cheap pizzas, roasted meats and desserts. San Marco, on the same block, is a hip, modern place very popular with the younger, fashionable crowd. It serves more upscale food choices but at prices that are still reasonable. I recommend both. We just had to try the famous Bellini cocktails and sandwiches at Harry's Bar, a short walk west to the Via Veneto, but be forewarned - you will pay dearly for it, even for lunch. Almost any place on the Via Veneto will drain your wallet except for the cheap pasta place just up from the Barberini metro. Skip it unless you really want to splurge on a fashionable al fresco dining experience on the Via Veneto. Getting to Spanish Steps: There is no direct way to walk due west on surface streets to the Spanish Steps so you must walk down either Via Veneto or Via Porta di Pinciana then back up Via Sistina to the Piazza di Spagna. The Hotel Golden is an uphill walk back, of course, which can be daunting at the end of a long day walking all over Rome. You can alternatively hop on bus #116 or, if at the Spanish Steps, try using the underground walkways and escalators between the Spagna metro stop and the top of the Via Veneto. Look for the escalators outside Harry's Bar, a short block from the hotel. Transportation: I highly recommend the Roma Pass if you will be spending two or three days in Rome. The 20 euro price is a good value as it includes all public transit for three days (metro, tram and bus lines) and provides two free admissions to your choice of 40 attractions like the Colosseum, the Palatine museums or Borghese Gallery, with discounts off any others beyond the first two. The Metro is very easy to use as there are only two lines that cross at Termini train station (Barbarini and Spagna are the two closest stops) and it is the quickest way to get to the Vatican, the Colosseum and destinations further out. Bus #116 terminus is just a block away from the hotel and the other end is a short walk from the Vatican. Recommended maps: The Roma Pass includes a good map (the same provided free by the hotel) however, the best maps in general I've found for Rome and other cities are those produced by MapEasy.com ($7-8 each) as they are very easy to read and use, highly informative and durable (water-resistant and tear-proof). In addition to clearly marked streets and landmarks, they are profusely detailed with location and information on all historic sites, hotels, restaurants and cafes, retail shops and department stores, banks, hospitals, entertainment and parks, transit (metro, bus, airports, ferries, car rentals and parking), etc. The maps concentrate on the city's center (there is no outlying regional info) and include enlarged scale views of several of the most important neighborhoods. Other travelers remarked on our MapEasy guide maps that we used in Rome, Venice, Florence and Barcelona. I have no affiliation with the publisher but am just an impressed, satisfied user.

Reviews.Title: “"Absolutely magnificent!"”
Reviews.Author: caletaMaryland
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a month in Italy, we stay the last five day at the Golden Hotel in Rome. The hotel is magnificent and we have never experienced such incredible service before. This is a gem of a hotel--tastefully furnished, bathroom, the most efficient in one months of traveling in Italy, Giuseppe, Teresa and Marco was very helpful and they spoke English and Spanish. It felt like our home. The location of the hotel is a few blocks from the Piazza Di Spagna, Fontana de Trevi, etc. You can walk everywhere. There are a lot of nice places to eat close by. We would highly recommend Hotel Golden for anyone who is spending time in Rome. Juan and Marta Becce Maryland, USA

Reviews.Title: “Great family run hotel”
Reviews.Author: KBMW
Reviews.Content: This family run hotel was clean, spacious, well located and very quiet. The rooms were very comfortable and the added touch of robes and slippers was quite nice. The breakfast was simple with lots of variety. Family members were very helpful. We felt very safe. It was also well priced.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value & Location”
Reviews.Author: supaflyNYC
Reviews.Content: We recently spent two nights at this hotel based on reviews we'd read on tripadvisor. Pros: The room was quiet -- a big deal to me -- and we were able to sleep through the night without interruptions. I had asked for a quiet room in advance, though I'm not sure other rooms wouldn't have been quiet as well. Great location -- located at the top of the Via Veneto, near the Villa Borghese. We had a short time in Rome, so we never made it to the Villa Borghese, but it was very convenient for us to walk right down Via Veneto and pick up the subway at Barberini Square. The hotel is about equidistant from this stop and the stop by the Spanish Steps. (Side note: There is a change place right near the entrance to the Barberini subway at the bottom of Via Veneto if you are walking down the right side of the street from the hotel. It does not charge a flat rate commission, so you do not feel pressured to change more money than necessary, and I found it to be one of the best rates in Rome and Florence during our trip). It's also a fairly short walk to the Trevi Fountain (about 10 - 15 minutes) and it's possible to walk to just about anywhere in Rome, but we walked to the Pantheon (about 15 minutes) and Trastevere (about 30 minutes) with no problems. Helpful Staff -- they gave us good directions and answered any questions. Cons: Conservation -- A/C set to a minimum temperature (would not be an issue if we weren't required to turn in the key card that controls the power each time we left the hotel). It took the room about an hour to cool off -- a bit of an inconvenience in July when Rome is unbearably hot and humid. This would not be an issue other times of the year. Additionally, I asked for an extra towel the day we got in and the person who gave me one seemed a bit less than forthcoming. I know we are used to more in America and I have no problem conserving, but it just felt the slightest bit overboard to me. Bed -- not terrible (I debated even including it here) but it was a bit hard. I did not wake up feeling stiff, so it may have felt harder to me than it really was. Overall, a decent experience and I would recommend this hotel to people looking for value in Rome -- the location is good and the staff are friendly; the room is quiet and clean. I do NOT, however, recommend Rome in July. It was very hot, and worse, unbearably humid. Not fun when you are walking around exploring a city.

Reviews.Title: “Nice family hotel”
Reviews.Author: sxeight
Reviews.Content: Nice, family-run hotel. Rooms slightly cramped; but clean. Stayed for 2 nights at the beginning of the trip and 1 night at the end of the trip. Air conditioning broke down and it was very hot in Rome that day (July 3). Had to leave the hotel because of it; but were not charge for the night.

Reviews.Title: “What a gem”
Reviews.Author: richthor
Reviews.Content: For the price, this is a wonderful hotel. The location is great. The service is personal, and the breakfast is extensive and good. On top of that the rooms are very large, by European standards.

Reviews.Title: “Great little family run hotel!”
Reviews.Author: TheMickinCaryNC
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Rome from June 3-8, 2008, and Hotel Golden was our base of choice from the other reviews we have read on various sites, including this one. We were glad with our choice! The hotel is family owned and run, and you will typically find Guiseppe, his brother, or his sister behind the front desk. They are very friendly and care very much about your stay. They helped us several times with directions and dinner recommendations. They had good suggestions for affordable ways to get around town too. The hotel itself is very small and occupies the second floor of a building that is just one block away from Via Veneto and the Borghese Gardens. It is also an easy walk to the subway and some of the sites. The rooms are typical for Europe, small. We booked a "triple room", and while the bathroom was very nice and quite large, the area for living/sleeping was quite tight. But the room was very clean and comfortable for the limited time we spent in it. The breakfast each morning is the same and they do not offer a very large variety/selection, but you should be able to find something to enjoy. The breakfast area itself is also very small and cozy. I do not believe they offer lunch or dinner at this hotel. If you are looking for an affordable place to stay in in the heart of Rome, we strongly recommend the Hotel Golden. Great location, friendly service, and very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Golden was a gem!”
Reviews.Author: Floridians16
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent a week at the Hotel Golden in Rome and were pleasantly surprised to find such a gem. We had searched the Internet for a place to stay and considered ourselves lucky, as it was all we hoped for. The hotel is located in a nice part of town in an area of much more expensive hotels, with bus stops and the subway ( both of which we used) conveniently nearby. It is also within walking distance of many of the sights, including the Galleria Borghese and a beautiful adjoining park only a 10-minute walk. Our room was on the front of the building overlooking a quiet street. It had all the amenities we wanted, including air-conditioning, plenty of room for two people, a large comfortable bed, cable T.V., a nice bathroom with shower and hair-dryer, and even fluffy robes and slippers. The room was always pristine when we returned from a long day of sight-seeing, and it was so pleasant to see Guiseppe at the front desk. He was very helpful in suggesting restaurants and bus routes, and even arranged for us to get into a sight we wanted to see. There is a breakfast buffet off the main hallway, which was plenty to get us started each day. We met several other U.S. travelers there and it was nice to chat with someone from home. Internet access is also available at the front desk, so we were able to communicate with our family if we wanted. Our stay was a most positive experience, and if you are lookiing for a safe, comfortable, friendly place to stay in Rome, for the price you can't beat the Hotel Golden.

Reviews.Title: “A WONDERFUL FIND”
Reviews.Author: Journeys005
Reviews.Content: We had two delightful rooms in the back. Superior doubles. I have been in the travel business (agent and owner) for 35 years and always stayed in 5 star hotels. Decided to try a smaller family owned hotel and based on detail from Trip Advisor, we booked for 5 nights. The service and hospitality was outstanding.. We will return and always think of Hotel Golden as our home in Rome. The money you save as compared to bigger hotels allows you much more purchasing power in euros. Giuseppe was always there to help with our requests. Our grandaughters loved the area and walked to many of Rome's beautiful sights. Overall, I will be recommending this hotel to my clients and family. You should enjoy life instead of always being critical. You will not be dissapointed. Thank you Giuseppe and everyone at the Hotel Golden.

Reviews.Title: “Good, Not Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: GinoStevo
