Reviews.Content: A party of two couples, this was our first visit to Rome and we stayed at the Golden for 3 nights with at the end of May. On the positive side, the family was helpful and pleasant - especially Guiseppe, the rooms were quiet, clean and the bathrooms were up-to-date. Free internet access and use of their laptop was a plus. The location was convenient and easily accessible by foot to some of the key locations such as the Spanish Steps, the Borghese gardens, Via Veneto and others. The security was good in that you had to be "buzzed in" by the desk attendant to gain access to the hotel. The driver and car they secured to get us to the airport was excellent and the 40 euro price seemed quite reasonable. On the down side, the breakfast was adequate but had the quality one might expect with canned fruit, pre-packaged deli meats, and mass-produced pastry. The lesser priced of the two rooms we had was extremely small with barely enough floor space to move around the bed. There is no common area in which to relax and sit with a book, glass of wine or cup of coffee, and due to size and available furniture the rooms are not conducive to anything but sleeping. Overall, a sure thing for cleanliness and convenience but I think perhaps we could have done better, especially now that we've seen the city and realize how accessible other locations would also have been. Price at 180 Euro a night may seem high, but one street over on the Via Veneto you'd pay 600-800 euro a night at the Marriott or other high-end hotels, so everything is relative. I'd stay there again but would check out other options as well.

Reviews.Title: “don't bother with hotel golden... much cheaper and friendlier rooms in rome”
Reviews.Author: breakoutofthebox911
Reviews.Content: my wife and I stayed here just one night at the end of our trip in italy. it was ok, but it is definitely not worth its price. hotel golden is in the nw corner of rome, relatively close to the trevi fountain and the spanish steps. it is a small hotel on the 2nd floor of a large building on via marche. the staff was friendly and somewhat helpful, but hassled us about a few extra towels. it is clean and well kept, but has an unearned 'we're the four seasons' attitude throughout, hence their prices. our room was okay, but the A/C didn't work very well (if at all). they said they did not have a fan,and that the air was already on... their 'breakfast' was awful and NOT what i would expect at 180 euro/night. stale pastries and cereal or slimy salami? warm yogurt, anyone? very unsatisfying and simply substandard. don't bother with the pub on the corner of via marche and via sicilia... (just down the sidewalk from hotel golden). they are a total ripoff and will slap you with a 2 euro service charge just to sit on their sidewalk tables to have a beer that you bought FROM them. if for some reason you are compelled to stay at hotel golden, take advantage of their deal with a local driving company if you need to go to the airport. it was 40 euro and our driver was great... much less than any cab would have been, as the main airport in rome (FCO) is rather removed from the city. they are also rather close to the 116 bus, which is a fleet of small buses that go all over town. other than that, i see no reason to patronize hotel golden... if you need a great place to stay in rome, stay at hotel paba... i wrote a review of it which can be seen on its review page. travel safely : )

Reviews.Title: “Luke warm recommendation”
Reviews.Author: dogmandan
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Hotel Golden for 4 days with another couple at the end of our 15 day trip. I am in the minority of our group with a recommendation, but it is only luke warm. I give Hotel Golden pluses for value and service. The most negative factor is overall comfort. Both rooms had king size beds (two twins pushed together) which were fine. There were no chairs in the room other than one small desk chair. That would be OK except the hotel has no lobby so there was not one place to sit and read or relax. If you were in your room you had to lie on the bed. The bath was adequate and everything was clean except for the floor. Our feet would be dirty after walking across the floor. House slippers are provided which helped on that problem. One room suffered from a lot of street noise. If we wanted to visit and plan with our traveling companions, we had to find a cafe. The hallway was cramped (narrow and lined with big bags of room linens. You could not pull your luggage behind you. The breakfast room was tiny and the selections were the weakest and of the least quality of any hotel we stayed at. The second day my wife noticed that the canned pineapple was beginning to ferment. and the bread products were old and dry. They did offer a bottle of complimentary sparkling wine which we did not use. The front desk service was great. We got good recommendations on dining and reservations. They also arranged airport transportation and gave us advice on tipping, etc. The location was just OK. It was just off the Via Veneto and across the road from the Villa Borghese. The consensus was that we would not stay there again and could only recommend with a full disclosure of the negatives which, in our opinion, outweighed the pros.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: SaraSuffolk
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights and found that we truly enjoyed Hotel Golden’s location in Rome. The hotel’s location, near the upscale Via Veneto, is a nice, calm oasis away from the touristy crush of Rome. We found the nearby buses (less than 5 minute walk) and Metro stop (less than 10 minute walk in an underground tunnel) useful to get to the major sites when we didn’t feel like walking. We stayed in the King Superior and, based on other reviews, I asked if I could be placed in a quiet room away from the front desk. I am a light sleeper so this is important to me. While there was no noise from the street, I could occasionally hear conversations and the television near the front desk, but never after 11:00 P.M. or before 7:00 A.M. The room and bathroom was spacious, clean and comfortable. (When we travel, we don’t spend a lot of time in our room except to relax a little and to sleep so we don’t need a suite or additional sitting areas.) Marco and Giuseppe were very helpful prior to my arrival, answering questions, securing reservations, etc. They check their email often and respond quickly and courteously. Once we arrived, they were happy to give directions and assist us with transportation issues. Giuseppe informed us that there is a travel agent in the same building who, for no additional charge, was able to book our Eurostar train reservations to get to Florence and Venice. I highly recommend this service, to avoid confusion at the train station and to help better plan any train travel since you know in advance the date, time and seat reservations. Another gentleman also worked at the front desk and speaks little English. We speak very little Italian, so we learned quickly to get all of our questions answered by Marco or Giuseppe when we saw them at the front desk. This is not a complaint, but just a suggestion to other English speaking travelers. The size of the breakfast room was not a problem for us and we only had to wait 5 minutes on one day before we could be seated. We enjoyed the extra security feature of leaving our key at the front desk and getting “buzzed” in upon our return. I give this hotel 5 stars for value because I did A LOT of searching for hotels before making this reservation and felt I could not find another hotel in the same class in a superior location for the same rate or better. To Americans, nothing is a good value in Italy right now, with the weak dollar, but this is not something to penalize the hotel for in terms of value rating. There was one issue that disappointed me. We arranged, with our reservation, for the car service at 40 Euros to pick us up at the airport. I emailed my flight information to them and asked if they would monitor my arrival online, since I may not be able to call them to report a delay, and they agreed to do this. Long story short, my flight did not arrive at 9:00 A.M. as planned and our arrival was changed to 6:45 P.M. I called the hotel from Amsterdam that morning to let them know of the change in plans. A woman, who does not speak English, answered the phone. I do not speak Italian so I was unable to communicate with her. So I paid 5 Euros for a 10 minute internet connection in the airport and emailed the hotel with the information, asking them to monitor my new arrival time. I then was off to take another flight to Paris to get to Rome. Like I said, long story. Our flight landed in Rome right around 7:00 P.M. and we found our driver about 5 minutes later. The service was wonderful and exactly what we needed after a long trip, with many complications, to get there. When we got to the hotel, we paid our driver the previously agreed upon (and verified by email) 40 Euros, but he insisted we owed him 55. We walked into the hotel together because he wanted the hotel staff to explain the cost to us. Giuseppe told us that the fee is 55 Euros because we landed after 7:00 P.M. He then said “What time did you land again? Was it before or after 7:00 P.M.? If you had to get your bags and you did not reach the driver until after 7:00, then you have to pay 55.” I informed him that no one told me of this and if they had, I would have just taken the train in. 40 Euros for the service is reasonable. 55 with the current exchange rate would have changed our minds. He stated that Marco emailed me with this information, but I told him I did not have access to email during that time since I was flying. He shrugged and said “I’m sorry but this is the arrangement we have with the driver” and that was it. I am a business owner and understand that occasional mistakes or lack of communication may happen from time to time. I also know that a sincere and appropriate apology goes a long way to smooth over any problems. An extra bottle of Prosecco or something similar would have cost them little and would have been a nice gesture to show regret over the situation and appreciation for our business. But based on the response to the problem, we assume there was no regret. This was my only disappointment with our stay and I found it surprising, based on our other interactions with the hotel owners. This is also the main reason I am giving a 4 star rating. Would I consider staying here again? Yes. Would I ask about any issues that might change what I’ve agreed to pay? Yes. Overall a nice hotel with a good location and value.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: dickensdad
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Golden for the last night of our trip to Italy. Our room was a "small double" - it really was quite small. The bed was a little too firm for our liking. Breakfast was not served until 7:30 AM, so we didn't really have time to eat much before we had to leave for the airport. Marco was very helpful and courteous, and he suggested an excellent restaurant in the area. The Golden may be a two star hotel, but it is certainly located in a five star neighborhood. The Via Veneto area is very pleasant and convenient to other areas of Rome. In spite of minor shortcomings, the Hotel Golden represents an outstanding value for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: MandS_8
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel! We chose this one for the price and especially for the great reviews I read on Trip advisor. We want to be one more of those positive reviews. What we loved about the hotel was its location near some very nice places. It was close to great (and cheap) restuarants - ask the hotel they recommend these. It is also close to the metro and hop-on-hop-off stop. We both felt very safe here

Reviews.Title: “Nice and cozy. Perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: sveta2407
Reviews.Content: Company of three (my sister, our friend and myself) stayed at the Golden Hotel for 2 nights. The hotel is immaculately clean and comfortable. Staff was extremely helpful at all times. Breakfast was very decent. if you need to arrange airport pick up, you can contact the hotel via e-mail and they will gladly do it for you.The location is absolutely perfect (walking distance to all major sightseeing sites of Rome): Villa Borgese - 2 min walk, Spanish Steps - 10 min walk, Fontana De Trevi - 10-15 min walk, Pantheon - 15 min, Colliseum and Forum - 20-25 min. Barberini subway station is just 10 min away. Although check in time is 3.00 PM, they let us in at 11.00 AM. Our plane was at 8.00 pm. So we checked out in the morning and left our luggage in the hotel till 4.00 pm at no charge. Also it was very nice to get a bottle of italian champagne as a welcoming gift upon arrival. If we ever will have a chance to return, we wil stay there because it is reasonably priced, comfotable, and perfectly located. Special thanks to Marco, Maria and Giusseppe from Svetlana, Alla, and Elena!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice and cozy”
Reviews.Author: daugas
Reviews.Content: Wonderful value for money, friendly and helpful staff. Location is perfect for newtimers in Rome. If you ever go for a weekend visit - choose them :)

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant stay!”
Reviews.Author: CarolinaWanderers
Reviews.Content: My husband and I truly enjoyed our stay at Hotel Golden. Our guest room was comfortable, quiet, and spacious by European standards. For a very reasonable price, we enjoyed a spotlessly clean room with lots of amenities, including a mini bar, in-room safe, and plush bathrobes. The family-run hotel had an extremely helpful and attentive staff. The owners, Marco & Giuseppe, were friendly and willing to answer all of our questions. We appreciated their assistance in arranging airport transportation to and from the hotel. The breakfast buffet was quite ample and included pastries, cereals, fruits, meats, cheeses, yogurt, juice, and coffee. The Borghese Gallery, Spanish Steps, and Piazza Barberini (metro stop) are just a short walk from the hotel. We would definitely stay at Hotel Golden again if we are ever lucky enough to return to Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Loved this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: rectordn
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for two night during the end of our honeymoon. Upon arrival we were helped with our luggage at the front door by one of the brothers that owns the hotel. While we were checking in the other brother who spoke perfect English gave us a map and highlighted all the attractions of Rome and how to get to each of them. He also recommended local resturants that gave us a real taste of Rome. The room was not large but the bed was soft and comfortable and it was very quite at night. The hotel is well located and we were able to walk to the Trevi Fountain and the Roman Forum no problem. We were also told how to use the Metro to get to the places that were not within walking distance. Breakfast in the morning was great. The hotel also has a deal with a private car company that will pick you up from the airport and also take you back. I highly recommend that service. The front desk is open 24 hours and they hold your room key for you so that you don't ever have to worry about losing your key while you are out. I loved this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Happy Seniors!”
Reviews.Author: MurphyChicago
Reviews.Content: My husband and I are a mature couple who have traveled through many European countries. We found Hotel Golden to be excellent for us! The rooms were spotlessly clean and comfortable and the bathroom was modern and cleaner than home. We learned that we could have saved a lot of time and money by having the wonderful family who owns the hotel make transportation arrangements to and from the airport for us. The breakfasts were much appreciated and they were happy to help with any and all questions we had. We would definitely stay again and have recommended it to our friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Quality hotel”
Reviews.Author: Vegasking
Reviews.Content: Our party consisting of two couples satyed th Hotel Golden for three nights in March. The hotel is in a very nice area that is easy to reach by public transport and walking (20 minutes from Colloseum). The rooms are very clean and well appointed but however are very small. As previous posters have mentioned the Spanish Steps can be reached by the Metro tunnel although if is a nice day it is a pleasant walk winding your way down through the streets to get there. All in all a very enjoyable stay and all four members of our party would stay here again albeit in one of the larger rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Magnifico!”
Reviews.Author: Leonje
Reviews.Content: Hotel Golden is a magnificent bargain. It is located in the center of Rome near Via Veneto and the US embassy and is relatively close to the Piazza di Spagna, the Piazza Barberini. We had a bit of trouble locating the hotel after getting off the bus, but after wandering around a bit, we found it. Front desk staff was fantastic. They located points of interest on the free map and showed us various routes we could take to get to them. Front desk was also prompt to buzz us in when we came in at night (you must turn in your room keys each time you leave). We booked a Small Double (Queensize bed). That decription was accurate. The room was quite small - it was difficult to open my suitcase! However, it was very clean and tastefully decorated. Our TV somehow got CNN in English. The staff put a little bowl with candies on the table! It was all the little details that really made the place. The bathroom was small, but clean. There were plenty of towels along with complementary shampoo, shower gel, soap, and a little razor. There were even two bathrobes for us to use! The complementary breakfast was delicious. There were all sorts of options to choose from: pastries, cereal, hardboiled eggs, fruits, meat. All this for only 80 euros/night!

Reviews.Title: “Great value! Nice staff!”
Reviews.Author: Lorelle1313
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in a great area that had a lot of resturants to choose from. It was a few blocks from the subway station but it was still really easy to get too. Rooms were always very clean as well as the bathrooms (which included terry cloth robes!) Very quite and had a great breakfast. There is also a great resturant across the street (La Bruscetta).

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Toritos
Reviews.Content: We stayed four nights in this hotel and we were very pleased. The location is central in a quiet street. Our room and the bathroom were very clean and new. The people at the recepcion are very helpfull and they speak perfect English and Spanish. The breakfast is ok, there is a lot of choice. We recomend this hotel and we'll stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and very clean”
Reviews.Author: steviemagid
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Golden at the end of a cruise for one night. It was a very nice hotel owned and operated by one family. The room was not spacious, but very clean. The bathroom was spotless and modern. It was charming. Unique setting for hotel on the 2nd floor of what looked to be an older office building. There is an older elevator with wooden doors and moveable gate that was just large enough to transport my husband and all of our luggage up to the front door of the hotel. I took the stairs. You have to buzz to get into the building and then buzz again when you get to the entrance, if it is after dark. Great location for touring, eating or anything else. Would stay there again. Quite reasonable, considering how strong the Euro is to the dollar right now. Wouldl gladly stay there again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant and central”
Reviews.Author: mjmcork
Reviews.Content: Stayed a few nights here. Very central and reasonably priced. Some rooms very small however - worth being sure that you are not in a tiny room if (like me) you dislike cramped spaces. Breakfasts basic but plenty food there. Staff uncommonly supercilious though, even for Rome!

Reviews.Title: “wonderful family atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: savannahAlabama
Reviews.Content: We picked the hotel golden because of reviews from tripadvisor and they were right. It is a wonderful family run hotel where the people really care. Internt for free, great deal, breakfast watched over by Mom, very good, clean and quiet. Great location. Rooms are small but that is Europe. Hopefully if we return to Rome we know where we will stay.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful Stay”
Reviews.Author: nenebugSavannah
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel Golden with another couple while recently traveling to Rome. This little family run Inn is a wonderful find. Our room was very small, as was the bath, but the entire hotel is spotless and the breakfast better by far than more expensive establishments we stayed in on our trip. We espicially enjoyed the location and the excellent recommendations made by the owners for good restaurants, touring, etc. You can stay in much more expensive accommodations while in Rome,but this little hotel offers everything you need at a very fair price. We highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: mac1950
Reviews.Content: This is a gem of a hotel just off via veneto and conveniently located. Two brothers Marco and Guiseppe run this hotel and their mother is the "behind the scenes" person who makes sure everything is running perfectly! The hotel is clean, the rooms are large and the bathrooms are huge - even by American standards! This is a place where they treat their guets like family. We mentioned to them that we liked the candy they put out in the front desk and made enquiries to see where we could buy some. We were told that it comes from a hotel supply source and was not available in the retail stores. But that evening the lovely mother knocks on our door and gives us a bag of the candy! Wow - talk about personal service.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect home base in Rome”
Reviews.Author: kat-MEM
Reviews.Content: I chose this place for my husband & me to stay based on the reviews. We were not disappointed. When we arrived in Rome from Orvieto via train, we decided to take a cab to the hotel since we weren't yet familiar with the city's layout. However, after 4 nights @ the hotel, we felf comfortable enough (& wanted to postpone our inevitable departure) to walk to the Termini. It probably took about 20 minutes & we wern't walking fast. We each were pulling a 21" rolling suitcase. It was worth the walk to have our last hour in Rome be spent on the streets, taking it all in. The hotel breakfast was great; plenty to get you going for the day. It was quite easy to find our way around the city from the hotel & we even wandered through the Borghese gardens one night while they were showing an opera on a big outdoor movie screen. It was a lovely Italian experience. My only suggestion would be for more lighting in the rooms. The bathrooms were nice & bright but the actual room seemed to have soft yellow light bulbs that made reading maps somewhat difficult. Overall, a fabulous & extremely economical choice for lodging.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: julesf
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights and it was a very nice place. Better than two stars! Very good breakfast, good location and very clean. The family is very friendly and make our stay very enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “No smoking!”
Reviews.Author: Monet123
Reviews.Content: Hotel Golden was a fantastic experience. The hotel was emaculate, smoke-free, and very homey. It is a small, charming place to stay. A very nice family runs the hotel. The two brothers behind the counter speak English perfectly. They were helpful, friendly, considerate, and easy-going. Breakfast in the mornings was terrific including the fine coffee. Using my laptop with wi-fi was without cost and a breeze. Also the hotel is in a great location, near the beautiful park surrounding the Borghese Gallery. It's a 5-10 minute walk to the Spanish Steps as well. Personally, I want to go back; no question about it!

Reviews.Title: “Loved this friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: pearson30
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Hotel Golden for the first 3 days of our trip to Italy and were very pleased with our overall experience. The owners of the hotel were extremely helpful in making our stay in Rome very enjoyable. They recommended restaurants, made museum reservations, and provided excellent directions. In addition, the whole family was very friendly and encouraged us to practice our limited Italian. The room was a standard double which was very clean with a large modern bathroom. The breakfasts were the best we had during our trip to Italy and there was quite a variety of food available. As noted in other comments the breakfast room was somewhat small but this encouraged interactions with the other guests which was nice. The location of the hotel was great, very close to the Borghese park and within walking distance of the Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain and the metro. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Rome, Rome, Rome”
Reviews.Author: srhs1961
Reviews.Content: We had originally booked this hotel for 3 nights but decided before we left the states to stay there 4 nights. The hotel made arrangements for us to be picked up at the airport and delivered back to the airport very early on our day of departure. It was so comforting to have these 2 problems solved for us before we even got to Rome. Staying there that 4th night was especially good because by then we knew where we were and spent the last day and night enjoying Rome instead of carting our luggage to a hotel closer to the airport. The Hotel Golden is located on a side street near the Via Veneto. It was a nice walk "downhill" to the Piazza Barberini but we soon discovered a less hilly way to get back to the Hotel Golden. The rooms were very clean, the breakfast was more than we had hoped for in a B & B in Italy. Guiseppi and Marco were very helpful in giving us information on when to go to the various attractions we wanted to see. We were told of 2 restaurants in the area that they recommended and both lived up to our expectations. Thanks to the Hotel Golden and its staff we enjoyed our first visit to Rome. Bill & Jeri, Chandler, AZ

Reviews.Title: “More positives than negatives”
Reviews.Author: JaybeeAyrshire
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights from Sept.18 to 20th and found the hotel to be very well situated for our first visit to Rome . The family all seemed to be involved in the running of the Hotel which was comforting and although the door system seemed to be a problem for others we did not find it bothersome . In fact in the interest of security it was a positive. Our room was right next to reception and the only noise we experienced was from the inconsiderate guests returning late after a night out . They obviously did not realise that their voices carried so much in an otherwise quiet area. The room was large and the bed was very clean and comfortable. Okay the bathroom was a little small but everything we needed was there . The main problem we had was the Breakfast room. It was just too small and perhaps the owners could be persuaded to consider some alterations or re-sighting . The breakfast choice was excellent and it seems a shame that people were so cramped when everything else was good. All in all we were quite satisfied with our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Golden - a gem”
Reviews.Author: belfastcastle
Reviews.Content: we stayed at hotel Golden for 3 days last week. At first I was a bit put off when I saw the front doorway and the buzzer system. The hotel is on the first floor of an old building - but soon realised that many buildings in Rome where very very old also. The buzzer system was not a problem not even when one night we didnt arrive back to the hotel til 2.15am. The rome 110 was a large clean room - overlooking a street - the window had traditional shutters and the double glazing was very efficient The bathroom was late, with nice toiletries, two white fluffy bathrobes and all the usual bits and pieces. The beakfast room is very small - however we had breakfast and different times each day and never had any trouble getting a table. The staff were very efficient but not overly friendly - but then I think that is the way the people in Rome are. The hotel was not quite as central as I would have liked but once we got our bearings we were just fine. should point out that there is plenty going on around the hotel - lots of nice restaurants - we did owever prefer to be in the centre of the tourist bit - We used the metro to go the Vatian city and also to the Colesseum and we also used the bus a couple of times. The secret is in having a really good clear map - we visited all the major tourist sites and did lots of walking - we had a wonderful time. If anyone has any doubts about Rome - please dont it is a wonderful experience - Enjoy!!

Reviews.Title: “We had some problems with this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lanson2
Reviews.Content: We chose Hotel Golden because of all the glowing reviews. The hotel was, indeed, as clean as described and we had a lovely room, although the air-conditioning was noisy. What nobody mentioned was that the hotel was on the first floor and you had to be buzzed in and buzzed out every time you left. If the downstairs front door was also locked, you had to identify yourself through an intercom before going upstairs to be let in through the second locked door. It was like being in prison. The staff were efficient and polite, but hardly over-friendly. The breakfast room was so tiny, it was difficult to get in or out to your table. Breakfast was a very quiet affair with everybody speaking in hushed tones. Not what one expects in Rome! Hotel Golden is adequate - no more - and reasonably priced for Rome, but for a few euro more, you could find a much less restrictive place to stay and one with much more atmosphere. There is no sitting area and the only time you see other people is at breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a trip to Rome”
Reviews.Author: laurells
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at at this hotel last week for 4 nights on our first trip to Rome. I I picked Hotel Golden after much searching as it rarely had any bad comments, never mind bad reviews on Tripadvisor. We booked online directly with the hotel and got a great deal. We also e-mailed the hotel directly to arrange a pick-up car from the airport. The hotel e-mailed me on 3 occasions in one day just to make sure the arrangements were pefect! That is what I call service. Our check-in was quick and efficient and we were provided with a free large map of the city upon which they marked a couple of restaurants they recommended we try. We were also advised to come to them with any questions we had. Room Our room was perfect and a good size, particularly the bathroom. We had a king size room so that maybe made a difference as I have seen other reviews saying the rooms are small. We had a dressing table, storage table for suitcases, a double couch, a king size bed, a bedside table and 3 cupboard drawer with built-in TV and safe in our room and were not short of room. The bathroom was really big with a full corner shower, huge square sink, toilet and bidet. We also had a table with a box of complimentary toiletries and a separate chair upon which were fresh towelling robes. There was also a hairdryer in the bathroom. We also used the mini bar which was incredibly cheap! A small bottle of Prosecco wine was only 5 euros and a bottle of water only 1 euro. Service A continental breakfast was served every day between 7.30am and 10am and there was a good variety of items. The dining room was small but we never had a problem getting a seat and it was never particularly busy. The family who ran the hotel were really friendly and were always happy to help. You have to buzz to get into the hotel after around 5pm as the hotel is only on one floor of a large building but even on Saturday night when we returned at around 2.45am there were no problems with getting in. This hotel is in a very fashionable area of Rome as the Via Veneto is just round the corner. This means that you are staying in one of, if not the best areas of Rome, but without having to pay the huge premiums to do so. We could not have picked a better hotel and I would advise anyone travelling to Rome to stay there. As for other tips about visiting Rome: 1. Get a good hop on-hop off tour bus and sit up top. Allows you great photos of the main sights and means that you can travel around all day getting on and off as required. We used this every day we were away and loved it. 2. Get a tour guide for the Vatican museum, Basilica etc or you will not fully appreciate everything you see. Our guide was an Australian called Michael and he made this trip the highlight of our stay 3. Another must see is the Capitoline Museums - don't miss them

Reviews.Title: “Inexpensive option in Rome”
Reviews.Author: sommer9
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Golden is good for travellers looking for an inexpensive hotel in Rome, tucked away in a quiet neighborhood. The rooms are extremely extremely small (ie, we had to lift the suitcases over the bed because they wouldn't fit between the end of the bed and the wall), but clean and with a private bathroom. The room had air conditioning, but it was on a timer and so didn't completely cool the room at all times. Marco and Guiseppe, the proprieters, were very helpful - giving us directions, making us dinner reservations, etc. There is free internet access, which is a plus given the high costs of everything else in Rome. While the breakfast room is small, there is a great spread of food - also a good savings since breakfast is included. One negative about the location is that the hotel is at the top of Via Veneto, which is uphill so you will be walking 10-15 minutes uphill from the bus or metro. But the neighborhood is very safe, and quiet and there aren't hoards of tourists all around. The hotel is not for people who want to spend a lot of time in their room, but is great for those who will be out and about enjoying the sites of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: ocphotographer
Reviews.Content: Based on the good reviews from this site, we chose to fit this hotel into our trip. We stayed 2 nights here and 2 nights in another hotel instead of staying all 4 nights the other hotel. Availability was limited to a "smaller double" here when we booked our room online. I don't know how large a regular double would have been but this room was indeed very small! (The width of the room fit just the bed and a small nightstand.) The bathroom was also small - the shower is very narrow. But everything was very clean, quiet and the location is convenient, especially if you plan to visit the Borghese Gallery. (This gallery is one of the best exhibits I've ever been to so I recommend it - the audio tour is definitely worth it.) It's a family run hotel and Marco and Giuseppe were both very nice and helpful. The included breakfast is a full European breakfast. This hotel also had free wireless internet and was a good price as well.

Reviews.Title: “Calm oasis”
Reviews.Author: travelmaedchen
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel after much searching on trip advisor and throughly enjoyed my stay. The hotel is about 15 mins from the Spanish steps and really quiet and peaceful. The room was really nice, comfortable and very clean. The staff were very friendly and helpful. Although they spoke very good English they were happy to help us practise our Italian. Breakfast was good and all items were regularly replenished so there was plenty of food. The only slightly annoying thing is having to buzz at the front door to be let in. However that didn't pose the slightest problem, whatever time we came back. I would happily recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a bit of calm after a day in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Returning....”
Reviews.Author: travelon22
Reviews.Content: All of the members of this family operated hotel were most kind and attentive, but particularly Giuseppe. We stayed for three nights at the beginning of our holiday and then returned for the last night of it. Our double superior room was quiet and spacious. The breakfast was good. Regarding the size of the breakfast room, it was certainly adequate for a modestly priced 15 room hotel. There were excellent restaurants in the area but a twenty minute walk took us to a favourite, Antica Trattoria Tritone, from a previous trip. The metro pass was useful for accessing places of interest. We liked the hotel's proximity to the Borghese Gallery. Giuseppe made a reservation for us in advance of our arrival. The auto to the airport was comfortable and reasonably priced. We will return......

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great neighborhood!”
Reviews.Author: legolasislove
Reviews.Content: This is a newer hotel so everything was clean and modern. The bathroom was huge. The AC was excellent! The staff was a little cold at first but warmed up after a while. The location in Via Veneto was excellent and the neighborhood was very safe. We were a 10 minute walk from the Metro and Piazza Barberini. There were plenty of restaurants and shops nearby. The breakfast was minimal and held in an extremely small room so we only ate there our first morning. Asking for extras seemed to be a problem for the staff but overall we enjoyed our experience.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel!”
Reviews.Author: melanie62
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Golden for 2 nights in July and we picked this hotel because of the positive comments on Tripadvisor. At 100 euro per night, it seemed reasonable in comparison to many other hotels we looked at. We arranged pick-up at the airport through the hotel and even though we were over an hour late arriving we were delighted to see the taxi driver still waiting! Even better - the car was a large, air-conditioned Mercedes and the driver took us into Rome by the scenic route. The hotel is very clean and on arrival we were given plenty of information about getting round the city and how to use the metro. The bedroom was large enough, and the bathroom was lovely and clean and very modern with fluffy bathrobes. Breakfast was also very good and although we didn't have to wait for a table, its easy to see why some people do. As for location, we timed ourselves one evening walking back from the Trevi fountain and walking quickly, it took 20 mins. And it was uphill most of the way. But it was through a nice area so we didn't mind. We took advantage of the metro which is very easy to use, to see the Collosseum and the Vatican. 4 euro buys you an all-day pass and well worth the value. The only negative I have, is that our room was right in the reception area and it was very noisy at times so try for a room further down the hall!

Reviews.Title: “A Little Golden Gem”
Reviews.Author: TessSydney
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Hotel Golden, we had emailed the hotel direct and had asked for a quiet room. We were not dissappointed, our room was quiet, clean and well appointed on top of that when we opened the window we looked out onto the old wall with a Statue of Emperor San Pedro - just an added bonus. This is a family run hotel everyone is friendly and very helpful. The breakfast was great it consisted of pastries, cereal and fruit it was more than ample. I had read about the breakfast room being too small, we didn't find that at all, we never had a problem getting a seat. The Hotel is in good condition and well kept. I would stay at the Hotel Golden anytime, we had friends that stayed at The Intercontinental, our room was much better and the staff were far more friendly.

Reviews.Title: “what a pleasant surprise in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: Frilo68
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Golden hotel for two nights in July 2007. I had three rooms, two doubles and a triple. Everybody in the group enjoyed their stay immensely. The rooms were spotless and nicely decorated. The large bathrooms sparkled and came with nice toiletries. Where else can you find your personal plush bathrobes in a two star hotel? Breakfast was lovely, with warm pastries, selection of jams, fruit, cereals and savory items. The location was ideal for us. It's in a very nice part of Rome and we felt completely safe at all times. There is a very convenient taxi stand just around the corner of the hotel. Although we tried to walk everywhere, Rome is a big city, so we took a cab here and there. I would recommend dinner at the San Marco restaurant, a two minute walk from the hotel. We had many selections from the menu and not one item disappointed us. Try the Tonnarelli with cacio e pepe.

Reviews.Title: “great value”
Reviews.Author: patandalison
Reviews.Content: This hotel is wonderful value as you get to stay in the poshest area of Rome without paying the premium. The owners really take pride in their hotel and it is spotlessly clean. We had a twin superior room and it really was lovely. The bathroom was fabulous. It really is hard to believe how good this place is. As for breakfast, well the room is far too small and so sometimes I felt like I wanted to get out of there fast so that others could sit down. Also, the staff are milling about a lot at breakfast and I personally feel uncomfortable with that. But the food itself is fine and the standard of the rooms more than make up for the breakfast. The staff are fluent Spanish and English speakers and are very helpful. The hotel's location is brilliant; it's near the Gardens and also near to bus stops for the sightseeing buses. A gem of a hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Golden”
Reviews.Author: HarborDawg
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful place! We coudn't have enjoyed our stay at the Hotel Golden more. I booked the hotel because of the positive reviews and reasonable price, and they really paid off. The family owned an operated hotel is located in a very nice area of Rome known as the Via Veneto. You are within walking distance to the Trevi Fountain, and Spanish Steps, You can actually walk to many other sites if you bring good walking shoes. The hotel will be happy to provide any directions, maps and transportaion information. We were provided continental breakfast every morning of our stay. the coffee and the danish were the best! Upon arrival you will find a dish of candy in your room and a bottle of proseco wine as a gift for you. The candy dish is filled daily. If you like to sleep with your window open the noise from outside will keep you awake all night. The hotel is air conditioned, so you really shouldn't have to open the window. The owners really take pride in how they maintaine the property. The rooms are spotless. The baths are clean and come with shampoo etc, and hair dryer. There is a computer available for your use during your stay at no charge. The transportation they provide for $35euros is well worth the price. The driver was right there to pick us up at the airport and wisked us off to the hotel. We used this transportation again we we returned to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bindalooga
Reviews.Content: We booked the Hotel Golden for a three night stay after checking a load out on Tripadvisor. We decided to go for a cheaper hotel that had good reviews, rather than pay more and risk dissapointment. The hotel was clean, comfortable, quiet (v. effective double glazing). The location was OK, a bit of an uphill walk on the way back, but nothing horrendous. The closest tourist attraction is the Spanish Steps, about 5 mins away. The nearest Metro is about the same. For breakfast, don't expect anything more than the usual continental selection, and you won't be dissapointed. Breakfast room can get full at busy times. Overall, I was pleased with our choice and would recommend this hotel if all you are after is a clean comfortable base for some sightseeing. At 38 degrees though a pool would have been great!!!

Reviews.Title: “what a great place!”
Reviews.Author: tojopop
Reviews.Content: We just bookended our stay in Positano with two nights at the Hotel Golden. This 2 star hotel is amazing. First of all they went out of thier way to get us an early check in after our flight from NYC. We were in our lovely, spotless, comfortable room by 10a.m. Our first night we stayed in room 113. It was a good size with a large bathroom. Our last night we were in 103 right off the front desk. It was totally quiet though small. Would not want to stay in this particular room for more than one or two nights due to it being a bit of a tight squeeze for 2 people. They have double paned windows so no worries about the street noise of Rome. They are right off the Via Veneto. It's a perfect location to stroll the streets of of the city from. We both travel alot for pleasure and business. A 2 star hotel in the height of the tourist season in Italy was a first for us. This is really one of those "finds" in the travel industry. So to sum up- great location, nice rooms, good breakfast choices, thoughtful owners, quiet and did we say great coffee! Thank you Hotel Golden and fellow Trip Advisors for another great travel experience.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem!”
Reviews.Author: Shir Hayam
Reviews.Content: Based on TripAdvisor recommendations, we booked this hotel for one night in June prior to a cruise. We could not have been more pleased, as were our friends who also stayed there pre-cruise. The family who run the Golden, especially Giuseppe who speaks excellent English, were warm, friendly and helpful. The rooms were lovely and very clean. We had a room at the end of the hall, an ideal location. The breakfast was more than adequate and the breakfast room charming. As others have noted, the location is in a nice, upscale part of Rome, accessible to the tourist areas on public transportation - or a good walk to the Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain, etc. On top of all this, the rate was a very good value for a hotel of this quality in Rome. We almost regretted having to leave for our cruise (although that was great, too). We would definitely stay there again next trip to Rome

Reviews.Title: “Highly Reccommended!!”
Reviews.Author: jasmine10
Reviews.Content: Previous posts about this hotel are right on. It is indeed a spotless, cozy, friendly place to stay. As a solo traveler, I was fortunate enough to book a single room the night before arriving. Little did I know that all other rooms were booked solid for months.... and for good reason! Upon arrival, I was treated with a warm reception and given maps, internet codes and sightseeing tips. I definitely agree about initially taking a cab from the station. It would be difficult to find until you have your bearings of the city. This family owned hotel truly takes strides to make your stay enjoyable. Highly reccommended.

Reviews.Title: “The only place to stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: hellera1
Reviews.Content: Hotel Golden is a great place to stay, very clean, very polite and friendly staff, centrally located, and has wi-fi internet access! The Hotel has several affordable dining options with-in a block. close to bus stop and shopping. If I'm in Rome you can find me at Hotel Golden.

Reviews.Title: “More than we anticipated”
Reviews.Author: journeypaul
Reviews.Content: We stayed for just 2 nights at the Hotel Golden on June 28 and 29. We stayed in Room 104 (hotel room pics are included). It was just around the corner from the main reception and it kind of felt like everything we said and did could be heard by the hotel staff. The room was great, but you might want to try another one down the hall. The breakfast was fantastic. Simply, more than enough. The hotel was about a 15 minute walk to Trevi fountain and on to Pantheon. It's a 5-10 minute walk to Barbarini metro station. 2 minutes to Borghese park. Guiseppe and Marco were outstanding help. Great tips. Helped wherever needed. We kept our bags with them after check out, and then they called us a cab, let us use restrooms, etc. upon returning. The price is great for the area we are in. The neighborhood is more upscale, and you feel very safe. We would definitely stay here again. Plenty of room, the bathroom was huge, and we didn't hear much street noise at all.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean and friendly”
Reviews.Author: imagoose4u
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a good neighborhood. It is a couple of blocks off Via Veneto, which is the classier area of Rome. I recc. taking a taxi from the train station or a shuttle from the airport so you can find it easier. The staff is great; they booked all our tours for us and were very accommodating. Our room was great with: air cond. (a must in July!), a mni bar, a larger bathroom, and very clean. It's a smaller hotel, but it has more charm and the breakfast is pretty good. We had to leave early for our flight and they had some juice and snacks to go made up for us. The main sights ( Colliseum, Forum, Pantheon, Vatican) are a little farther to walk. We got Roma passes and used the buses and Metro. Closer sights that are within walking distance are Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain, and Borghese Park. Good restaurants nearby and no reservations were required like in Venice and Florence. We would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great little place with personal service”
Reviews.Author: loveabargain
Reviews.Content: Near the heart of the monument district in Rome this little find of a hotel was great. It has 15 rooms and is on the second floor of a mixed use and mainly residential building. The room was comfortable and of a good size with a floor to ceiling window that was double pane and blocked out most or all of the road noise of the city. A light buffet breakfast is served in the morning. This is a family owned hotel and members of the family are always there to assist you with recommendations, information, reservations for musems, etc. Their English skills are great for communication. We found this hotel by checking with Tripadvisor and were very pleased with it.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly family run hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rayalan
Reviews.Content: This is a small family run hotel situated just off the Via Veneto, very close to buses and the metro. The Villa Borghese is just across the road - well worth a visit to relax on a Sunday or at any other time. The owners/staff were very friendly and always willing to help with directions, local information, airport check-in times and booking taxis. Accommodation first class. Breakfast was well set out with a great choice of food. We thoroughly enjoyed our 5 night stay and would rate the hotel much higher than it's 2 stars (which can only be because of its size). We would have no hesitation in booking again if we return to Rome and in recommending it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Golden is 'platinum' for me”
Reviews.Author: traveladdictBucks
Reviews.Content: Our first visit to Rome. Chose the Hotel Golden after much research on the web and was especially influenced by the good reviews received by this hotel on tripadvisor. My wife and I were not disappointed. Golden is very central, there is a great little cafe on the corner where you can relax after a long days' shopping or sightseeing. Lovely room, very clean, plenty of storage, comfortable bed. Beautifully decorated bathroom with a super shower. Bathrobes a nice little extra. Very quiet. The family owners were very helpful and friendly towards us and arranged pickup from the airport and on departure to the airport at very competative rates. We will certainly be returning to Rome within the next year and hopefully are able to book this hotel again. I would strongly recommend the Hotel Golden to anyone visiting Rome.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Doveuk
Reviews.Content: just returned from rome,had a great stay at this spotlessly clean and comfortable hotel .Good location ,fab breakfast helpful staff,Also try cafe Il Fiammifero just off Via Veneto reasonable prices and good food

Reviews.Title: “Nice, cozy hotel in good part of town”
Reviews.Author: Hotshot44
Reviews.Content: Per reviews on Trip Advisor, we selected this hotel and were not disappointed! All of the rooms are on one floor of a building which makes it cozy and secure. We had a double room, which was spacious and comfortable. And the bathroom was a very good size. Breakfast was adequate, and the food was replenished often. The breakfast room is a little tight, but we always managed to get a table and never saw others waiting for tables. The hotel had a friendly B&B feel with English guidebooks and newspapers available for guests. The hotel is in a great location: amidst all the ritzy hotels, near the American Embassy, and walking distance to the metro. The major sites are within walking distance; however, it's a good walk. The service was outstanding - we would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Golden”
Reviews.Author: nuts2travel
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in Rome several times at various hotels and the Hotel Golden was very nice. A small family run hotel that is very secure, very clean, close to Via Veneto, and very helpful with directions and restaurant recommendations. Rooms are small but comfortable and extremely clean. We would definitely go back on future trips to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic place to stay”
Reviews.Author: irish_gremlin
Reviews.Content: We recently had the pleasure of staying at the Hotel Golden. With my work I stay in many hotels and the Hotel Golden is one of the nicest places I have stayed. I would describe it as staying with your relatives rather than being in a sterile hotel. The rooms were compact but immaculate. There in a complimentary safe in the room, a dish of sweets that is daily topped up and a great minibar. The bathroom was immaculate and the attention to detail was great. They even provide you with a complimentary bathrobe. The breakfast room is small but it wasn't really a problem. The variety of food was great and unlike the large hotels it was topped up on a constant basis. The location of this hotel is fantastic with lots of places within a 15 minute walk, though if you prefer to use the bus then there are regular buses running from the Via Veneto. We will return to Rome and I would hope we will have the pleasure of staying in this great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: Shennin
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Hotel Golden for 3 nights in early March. The hotel is in a good location, within easy distance to major sites. The rooms are very clean and comfortable. The two brothers on reception particularly Guisseppi were very helpful. We had a room facing onto the street and the noise was bad, the windows block out most of the sound, but it still kept me awake. The breakfast room is the smallest i've even been in! but the breakfast ok adequate. The hotel is very good value for money, I would return again, but request a room at the back.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Family Feel Hotel In An Ideal Location”
Reviews.Author: YCYMRO
Reviews.Content: A group of 13 of us stayed between 7 - 13 March for the Welsh Rugby international on the 10th. Even though we had a disappointing result the Hotel was wonderful, very clean with daily maid service including fresh towels. This hotel is ideally located, which allowed us to walk to the Vatican, Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps, Pantheon, and Coliseum, and even to the Flaminio Stadium for the game itself. Buses and Metro stations are also conveniently close. Both Marco and Giuseppe, who run the hotel, are very knowledgeable regarding tourist routes and can point you in the right direction. They canl also recommend good restaurants, that wont rip you off. The extended family and staff also provide ample continental breakfasts even though the dining area is on the small side. If you choose this hotel you cannot go wrong, and in general most people are very friendly, however when out there on the mean streets watch out because, unfortunately there are many thieves about also!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful second visit”
Reviews.Author: AnnMudefordDorset
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the hotel last year with three friends and decided to bring three more to enjoy this supeb hotel. it is hard to believe it is only a 2 star hotel as it so comfortable and the rooms are very tastefuly decorated with so many of the touches found in a higher grade hotel. The buffet breakfast is lovely and plenty of it. The staff are fantastic booking a car to collect us from the airport, The maps and the helpful advice made our holiday special. The hotel is well located for all the sights and good food is available near by. I would recomend this hotel to anyone for a break in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional boutique hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Happy_Visi2r
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Golden is an exceptional family-run hotel. It is small - 15 rooms - located on the first floor (2nd floor in the US) of an apartment building. Why exceptional? Our room was generous and well appointed. Our bed and pillows were very comfortable. The bathroom was large with an excellent shower and lots of hot water. Breakfast, provided with the room, is diverse with meats, cheese, cereals, fruit, juice, croissants, and coffee and tea and is served in a small but well appointed room. Thankfully Rome is a walker's paradise. It is in an ideal location, one block off the Via Veneto (a Mecca for shoppers), five minutes to a lovely park (the Villa Borghese, with a must-see museum) and easy access to public transportation. My wife and I ate in several of the restaurants in the vicinity of the hotel and never had a bad meal. What makes this hotel particularly special is the service – which started before we arrived when transport was arranged from the airport to the hotel (well worth the cost of Euros 35.00) and includes excellent communication and problem solving for the traveler. We received an excellent orientation to the city, neighborhood, and services upon arrival. Whichever member of the family is on duty, you can expect help in finding tourist attractions, restaurants, transportation as well as a concierge service for making reservations and luggage storage. Do not expect a traditional American hotel experience. This is Rome. It can be noisy at night as people are out late. So, close the window if noise is a factor for you (earplugs if you prefer). It was not a problem for us. Steve and Mickey Edwards Baker City, Oregon, USA

Reviews.Title: “Adorable and Perfectly Located”
Reviews.Author: Denvgal
Reviews.Content: My friends and I stayed at the Hotel Golden right after New Years for 3 nights. After walking past all of these beautiful Hotels we turned right down a dark street and weren't sure where we were going. It turns out we were headed toward the nicest place we stayed during our trip to Italy. We were warmly welcomed by Marco, one of the two brothers who own the place and found decent sized rooms quaintly decorated with a large bathroom. Our favorite part was the breakfast in the morning. They pulled out all of the stops and all of the tables in the small breakfast area had beautiful place settings and the food was displayed in a very pleasing manner. The brothers were so accomodating and gave us great suggestions for dinner. (San Marco just down the street was awesome. Try the 4 cheese gnocchi.) This hotel is perfect for upper middle of the road place to stay without the price. The location was great. It was an easy walk to the metro to get to the Vatican and the Colosseum. It is located within blocks of the Borghese, a beautiful park and is a short walk to the Spanish Steps. Staying at the Hotel Golden was a great way to end our trip and I would stay there again in a heartbeat when not if I am back in Rome. Debbi- Denver, Colorado

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly and helpful”
Reviews.Author: GordonWorcester
Reviews.Content: A friend and I chose this hotel after reading reviews on here. We were on a 1 night flying visit to Rome. We had a superior room which was smaller than I had expected but was very well presented and had everything you needed , even a selection of sweets. We found the owners were very friendly and went out of their way to help us. We had to leave early before breakfast was normally served but the hotel went out of its way to ensure we had a proper breakfast before we left. The hotel is located in a quiet street but very close to lots of restaurants and bars, in fact there is a nice bar right next door. The hotel recommended the San Marco in the next street for dinner and we were not disappointed. We chose to walk to the hotel from Termini Station , which took about 20 mins and never really had time to find out where the Metro stations etc were. It was also situated right next to the park in a pleasant non-threatening area.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Maria&Mike
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed in this hotel for a short, new year break and we were very pleased and satisfied with what we found. Very well located near the via veneto / barberini metro / spanish steps and the fabulous villa borghese park which makes a wonderful early evening walk, just when the sun's setting. The hotel is small with up to 10 rooms but it is cosy, very clean and had friendly, welcoming staff. Breakfast good and there are even bowls of sweets left in your room! Very reasonable hotel for this part of town. Would definitely recommend to others and stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Stay somewhere else!”
Reviews.Author: pittsburgh92
Reviews.Content: My friend and I did a lot of research before going on our trip to Europe...it was going to be our first time in Rome. We thought the reviews for Hotel Golden really sounded well...golden...but it was anything but! The walls of the rooms are super thin so you can hear everyone going in and out of the rooms...also, while the rooms were very clean, the shower in the bathroom was super small...and good luck trying to get one of the hotel"s owners to crack a smile...he was so serious! My friend and I wanted to take him out just to loosen his collar up, but of course that didn't happen...and neither should your stay at the Hotel Golden! The family was nice...but expect to hike tback from any of the sites. My friend and I were truly exhausted when we got back to the room...although the reviews tell you that you're close to everything, you are not!!!! It's an exhausting walk and the underground transportation was under construction while we were there. Good luck and travel safe!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: MJSF
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in November based on on excellent Trip advisor reviews and they are all true!! The Hotel is very small but immaculately kept and the welcome and service from Mario was impeccable. We arrived late evening, and the first thing he did was to give us a map and show us where to go and how to get everywhere. Although we knew Rome fairly well, we felt we could have got help with any aspect at any time. Our room was spotless and the bathroom was better than most 3 star hotels I have stayed in elsewhere in Europe. The Breakfast room is very small but the selection of cereals, fruit, ham a and cheese etc. should suit any palate. Only 2 points worth noting; We got badly ripped off by an official looking taxi from Teminni stattion. We did queue in the Taxi rank but were approached near the front, and got into a taxi that looked EXACTLY like the rest but the meter went very fast, and we ended up paying 30 Euros for a short ride to the Hotel for a quiet life because that was what the meter said! This is a very sophisticated scam and I wonder why the proper taxi drivers put up with this? If you are walking, the Golden is quite a hike up from the centre and river which is OK if you are fit, but not suitable for the less able. There are buses which the Hotel will point out but we didn't bother. Overall, you could not go wrong for the class of Hotel. Difficult to imagine any better for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: nicaw
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the Golden Hotel for 1 week in November. The staff/family were extremely friendly and welcoming. When we arrived we were given a map and were show good local restaurants, where the nearest metro station was, which busses to take and other general information. As this was our first visit to Rome this was greatly appreciated. The hotel is immaculately clean, the bedroom was very pleasant and there was also a great shower. The hotel is part of a large old building and occupies the first floor which can be accessed using a lovely small lift. The main door into the building was locked at 8pm, so we had to ring the bell for access. This made the hotel feel very secure. The continental breakfast was just enough to start the day and was kept stocked for the duration of the breakfast time. The hotel is in a great location, just steps from the upmarket Via Veneto, which has many restaurants and quality hotels. If I'm lucky enough to visit Rome again, I would definately stay at this hotel again. I don't think I've ever stayed in a hotel so clean!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at Hotel Golden”
Reviews.Author: Paulson
Reviews.Content: We (four adults) stayed at the Hotel Golden for three nights in early November. We all thoroughly enjoyed our visit there!! The hotel is centrally located in old Rome, on a quiet side street. The Via Veneto (a main street with upscale stores, restaurants, etc.) is only a block from the hotel. We walked to the Borghese Galleria in minutes. A subway station is within a short walking distance. The hotel is a family business and all members of the family were very hospitable and helpful with recommendations for restaurants, transportation, etc. I left behind a tube with posters in it and they saved it and are mailing it to me! I had to leave for the airport at 4:15 a.m. and they arranged the cab for me and were at the desk at that hour to assist me with my departure. For those who are wanting to check e-mail from home, a computer with internet access is at the front desk for guests to use. The hotel is on the second floor of an old, grand renovated building. An old-time lift takes you to the hotel lobby. The rooms we stayed in were very attractively decorated and very comfortable. The bathrooms were beyond expectations -- large, immaculate and nicely appointed. The breakfast selection was appealing and generous. We couldn't have been more pleased with our stay at the Hotel Golden!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Walscch
Reviews.Content: All in the hotel was perfect, our room was beautiful and perfect cleaned up every day, the breakfast was varied and complete and Marco is a very nice person, he gave good ideas for the visits and the restaurants. Torneremo certamente a Roma in primavera. Walschaerts Chantal

Reviews.Title: “Not so golden...”
Reviews.Author: Chicocat
Reviews.Content: I am not sure why people have rated this place so highly. My husband and I stayed at the Hotel Golden the first three nights of our honeymoon and were very disappointed. Yes, the hotel is clean and the location seemed pretty good, and Jose was nice, but those are the only positive things I can say. The older woman's obsessive cleaning of the breakfast area made for an awkward eating experience, our room was dark and its walls were thin and the air conditioner rattled whenever it came on. I don't want the Hotel Golden to lose business because of my review - I just want other travellers to know what to expect. If you are looking for a nice place to rest after a day of walking around Rome, I would advise that you stay somewhere a little nicer.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel. Would recommend without hesitation”
Reviews.Author: Gailsun
Reviews.Content: Hotel Golden in Rome was by far the best hotel experience that I had in a recent 2 week trip to Italy. This hotel's location is terrific. I had no problems getting around Rome on foot or by subway from this hotel. It is close to the Spanish Steps and Trevi Fountain. The Borhgese Gallery is also very close by. The hotel is around the corner from Via Veneto which is a street that has many upscale hotels and restaurants. There are lower priced restaurants on the side streets. The hotel itself is very well done and very quiet, located in an nice neighborhood. It seemed like everything in it was brand new...there were no flaws that I could see. The room was a good size with pretty furnishings. The bathrooms was wonderful....very large with a big shower and gorgeous tile! You will not be sorry if you stay at the Golden.

Reviews.Title: “Small but perfectlyformed”
Reviews.Author: HappysuzieB
Reviews.Content: We arrived in sunny rome mid October 2006. After making use of the taxi pick up from the airport - which was possibly the most hassle free transfer we've experienced on city break and worth every euro. Checked into the hotel located on the first floor of an apartment block, beautiful entrance hall and antique lift. The hotel itself is very welcoming, spotlessly clean and tastefully furnished. Our room was a good size, with a spotlessly clean bathroom and the most amazing view of a roman face peering in from the wall opposite. The shutters meant we had cool and dark sleep and the double glazing provided a brilliant soundproofing from the nearby main road. The bathroom layout was interesting with a bidet directly opposite the toilet which proved to be an obsticle on entering and exiting the shower. The hotel itself is situated within walking distance of everything in central Rome. It took us approximately one hour to walk to the Vatican and about 15 minutes to the Trevi Fountain. This really was the best way to see the city as you are greeted by the most amazing sights round every corner. We would recommend that you get up early and attempt to do the main sights first thing, as the crowds become vast the later in the day you leave it. We walked straight into the Colosseum and practically had it to ourselves. You also get to see a different side to the streets of Rome without all the tourists thronging. Breakfast was more than adequate with pastries, fruit, cold meats and bread to fill yourelf up on if still hungry after the previous nights dinner. It started at approx 7.30 and although previous reviews have commented that the small breakfast room was too small to hold all guests, we did not find this a problem at all - except if you choose to eat at the same time as everyone else. There are plenty of restaurants near the hotel, all the recommendations made by Marco at the hotel were great, although we would recommend booking for Friday and Sat nights. A taxi into the Piazza Navona area doesn't cost more than 6/7 euros if you want a bit more variety. Whilst the via Veneto has some beautiful bars/ restaurants why are very expensive but good for just watching the world go by. In all we had high hopes for the Hotel Golden and were not disappointed. Whilst it does not have the facilities (eg. swimming pool, bar, gym) of bigger hotels, it is small touches like the minibar, dressing gown and absolute cleanliness of the place that made this the ideal base for exploring what is possibly the most beatiful city in the world.

Reviews.Title: “Not quite as I expected..”
Reviews.Author: Search
Reviews.Content: We recently finished our 3 and a half week European holiday with our 3 children at the Hotel Golden for 3 nights. I hate to disagree with previous reporters but I can honestly say we did not find Marco to be quite as friendly as expected. Maybe we got off on the wrong foot as we arrived in our rental car and couldn't find a park, had to unload 3 children (1 in wheelchair) plus baggage and then find find our way to the car rental place to drop it off. My husband had to double park and we couldn't get through to the car rental place so we asked Marco to help us get in touch with the car rental place as we had no luck on our mobile. He really made no effort to help and was almost dismissive of us, basically shrugging his shoulders and turning away. I would never say he was unfriendly or impolite but definitely not helpful basically just nodded the obligatory nod as he gave us our keys every day. The rooms, however were lovely. We had a superior twin and a superior triple and they were so cool and spotlessly clean and quiet. The bathrooms were big enough and plenty of hot water. The hotel is in a great spot with plenty of sites nearby to walk to and the cafe on the corner next door did the best coffees we had in our whole time in Italy plus their tiramisu was out of this world! Breakfast at the hotel was adequate, nothing fancy but all you'd need to give you a good start to the day. I scoured Trip Advisor reviews for all the hotels we stayed in through Europe and each one exceeded our expectations with cleanliness and friendliness. We did feel a bit sad that our last place on our holiday was soured a bit by the indifference of Marco, but, maybe he was just having a bad day or we were, who knows!!

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: ericac
Reviews.Content: We stopped at the Hotel Golden from October 9-13th 2006. We booked it after reading so many recommendations on the trip advisor web pages and we were not let down. The hotel is in a very good position just round the corner from via veneto and a short walk to the spanish steps and trevi fountain. In fact we walked everywhere even the vatican and colloseum are only a 25-30 minute easy walk with plenty to admire on the way! The hotel is fairly small but is in immaculate condition with everything you need. Our room (110) was a large double with 6ft bed/ TV/ air con/ bath robes/ safe/ hair dryer and mini bar- which was very reasonably priced. Would recommend anyone to stay here, Marco and his family will look after you well! (Try the chocolate croissants at breakfast!!!) The immediate surrounding area is one of the nicer parts of Rome, with expensive looking restaurants and bars. Ask Marco for ideas on where to eat!

Reviews.Title: “fantastic little hotel”
Reviews.Author: jillyjen
Reviews.Content: 5 ladies stayed at the hotel in october and thoroughly enjoyed it. Once we found our bearings it was in a good location for the Spanish Steps and the designer shops in that area and also straight down the road into the main tourist area. Trevi fountain about 10 mins stroll. A walk to the Vatican took about 20-30mins and that was with the shop browsing as well. Marco and reception very helpful giving instructions and maps etc however if you do get lost, ask for the American Embassy, everyone seemed to know where that was. If you dont want to wander back into town after a busy day there are some good restaurants close to hand. All in all a good little hotel, only down side, there are no facilities to make a coffee or tea in the room, but there is a cafe underneath the hotel if you need one.

Reviews.Title: “A little gem”
Reviews.Author: DiTone
Reviews.Content: At first sight, you wonder what you got yourself into since it is a second floor hotel. But wait. It is just charming and Marco is a gem who's English is pretty good! The location is superb near Villa Borghese and Via Veneto. It is only two star but everything you need is there if you don't require all the swimming pool.Patio/Spa extras.

Reviews.Title: “Yes ! The Reviews are Correct”
Reviews.Author: Islesman
Reviews.Content: Having booked after reading all the good reports on T.A. we were not dissappointed with our choice of Hotel. We booked a Superior double { room112) @ 170Euros per night and found it to be spacious with 6' bed ,clean and well appointed as was the large ensuite.The room was also quiet at night and the bed very comfortable.Nicely presented Breakfast and adequate for starting your day. Yes we agree that the Reception, Diningroom and corridors are small but this is in keeping with an appartment style Hotel. The Hotel Golden is furnished to a high standard and the personal service by Marco and his family added to the enjoyment of our stay. Would recommend the airport car service they provide for 35Euros ( nice car, nice driver ,no hassle ! worth every Euro). Several good eating places close to Hotel i.e San Marco & La Bruchetta at reasonable prices or try the more expensive Via Veneto Restaurants(.Splash out on a drink or cocktail at Harrys Bar & relax) or take a picnic to the lovely Borghesse Park. Hotel and the location was excellant , our stay was really GOLDEN!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: BrianManley.
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Golden for 2 nights, 9/18-9/20, I would recceomden this hotel, great value, we paid 170euros per night, great location, great staff, Aewsome room, very surprised, big & spacious for Europe/Italy, Great Bathroom, nice comfortable bed, can't say enough about the room, especially for the price!! Internet acces, wireless & they offer a lap top at the front desk, it is in an apartment buidling on the first floor, small feeling when you first arrive but definetley worth the price, we stayed across the street at the Hotel Victoria for one night (golden could not accomadate us), the cost was 250 euro, room was a littler larger & nicer but I would have stayed at the Golden for the price. Excellent location in Rome, everything except the Vaticain is in walking distance. Email me with any questions, brianmanley@verizon.net

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: grannymac
Reviews.Content: We decided to spend 2 nights at this hotel in Rome on our way to Tuscany. On the basis of the almost 100% very positive reviews on this website, I booked the hotel. I was disappointed and came back to re-read the reviews, as I wanted to check all the positive feedback I thought I had got. The most helpful thing I read was that there was a limo service from the airport which we found was a great help and very reasonable at 35 euros. Marco is charming and helpful and we too enjoyed a visit to the Restaurant San Marco on his recommendation. The hotel is conveniently situated though the fact that it rained all the time and there were complicated road/pavement works on the Via Veneto was most inconvenient. The hotel is almost claustraphobically small. Our double room was spotless but very basic and minimally furnished. The bathroom was OK and the shower good. The breakfast room is tiny. I couldn't believe it when I saw it when we arrived but yes, it was the breakfast room with a few tables, a small buffet and little room to move around. The buffet was OK but nothing to write home about. We paid 170 euros/night which is not inexpensive. We have stayed several times in a very convenient small hotel in Paris and last time (October 2005) paid the same money for a very comfortable hotel. We would not plan to stay there again or recommend it

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: litter
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Golden is a wonderful little boutique hotel in a upmarket suburb in Rome, near the Villa Borgese gardens. Despite it being the height of the tourist season, we had a great time in Rome and the Hotel Golden made it all a lot easier. It was something to look forward to at the end of the long days. The owners are attentive to all needs and very friendly and helpful with advice on affordable restaurants in the area. They are available 24 hours.
