We cant say enough about the personalised service (for example, they went out of their way to arrange for early breakfasts for us). The rooms were very well-appointed, bathroom excellent - overall, very comfortable and stylish. On top of that, we thought it was a real bargain - we paid 90 euros/night - and when we return to Rome we will definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Phantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Marimork
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in a quiet street near the the well-known Via Veneto and nearby a big park. The rooms are on one floor of an old but well cared-for building. We stayed 5 days in July and our Double-room was in an excellent condition, no damages - everything seemed to be new. Overall the hotel gives an first-class impression and could be compared to any Four-Star-Hotel. The following should be especially emphasized: the very clean and air-conditioned room, the very friendly hotel-management by two brothers and a sister, 24h frontdesk, quick response on email and telephone requests, for italian circumstances very extensive breakfast buffet (continental). We do highly recommend this hotel for accomodation and thank for the nice days.

Reviews.Title: “my first visit to Rome”
Reviews.Author: ismet
Reviews.Content: I went to Rome with my 11 and 16 years old daughters first time on Aug 1. 2006. I booked the hotel on the internet and it seemed ok when I was booking it. When we arrived to the hotel after 45 min. taxi drive from the airport, the lobby of the hotel was hot and the clerk or the owner, Marco, was sweating without ac at the Lobby. It was a tiny room with tiny bathroom and shower. THe floor was tile and the hotel didn't provide slippers and we walked around with bear foot. I must say that cleanniness was to our satisfaction however. The breakfast room was extremely small (sitting to butt to butt) to the next table. Breakfast buffet selections was stincey it is far from being generaous as there was only one selection of cereal and it was so congested. My daughters didn't enjoyed the hotel at all, and they said that the hotels in US lot better with 2 stars as the hotel golden was two stars which costed us 110 euro per night which we found it costly. We came to conclusion that we will not go back to Rome neither any other city in Italy again as the people were not friendly yet was very expensive as well.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded It's Great Reviews!!”
Reviews.Author: NL&LA
Reviews.Content: My partner and I have just spent the last four days at the wonderful Hotel Golden on our first trip to Italy. After lengthy research of the hotels in Rome we chose the Golden based on the reviews we'd read on TripAdvisor and other sites. Situated in a safe and quiet part of the Centro Storico near the Villa Borghese and Via Veneto, we found the hotel in a prime position for experiencing the many sites Rome has to offer. The hotel is on the first floor of a lovely building and serviced by a small antique elevator (large enough for two with luggage). We found our room, and indeed, the whole hotel, to be immaculate and furnished with great attention to detail and quality. After booking on the hotel website, we were offered the opportunity to be picked up from Leonardo da Vinci airport in a chauffeured car for Euro 35. This suited us after the long haul flight from Australia and the driver obligingly drove us past many of the buildings and monuments on the way to the hotel-- a great introduction to the city! We arrived in Rome early in the morning and Marco offered to look after our bags until the room was ready. When we returned early to check in we were offered coffee and mineral water in the breakfast room while we waited. Marco's mother even brought us some grapes and a TV to watch; it was small touches such as this that made our stay so enjoyable. Our room was number 104; it was larger than we expected and beautifully furnished. The bed was comfortable, the bathroom large and modern and the airconditioning much appreciated in the summer heat. Free wireless internet was also a bonus. A continental buffet breakfast was served in the breakfast room and included bread and pastries, cured meats, boiled eggs, cereal, yoghurt, fruit and cheese. Upon check in, Marco gave us a map of the city and showed us the best walking routes to each of the major attractions. We enjoy walking and did not have to catch public transport at all during our stay; all of the attractions are 15-30 minutes walk away. He also suggested some nearby restaurants and was happy to make reservations on our behalf. We had an excellent meal at Ristorante Pizzeria San Marco on Via Sardegna on Marco's recommendation and were only sorry that we did not have the chance to dine there again! make sure to ask where the nearby underground supermarket is as it was great to buy provisions for a picnic in the Villa Borghese. Overall, we were both impressed with the extremely professional service we and our fellow guests experienced at the family-run Hotel Golden. My partner and I both work in the hospitality and catering industry and commented that we witnessed professional and personal service on a par with that in far more expensive hotels. We would like to thank Marco and his family for providing us with a great start to our Italian adventure!!

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel!”
Reviews.Author: mln5f
Reviews.Content: May 2006 - After a VERY long flight from LA to Rome (through Paris), we walked to the hotel from the train station. It was a little over a mile and not recommended if you're dragging big suitcases like we were. Even so, it wasn't difficult to find - it is one block off of Via Veneto, a very nice avenue with luxury hotels, restaurants, and shops. We ended up in the room right next to the lobby. The room itself was bigger than average and had a decently sized bathroom. The shower was one of the best we've ever experienced and we've traveled a lot. Breakfast was served every morning - it included juice, coffee, pastries, cereal, hard boiled eggs, and more. Marco was very helpful - he provided us with a map and showed us where we could find good restaurants, short cuts through the city, bus stops, and all the major tourist attractions. It's also within walking distance to the Trevi Fountain, Pantheon, Spanish Steps, and other attractions. Lastly, the hotel was right next to the Borghese Park - it is beautiful and from the Pincio, you can get a panoramic view of the entire city. We really liked the hotel and its location. The only small problem we had was that we could hear them preparing breakfast in the morning as our room was right next to the breakfast room. Otherwise, we really liked it!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliantly located Hotel Golden”
Reviews.Author: CRWHampshire_England
Reviews.Content: Centrally located, but in a quiet area, this small, family-run hotel is an excellent choice. Smart bedrooms with very well equipped modern bathrooms, a/c, good breakfast and charming, helpful staff. We will definitely be using it again and it should be top of the discerning traveller's list, when in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful place to stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in the hotel for the first week in July. Two brothers are extremely helpful during our first visit to Rome. They have arranged our trips to Pisa and Pompepi, and provided us with very useful tips to walk around the neighborhood. The hotel is very nice, clean and safe, and is close to Spanish steps and park. We have had wonderful time to stay in the hotel, and will definitely go back again when we visit Rome in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed Hotel Golden & Rome a lot!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: In the midst of this bustling city is the quiet calm of the family-run Hotel Golden. Although the rooms are small, they are elegantly furnished and more than comfortable. The family does an excellent job of taking care of the guests' needs, and the brothers who man the front desk are welcoming, helpful, and fun to talk to. As well, their mother prepares a lovely breakfast spread each morning. The Hotel Golden is in a great location, too. We were able to walk to all the spots we wanted to visit and enjoy a view of Rome's lively streets while we were exploring the neighborhood. There's so much to see and do in Rome, it exhausted us, and we were glad to come home to this little oasis each night. Thank you, Marco, for making us feel so at home in your home!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Family Owned Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dupontcircletraveler
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a trip to Italy (June 16-25) and had the pleasure of staying at the Rome Hotel Golden (84 Via Marche) 4 of the nights of our trip. The hotel is owned by a family and all the members work there which gives it a very homey feel. Marco and Guiseppe were particularly friendly and helpful both during our trip and also before the trip. I emailed with Guiseppe many times before we arrived to ask some questions and his advice about certain things and he was very fast replying back to my questions and also went out of his way for me to look for a ferry schedule since we were going to the amalfi coast for part of our trip. Both Marco and Guiseppe speak excellent English too. The rate was EXCELLENT! They had an internet special going on which is unheard of in the summer in Rome. We stayed there for 135 euros per night which included a DELICIOUS breakfast every morning of all sorts of breads, jams and spreads, pastries, yogurts, meats, cheeses, hard boiled eggs, coffee, juices, etc. My husband said the coffee was his favorite on our trip. The hotel itself is great. Its walking distance from everything (Rome is very walkable anyway). It is about 1.5 blocks from Via Veneto and just a short walk (about 10 mins) to Piazza Di Spagna (Spanish Steps), Fontana di Trevi (Trevi Fountain), and Piazza del Popolo. The other excellent thing about the hotel is that is is in a quiet area so no noise at all at night or in the morning. However, there are some really great restaurants 1-2 blocks around the hotel. We ate at San Marco which was EXCELLENT - a cute, trendy pizza/pasta winebar type place, Pomodorino (also pizza - more casual), and there was another recommendation from Marco that we didnt end up making it to called Sardegna which looked very nice. There is also a coffee bar/snack shop right on the corner. The rooms are great too. Typical Rome size (smaller) but very clean, very nice bathroom with a great shower and great water pressure (usually in europe its a trickle!). The bed was comfy and everything was very clean. We stayed in a typical room and then one night Guiseppe gave us the honeymoon suite for the same rate as our regular room. It was big and really nice too! Lastly, the hotel has free internet access at the front desk. This is great for quick emails home and also checking out restaurants or any info about sites etc. overall i would highly recommend the hotel golden and we will definitely stay there again when we are in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay at Hotel Golden in the Via Veneto area of Rome!”
Reviews.Author: mmirsky
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 4 night stay at Hotel Golden in late May. The hotel is 'as advertised' regarding all of the positive comments you will find on Trip Advisor - this was why we booked and the hotel met or exceeded our expectations. What really set the hotel apart was the friendliness and helpfulness of the staff. Guiseppe, Marco, and the rest of the family were focused on ensuring that we had a comfortable stay and they provided great advice and directions. The room was clean, comfortable and attractively decorated. The bathroom was bigger then we expected. Make sure you bring an alarm clock as the room did not have one. We found the location to be very convienent. The breakfast was more than sufficient. If you are expecting a big American breakfast of bacon and eggs you will be dissapointed. It is a more European breakfast. There was cereal, rolls, cheese, yogurts, meats, fruit, breakfast pastries, hard boiled eggs and more. We never left hungry! Hotel Golden really added to our enjoyment of Rome and we would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Golden”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel Golden for three nights and loved it. The rooms are nicely decorated, clean, nice size, fairly large bath. The breakfast each morning was wonderful, nicely presented and fresh. It was in a great location--near Via Veneto where there were lots of choices of restaurants. But the best discovery was a huge beautiful park practically across the street from the hotel. It was a wonderful way to recoup your energy after a long day of touring. It reminds me a little of Central Park in New York--just not as big. This charming small hotel is family run and they are so accommodating. Wonderful suggestions, tips, always spoke to our cab drivers every time we wanted a taxi. Great place to stay--highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Comfortable & Friendly”
Reviews.Author: heartbeat
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in the hotel for 3 nights at the end of May - having seen the reviews written by others. As normal I try to help and be constructive in comments - which are longer than most (sorry) The hotel has rooms on the 2nd floor of a building in one of the more upmarket areas of Rome. Floors above and below seem to be residential but no noise at all from either. We concur with the comments of other reviewers with regards Marco and Guiseppi who are keen to let you know how to get around and give plenty of advice. Our room was spotlessly clean, and bed confortable, and bathroom and shower great (although you get those annoying sachets of shower gel which you cant open without your teeth - bottle would have been good) Hotel is away from the main road but you probably need to keep windows shut at night to ensure you dont hear it or keep air conditioning on which was a bit noisy but worked very well - but really no problem at all. I would say however that our room was opposite the breakfast room which serves breakfast from 7.30 so if youre in one of these you will hear early morning activity - but then again you should be rousing for the day anyway. Overall we were well pleased with room - and it has a complementary safe in it - good idea. TV is in there - but you dont use it much (and CNN is really the only channel if you only understand English) As one who likes a good wholesome breakfast I found this disappointing with the smallest cereal bowls Ive ever seen. Ok if you like a light breakfast with rolls and cheese/jams etc. No toaster in sight which was a shame. Breakfast room is very small with 6 tables so early bird gets the worm as they say - but that said we went back to the room when there was a queue and then unprompted they called us when a table was free - nice touch. As for location - well its about 10 mins walk to Spanish Steps downhill and you need to work out a few shortcuts. Rest of main sights all within walking distance but probably half hour to Colosseum which is the furthest away - always take a couple of maps. Bus service is good but you need to know where to go - hotel will help where to get on (and just to say the jump on and off bus tour for Euro 13 each was great value) . We came across a quick route to the metro through supermarket under ground which would have been so much better if we had known. However, we needed the exercise. Be prepared for the walk up the hill back to the hotel - its good for you but tiring. Be like us and use the bars along the way - and on which point the bar round the corner (just across from the tobacconist) is great and friendly and nice cakes and savouries also. There are taxis of course but who needs them !! To finish let me say we really enjoyed our stay in the hotel. Its a 2 star I think but run as good as the bigger ones and the brothers take great pride in the hotel which shows. Small but as I say clean, comfortable and personal touch. I know the brothers check trip advisor every day to see whats said. They do an excellent job with one floor of a building. The price we paid was euro 480 for 3 nights which in Rome is good value. And of course Rome is a wonderful place to visit and we did feel quite safe in the hotel area. Oh one last thing - recommend you use the hotel organised taxi to/from airport - less risk and good value (35 euro each way). Airport was 40 mins away (and the journey will be an education on Italian driving).

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Golden”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Golden is an excellent hotel, perfectly appointed, clean, safe, centrally located next to lovely Via Veneto. It is a family run hotel and the owners are homely, extremely professional and very helpful for first time visitors. A great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “The Golden is OK”
Reviews.Author: TheBadRob
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Golden hotel in Rome from from 05-10 May (2006). The hotel was easy to find and convenient to everything I like to see in Rome. The rate I got for the single room I was in was better than most other hotels available. The hotel staff is great - very friendly, and english speakers as well. (most of them). The rate I got included breakfast, which is a pretty standard Euro-breakfast. Decent coffee, espresso-drinks available, breads, croissants, yoghurts some fruit, teas. all in all, not bad. But the dining room can fit only 5 or six small tables... The place is very clean and modern. Located on the 2nd floor - it's very secure. You have to walk by the front desk to get to your room. The desk person has to buzz you in to the front door for you to just get you in the building. The room I was in was small, I could touch the two walls at the same time, with my arms outstretched. I'm less than 2 meters tall. Still, since I don't come to Rome to hang out in the hotel, it worked for me, because it was clean and the bed was comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Keep it a Secret”
Reviews.Author: footballfan
Reviews.Content: We visit the hotel for three days at the end of March, and to be honest I wasn't goint to write a review, as looking at all the good reviews the hotel has it will be difficult to book next time we go to Rome! The Hotel is in a fabulous area of Rome, the rooms are spotless and the friendlyness of the fanily who run it could not be bettered. Their recommendations of places to eat and visit are also great.

Reviews.Title: “"The best stay in Italy"”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel in the centre of Rome. Although this is only a 2 star hotel its rooms are spotless and well proportioned.My wife is very particular and could not find fault with anything and we all slept sound as if we were in our own beds. Its location is great with all of the normal sights within walking distance. Both Marco and Giuseppe are very helpfull giving advice on transportation,restaurants and any queries we had. Breakfast was great and our children loved the extra decorations put out for easter. We felt very welcome and confortable and would recommend anyone to visit.

Reviews.Title: “Rome in comfort”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I would not normally use a 2 star hotel when going on a few days holiday. On this occasion because of the reviews I decided to take a chance with 'Hotel Golden'. I was not disappointed. This was a very comfortable, friendly hotel. The room was clean, well proportioned and the hotel ideally situated for a visitor to Rome. Management and staff were friendly and helpful and I will have no hesitation in recommending the hotel to friends , as well as, using it again myself.This is the first time I have written a report on any hotel visited but because of the quality of service and value for money I thought I would share this with others likely to be looking for a good hotel in Rome near the 'Spanish Steps' and 'Trevi Fountain'

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: peza999
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a weekend at the Hotel Golden and had a superb time. The rooms are small but comfortable and spotlessly clean. Breakfast is a continental buffet and beautifully presented. The Hotel is situated in a quiet street within easy walking distance to the metro lines and taxi ranks. Marco and Giuseppe are very helpful providing us with maps, directions and general information. They recommended the San Marco restaurant which was a short walk away. It was excellent food and very good value. I would highly recommend this Hotel and hope to return one day.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, Friendly place”
Reviews.Author: Paddywak1967
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Golden Hotel for a long weekend from 4-8th February 2006. Don't be put off by the fact that the hotel shares its entrance with other apartments. This is a top quality place to stay. The two brothers spoke very good English and were extremely helpful in recommending good, cheap restaurants, places to visit, transport routes, etc. They even supplied us with a map for free and highlighted everything that we needed. Other staff were equally friendly and there was always someone on hand to help. The rooms themselves were excellent. Rome was very cold at night (apparently they had a mini-heatwave the week before but it ended on the day we arrived-just our luck!)but the heating system in our room was very good and could be adjusted to suit. The room was a good size and spotlessly clean. Towels and sheets were changed daily and everything was generally of a very high quality. It felt like you were staying in a more expensive hotel. The owners and staff seem to take a pride in their hotel. Breakfast was continental but was very varied with a good variety of fresh foods and produce and certainly enough to fill you up for the morning. Next time we come to Rome we'll endeavour to return to the golden hotel. Nice location, great service and top quality rooms!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Hotel was clean and very nice. The location is just off the top of Via Vento where the surroundings are very quiet. The main sight seeing areas of Rome are within walking distance of the hotel but be prepared to walk at least 20 minutes to get to them. The only slight disappoint was the breakfast and lack of it. Although it was continental as advertised it could have been a lot better. Overall the Hotel Golden is nothing to rave about but is nice, clean and in a quiet area. If you like walking and aren't fussed about whether you have breakfast or not then it's worth a visit for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Great little hotel to stay in. We stayed over Christmas and everyone was friendly and helpful. Rooms were very nice, hotel beside the park and close to all the sites. Breakfast was nice as well.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This family-owned hotel was a pleasure to stay in. They were extremely hard working and went above and beyond in terms of making us feel welcome and introducing us to the city. Upon checking in, we were given a map and shown the locations for the main attractions, briefed on public transportation, and recommended several restaurants all of which were fantastic. As for the location of the hotel, it was in a good area with plenty of restaurants and near some of the city’s top attractions. The Metro station is not too far and it involves a nice walk down Via Veneto. The Villa Borghese is just around the corner, which is also quite lovely. We were also very pleased with our room. It was warmly decorated and quite spacious. We stayed in a double superior room, which had a large bed and bathroom and was very quiet. In fact, the hotel was fairly quiet in general. Overall, our experience at this hotel was great and helped make our first trip to Rome quite memorable. Although only a two-star hotel, the amenities were sufficient and the service unforgettable. If afforded the opportunity to return to Rome, we will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great for Family”
Reviews.Author: OzzieCritter
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from our first trip to Rome and we stayed in this Hotel on the recommendations from this site. We are a family of 4 paying 200 euro a night. I thought this was expensive until I tried to find a better price. For position, comfort and security it is good value. Our room consisted of a huge king bed and a double bed for the kids. It was a bit squashy but we've had worse. The bathroom was huge and we wanted to bring the fantastic shower home with us. It was all tastefully decorated and clean. There was plenty of breakfast, they even managed to fill up our 13 year old son. We walked everywhere, Spanish Steps are closest at 8 minutes ( a bit longer coming back up the hill). Nice restaurants nearby and quiet at night. A lovely hotel in a beautiful city.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect family run hotel”
Reviews.Author: happyherts
Reviews.Content: We have just spent 3 nights October 10th-13th at the hotel Golden. This hotel is a little gem. We booked using the web site venere and paid 460 euros for 3 nights, excellent value. (When making the reservation if you use the code AMREF your get an extra 4% of the price). The hotel is a small family run hotel consisting of about 13 rooms. The hotel is situated in a quiet location, 1 block off of the Via Veneto. The rooms are a good size and spotless. The breakfast was perfect with a good variety of food. When we arrived the owner Macro could not have made us feel any more welcome. He took the trouble to show us all the main tourist attractions, telling us the best way to reach them and many other tips. The hotel is only listed as a 2 star (which is impossible to believe). We spoke to the owner who said that the hotel is in the process of being upgraded to a 3 star for next year. This hotel is excellent value for money and I would say it would be hard to find a hotel in Rome in such a good location that would give you better value for money. We traveled to quite a few different areas of Rome and from what we saw this was the best place to be. Everywhere was in walking distance. Spanish Steps and Trevi Fountain about 10 minutes, the Vatican about 30 minutes. This hotel is only 253rd in the popularity index, but don’t be misled by that figure. I assume this is because it has only had a few reviews posted on this site. But if you consider that it has only 13 rooms this is bound to be the case. I can not recommend this hotel highly enough and would congratulate anyone that is lucky enough to pick this hotel when staying in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Golden made our first visit to Rome delightful!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After an extensive online search of rooms in Rome, my mom, sister and I decided on the Hotel Golden and could not have been more pleased. Before arriving, Giuseppe, one of the family owners, arranged for a car to pick us up at the airport, which was a relief after a long flight, and was prompt in answering any questions I had about the hotel and our reservation via e-mail. We arrived to a very gracious and discreet hotel where Marco, another member of the family, immediately made us feel welcome. Our room was spotless and tastefully decorated, not to mention quite cozy for the three of us. I must comment on the bathroom as it was very large and lovely, especially for three women. The breakfast consisted of a large assortment of foods and beverages and was great for starting our days in Rome. We found the area to be very convenient and easily accessible to the rest of the city, from what we saw it seemed to be the best area in which to stay. Marco recommended (and mapped out) several restaurants/bars that were wonderful experiences and made our vacation that much better, even going as far as making reservations for us at his favorite restaurant where we were treated like locals. I cannot say enough good things about this small hotel and accomodating family. We visited 3 other cities in Europe, paid more for larger chain hotels but this was by far the best. As someone who has travelled quite extensively, and usually enjoys the services and amenities of a larger hotel, the Hotel Golden surpassed all of our expectations and made me appreciate the delightfulness of a small, family run hotel, while still having all of the services one may need while on vacation. I strongly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Rome and sincerely thank the entire family for their hospitality and for making our stay in Rome a most enjoyable one!
